NzMAUQiPhk0YgmUBvf1EEA.text: Huge line and a lot of people ahead of us, but it went quickly. Food was great! We don't have this option in the Midwest and it was great that it lived up to the hype. I will definitely return

ezl_1zhv9A8dUAw1wB-wjw.text: Living in Hawaii, I try to eat as much In-N-Out Burger when I'm in the West Coast and Shake Shack when I'm in New York. I think the burgers at In-N-out taste really good with the veggies being fresh. I like the service too and how they ask if I want onions with the burger. I don't and I usually forget to order without onions at order burger joints. So I just remove them. The shakes are good too but i usually order the secret menu one. Over all, I think they have the best value burger with the freshest ingredients. Shakes too!

photos.caption: Photo of In-N-Out Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of In-N-Out Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of In-N-Out Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States

C8YY00QyDNCzEXPAfKB1zw.text: What else can I say? It's in-n-out my fav burger joint 100% over anything! Nice and simple menu no fuss! Animal style your burger!! The fries are the best I have ever had! It's the size of McDonald's fries but these are fresh, and Chewy, not the frozen crunchy kind.

kyPZ_m2bRrsdoRTtvfpoJg.text: Simply a great burger. They kick McDonalds ass! Order the Fries animal style.

kebFPk5O2pKASN4poGk_EA.text: Super fun location and a great late night snack. After some gambling my husband and I wanted a little something before calling it a night. This location was open til 1am so we were able to grab a burger before it closed. Perfect ending to our first night in Vegas!

g6vWDa0natTaQAfKfMPAWw.text: Stopped by for a quick cheeseburger. I have never been before and I was pleasantly surprised.  The cheeseburger was excellent, crispy bun, crunchy edges on the burger, and very fresh. The fries were good and the price was excellent. I will definitely stop by here again.

AHO11SDaLqC7w-QNBe6qAA.text: A long line and time at Thursday night 7:50 pm. But for $3.50 in Las Vegas you can find no better cheeseburger. End of story

-2hlDUhWhn65sC9esGhG5g.text: I'm a California native living in Indiana. They continue to live up to the standards of amazing food and fast serves. It was quite busy when we came in but we got or food quickly and I enjoyed food from my childhood!!   Definitely try the shake made with real ice cream!!

photos.caption: Photo of In-N-Out Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of In-N-Out Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Single burger with no tomatoes with sauce on my fires.

W0UFAkAV8tV22D7QOH3SOw.text: I was shocked how aggressively mediocre the food was. West coast people I feel sorry for you if this is what you consider to be good.

o9Zy3pabGgLNkyWAD4FHLQ.text: Being from Maine, I knew I needed to try In-N-Out while on the West Coast. Wanted to see how it compares to Five Guys. Which honestly both restaurants have their positives. Service was fast for the amount of people there. The price was also reasonable (although heard it's a little more than an average location) as it's a strip location. I got the cheeseburger combo but should have gone with the double for a more filling burger. Great quality burger and fries though. While the fries tasted better here than five guys, I'd overall say five guys is better. More customization and larger burger and fry portions. It comes very close though and will easily eat here again anytime I'm back. A must stop place to eat for any coming to the West Coast who haven't experienced it before. Fast and tasty food at a reasonable price on the strip can't be beat.

XRljj2nFO_4i8-EIfGK7fw.text: If I never had in n out before and this was my first time I would not be back.  I lived in California and ate this about twice a week. When I visit Cali the first thing I have to get is in n out.  This place did not satisfy my crave. The burgers did not taste like  the burgers that I crave. The fries didn't even taste fresh. Something is not right in this location.  I guess I will have to go to Cali to satisfy my in n out crave.

5sVvn6y3O3O4K8KVAgkbBg.text: I never write reviews but this time I needed to give my opinion. First time ever at an In-N-Out burger, so excited to try it because I had heard so many good things! The queue wasn't too long, the server was awesome - so friendly and helpful. I waited patiently for what I hoped would be an awesome burger (and animal fries of course!). Got our food and  WOW TOTAL DISAPPOINTMENT! I managed to eat less than half of my cheeseburger, hubby ate slightly more. And the animal fries - honestly the worst fries I have ever had in my life! Glad I tried it, but seriously wish I hadn't! Should went anywhere else

QJE_OUK31dLLWt2lYfqXBg.text: Ordered protein double double. Burger taste great as usual.   Long lines, very busy location.

mjY44nQhLqaiyZYsuXITZA.text: First time trying it to see if it lives up to the hype and it does! I had my burger animal style which is highly recommend by everyone. I forgot to do my fries animal style but next time I will for sure! The food came out quick and the staff was very friendly

photos.caption: Photo of In-N-Out Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States

GnHSSod1GOF8TiXS3bVpEg.text: The taste of this in n out it is not the same as California ones. The burger and fries did not taste as fresh. My bun was cold and the grill onion was not as good. So disappointed. There's was a long line but the food came out quick which might be why my food did not taste as good and bun was cold. Gave this place a 2 stars because the big place compared to in n out in California. I recommend for people who never have in n out before try it in California first and you will be able to taste the differences!

gxV7usEU8MxUB-d_kkkpOQ.text: Looking for a real fast food service along with getting hot ole fashioned hamburger. The In & Out is a Christian family company and at the bottom of the rim of their cups has a scripture. This is the place to be, service is quick and busy. The hamburgers are ole fashioned broil grilled like you like, homemade original fries! You can go wrong here with a burger and fries.

AhOTTmp3elHU81-P7KkeKQ.text: If you like burgers and you're looking for something quick to eat and an inexpensive then In-N-Out burger is the place to go. There will more than likely be a line no matter what time of day or night that you go.  But the lines moves quickly and it's worth the small wait in line. Here is a tip if you go out with someone to In-N-Out burger, one person should order the food and the other person should find a table for seating.  I loved the food but hated having to wait for a table. And try the Lemonade! I couldn't get enough of it!

YcbX5ahPmN_pJUsGUxMcTw.text: My only gripe is the speed of the drive thru. This location is probably the slowest in town. Please try to improve Drive thru speed, please!

eKQcaMYIic3cb1leCbpemA.text: Four for food, but five for location. I grew up in Southern California and enjoyed In N Out my whole life. My 14 year old son, however, had never been West of the MS. We were in Vegas for a family matter and decided to come to this location. Lines were really long and getting a seat was impossible. We had to sit outside in 100 degree weather. The food is great, but find a location further off the strip if you're able.

tg8aLTBY220OlkSO47ySSQ.text: I have never received such great hospitality from any In and out Location in my life. Terrance went above and beyond to ensure that my friends and I were well taken care of. He had something none of the other employees had. He had a constant eye for what was going on and I truly appreciate that. I could also see him directing other employees to catch things that they wouldn't otherwise have. I have no doubt in my mind that Terrance will make a great manager if he's not already one. Thank you Terrance!

-BIvMytH0BtjCe2t-Nt7wA.text: It is tucked back off the strip a little bit by the LINQ hotel, down a little ally lined with shops right by the Ferris wheel. It is a great burger and fries - extremely fresh ingredients! The menu is just burgers and fries - keeping it simple and perfect! They have a healthier option of protein style - burger comes wrapped in lettuce instead of a burger. If you haven't even eaten at an in-n-out, it is a must try, and an extremely affordable meal on the strip!

C_Nn5HDhVNXhtBkQR-C0hg.text: My first time at an In-N-Out and I honestly didn't get what all the fuss was about. Burger (Double Double) was solid - flavorful and fresh - but the fries were bad ... cold, limp, disappointing. By far Shake Shack is better in every respect.

vWqYpJCnInWAHQMySVqLVQ.text: If you are looking for an average inexpensive quick burger this is the place. If you are looking for a great burger that makes you say wow! You are in the wrong place. I have no clue where all the hype comes from. Apparently there are many people who have never eaten a good burger to be able to make a comparison. Be sure to get a double as the patties are tiny. Service was fast friendly and efficient.  Bun and fries were fresh

dqT-x0KkP9J_vkUiNZ-t7g.text: the problem is if you don't your food immediately, as in take it back to your hotel room, forget about it cold nasty animal fries and hamburger

i79ohaLHxwgMnmLB3DMnjQ.text: Probably the quickest and cheapest bite on the strip. Perfect for quick lunch but very very packed even in weekdays

WUWK1xEGro6mAjTA7eSBpA.text: Finally, the moment I've been waiting years for!!!  In and Out on the strip.  Need I say more!! Best burgers around!

EUGWh0ESpfZxQH-pZmEi6A.text: So I am native to Illinois and have wanted to hit an In and Out Burger since the first time I saw the Big Lebowski in 1998. I have studied the secret menu and been filled with tales of deliciousness from friends who went to college on the west coast or people who have visited on vacations. Unfortunately this experience fell way flat of those in my dreams. This is a pretty  standard, slightly better fast food burger place that maybe was a trail blazer but now is just one in the crowd with places like smashburger, meatheads, whataburger, 5 Guys etc... I got a double double animal style. It was fine for a late night snack. But tasted pretty much like your standard griddled double cheeseburger with thousand island like spread on it. The fries were just bad. Soggy not very salty and the melted slice of american cheese solidified quickly at my table. Unappealing and not tasty at all. The chocolate milkshake I had was the best part. Super thick and was able to withstand the heat walking back to are hotel.

LO9AqttN14nvQ73xzVED3A.text: In n out is the best! We have eaten here twice and it's always perfect. The animal style burgers and fries is the way to go.

o00-h9Fnnuqjbc_R8IF7GA.text: I had to give this a try while visiting out West after all hearing all the hype surrounding this establishment.  I just say it did not disappoint- the service was fast & friendly and the food was fresh & hot!  The line was long but moved very quickly, we didn't wait long at all to place the order.  I ordered a simple cheeseburger meal but added the special sauce to it. The best part of the sandwich was the soft and crusty buttery bun. They take the extra step to toast the inside bun which adds the perfect light crunch. The fries were good not extraordinary. I also tased the fries animal style - it was too rich and heavy for my tastes but I liked the flavor combinations of the melted cheese with special sauce with the fries.  I definitely recommend this place if you are looking for a fast food restaurant with good, quality fresh burgers.

photos.caption: Photo of In-N-Out Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of In-N-Out Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Location by the Ling on the Las Vegas strip
Photo of In-N-Out Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States

6keMANAQF5loiSaKv2xYMA.text: Being from the East Coast this place is amazing! We went during our stay in Las Vegas. We got the double double one animal style and one not animal style and then animal style fries. I must say the sauce makes the meal. Make sure to get the fries well done and get a shake. This place is always busy so be prepared to wait.

photos.caption: Photo of In-N-Out Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States

kjC--p2HdjoaKAJjBaWTgg.text: The food is great, you get it in a timely manner. The only negatives things are the long lines, and lack of space. Every business has a maximum occupancy, but this in n out does not regulate that. If you are willing to wait in line and pay, they will not turn you away. You will have to find your own accommodations to sit and eat comfortably.

Btbeo6wl8xEJ-Q4CQKO_LQ.text: We visited on a Sunday afternoon about 1:30.  Super busy and in-out does not describe the 20 minute wait.  This was our first visit.  The burgers aren't large but very tasty.  French fries were just ok.  I had a double cheeseburger and my wife had a cheeseburger and a shake. Overall it was good but we would probably pass if it was a 20minute wait. Also, this location is at the back of the Linq area.  There was no seating in-or-out of this location so we ate by a nearby fountain.  We'll go back but not on a weekend.

photos.caption: Photo of In-N-Out Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. In-N-Wait-Burger On a Sunday afternoon in April,2019

JJH778SpZo0WSNR3bvCU3w.text: Went around 10pm. Very busy (short line but longish wait to get food) and no seating. burger was extremely fresh and tasty. can't forget to mention the presentation! it was very well put together. don't forget to go animal style!!

Vu_gE9DpZ-UtZlO7IKexxw.text: Been fortunate to visit A LOT of in-N-Out restaurants but man the service and quality here was top notch. Being that it's in Vegas there were TONS of people here so you can imagine they had orders coming every second. The workers here took care of everyone and no mistakes from what I witnessed. The service was only surpassed by the quality of food. Everything I ordered came out not just hot but fresh and succulent. Because of this I visited every day I was in Vegas. Keep up the good work guys much appreciated from us travelers who can't have your food as often as we would like!

photos.caption: Photo of In-N-Out Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States

9UvuC3bzeCwkTC2ILKF6RQ.text: So glad I made it!! All ingredients extremely fresh. The beef patty is worth it. the fries were fresh and cooked perfectly. You have to be patient there was a line out the door but it is definitely worth the wait. If you have not eaten here add it to your places to eat in Vegas. I wish there was one in Indiana.

photos.caption: Photo of In-N-Out Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States

DcxjOfjjqSxzWRV4f9EPCQ.text: This was my first time EVER going to In-N-Out as an East Coaster and I found the food OK. I will say the service at this incredibly busy Las Vegas Strip location is phenomenal. The line is non-stop & never ending, but those cashiers and cooks keep things moving!   I ordered the Animal Style Fries. The fries were not the crispy, but maybe this is an In-N-Out signature. I did devour the entire tray because the sauce & caramelized onions will not stop calling your name.   I am a non-meat eater so there are basically zero options if you are looking for a veggie burger here - just FYI.

photos.caption: Photo of In-N-Out Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States

fvzW20o-NgJ8YV6FJkh0ag.text: Sooo Gooooood......So fresh, soft bun, Juicy beefs, so reasonable priced, $3.40 for a Cheese Burger, if I don't have to watch my diet, I will definitely get a Milk Shake & Fries.....

photos.caption: Photo of In-N-Out Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of In-N-Out Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of In-N-Out Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States

R1Du6sqe6OC8WEe8TEXyYA.text: I used to think y'all West Coast folks were lying about this spot, but it's ALL TRUE! Hadn't had In-N-Out since I visited LA in 2008 and Omigosh...it's 1000000 better than I remembered! I literally went five times during Memorial Day weekend lol.  Burgers are A1. So good that I was willing to smuggle 50 of them on my flight...but TSA wasn't having it bahaha. ;)   I will say that I wasn't a big fan of the fries. Both the animal style and regular style tasted like NOTHING to me...like empty potatoes if that makes sense.   Additionally, this location is pricer than others in Vegas, but I guess it's all about location.   Yum yum yum for dem burgers thoooo. Yes lawd.

qcyGmCu00BDZo53Mr4-Anw.text: One star is for the quality of food solely. The service was fast and reasonable. But the food was way too overhyped. I live on the east coast and in-n-out has been idolized by so many people. Burgers are thin, burger is majority lettuce, and sauce was soaked into the burger. I ordered the animal fries in hopes that it would balance out the regular burger but it was just as disappointing. I could never have in-n-out again, and it wouldn't make a difference for me.

iLV9Z1iyeYXk1IapcrcSWQ.text: What more is there to say. It's the best fast food in the game. The ingredients are the best the processes are refined to offer the absolute best and most consistent fast food offerings. They keep the menu small and simple. Their focus is on doing a few things great rather than focusing on every personal preference. Lines move very fast and efficiently and the food is cooked to order. This particular location is very busy and a great late night offering after a day or night of enjoying what Vegas has to offer. I am from the east coast and only get to dine at an in n out a couple times a year. It's a must try and is always a great experience.

photos.caption: Photo of In-N-Out Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 4x4 no onion.

pTDQl9k3Ot8HNfzJTCYgNg.text: I don't typically review regular chains, but if they stand out, I figured I'd write a little something. Ordered just before 12 pm with a short line. Right after we ordered, line was out the door. Burgers got the same great taste. Fries? Not so much. It didn't have the same crunch or softness to it. AND they totally skimp out on the quantity. We ordered 2. One came just enough to fill the fries bowl. The other was only half full. For those who love In-N-Out, you know they are generous with their fries. But if you're having cravings, it's nice to have an In-N-Out within walking distance (if you're near the center of the Vegas strip).

rV-6sdkd8h-LBbWwr8cdng.text: The double double with animal style fries and a Dr. Pepper is pure heaven. Fresh and delicious. Scorching hot and booming with flavor. I'm from the east coast so I couldn't wait to try In-N-Out and it definitely exceeded my expectations. Yay!!

photos.caption: Photo of In-N-Out Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States

9FPO-uGkDtdDo_Cx9xiZpQ.text: Their burgers always good as usual. Every time I travel I like to visit once time @ in n out burger depending on location that I am at. I always like animal double burgers and animal fried. Also eat with pickle pepper that you can get inside store. The bad thing about this place is they too crowded and is very hard to find table to sit.

photos.caption: Photo of In-N-Out Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Receipt
Photo of In-N-Out Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Animal burgers and animal fried

IXxRXBllyKUNqgFsL29glw.text: It's rare like never that I visit Vegas or the West Coast without eating at least one meal at In-N-Out Burger if it's in-between meals I justify it by calling it a snack either way I'm enjoying a double double. This location is like going to the concession stand at the circus on any given day but no matter the crowds or how long the wait I'm not walking past it. It's rare that I see a security guard at the entrance to a burger joint but there's one here and it appears he's sampling what he's paid to protect or at least paid to open the door for the crowds.  I don't know if this is the best fast food burger on planet earth but it rivals any I've eaten at and I think I've tried most of the most popular ones at least once. There's no doubt this is a popular walk up location and although the wait can be long the food will be served hot and fresh. The dine in area is relatively small but there are a few tables outdoors and also a concrete wall out front that some choose to take advantage of, if this is an option you chose be prepared to share with the pigeons they are very friendly and bold so protect your burger and share your fries...

8CrZzo2ltHmrmN60UAHs7Q.text: Great, fast service, fresh ingredients, bottomless drinks.... My issue is with their burgers because the meat is way too thin imo. It's tasty beef, don't get me wrong, but there's not enough of it!   I really wasn't blown out of the water like I had expected to be when I tasted their food, but it is good for a fast food chain. I still would prefer Five Guys or A&W though...   Try it for yourself, but don't have high expectations like I did! And the special sauce they put on the animal style fries is definitely what makes them "animal style".

-RYn1380XLPdJpLlCvoYWQ.text: I have heard stories and dreamed about this day.  I have finally tired In-N-Out Burger @ Las vegas   This was like dream come True.  Let me say we went on a good time where that outside temperature was 98 degrees and this restaurant had a/c and room to dine inside!  We ordered 1 cheeseburger and 1 double with fries and drinks.  Food Pro: This place rocks. Burgers were well cooked. with fresh lettuces and tomatoes. Con: I expect more on the fries. Sort of disappointed.  I live in the south and always eating McDonald and Burger king and coming to Vegas able to hit the IN-N-OUT was one of my bucket-list.  Overall: It was a dream come True. I finally made it. I have joined the In-N-Out club. I feel proud :)

xBnpI_erCXq_EjcWHidBzQ.text: This is one of the best burger places I've been to in a long time. The burgers were so good! It was crowded but we were literally in and out!

FXnm6HAvLIRsCmpfZU8iBA.text: Came here to grab a quick bite to eat on our first day in Vegas to compensate for not eating breakfast, lunch and having too much to drink on a empty stomach. Although the line was long we got through it pretty fast to place an order and even had a little time to have a small conversation with our cashier who asked us a question about our Fat Tuesday in our hands and how she never had one before.  Our number was in the latter part of the 40's and they were on their 20's. We waited around for a while to get our order as the 20's passed, 30's passed, 40's passed, 50's passed... wait what? Where is my order? I went up to the pick up counter and waited a little bit before i asked if they called 48 yet?   The lady that helped me checked the back and found my order stashed with all the other upper number of to-go bags. We walked to the Linq to meet up with my friends and ate our meal. The burger weren't even warm (The Linq is literally across the way and the temperature outside was well over 100 degrees). The fries were super cold that we didn't even touch it. This tells me that they totally forgot to call out my order number and was sitting there for a long time for.   I've experienced much better than this location but, on the good side the ordering line goes by really fast.

gQ90dIR-aICsfsdOBB6CjA.text: I love In-N-Out. Being from WA there isn't one close by so it's always nice being able to go whenever I'm in Cali. I've been to a few in Cali that were sadly disappointing. When I found out there was one in Vegas I knew I had to stop by when I was on my trip. The lines late at night can get long, yes, but they work quickly to get through it. I didn't feel like I was waiting forever in line or for my food for how busy it gets. And as far as seating goes the 3 times I was there on my trip (all at various hours in the evening) I had no problem finding a seat (both inside and out.) If you love In-N-Out and want some good cheap food check it out. Grab your food and head out to see the fountains and high roller.

photos.caption: Photo of In-N-Out Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of In-N-Out Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of In-N-Out Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States

YJcm3von7EjfH_AcyeJT8g.text: I FINALLY was able to try In-N-Out burger last night!!!! There is a new location in the Linq Promenade, located between the Linq and Flamingo hotels. It was exactly what I needed after about 7 hrs of traveling.  The Good: This is a popular place, but the line moved swiftly. The employee who took our order was very nice and happy!! It's a pleasant change from the sterotypical down-trodden fast food worker.  In order to get the real In-N-Out experience, you must google the secret menu. I ordered the Flying Dutchman with lettuce and tomato (a double cheeseburger minus the buns), Joe had a double double animal style (a double cheese burger with their sauce, onions, pickles), and an order of cheese fries lite well (fries cooked just a little longer so they are crisper with 2 slices of American cheese on top).  Oh my gosh, the food was so fresh and so delicious!!! Our meal costs $12.02. That is a STEAL for a meal for 2 in Vegas that isn't McDonald's!  Could improve:  Knowing you have to look up the secret menu for the full experience.... or else you are getting just a plain hamburger/cheeseburger.  Cleanliness in the dining area. It's not that the resturant was totally unclean, it's just that this resturant was hoppin' and there was a lot of foot traffic, and some people don't clean up after themselves. There were several employees running around and cleaning up, so they were definitley trying!  Also, some chili on those fries would have been tasty ;)  The bad: Nothing!!!  Overall: In-N-Out lived up to the hype for me, however I have learned to keep my expectations low when anything is hyped up.  I will most likely be getting food there again before I return to my In-N-Outless state if Wisconsin.

Av1G7sc80092GwcUwkE2aQ.text: Good food very fast, they were on number 24 when we got there and ordered, we were number 44, went to find a seat and grab some ketchup and napkins and our number we called, no more than 5 minutes at least. Food was great as advertised and very friendly workers. As we were 20 minutes into our meal we heard the number 44 called again, FAST FAST FAST GREAT FOOD!

eP01JZE-sKtiioIlJz9aNg.text: This is the best fast food burger I've ever had. The burger was a nice size and juicy. I also loved the taste of the animal sauce and the crispness and freshness of the veggies. Totally worth it. The double double combo is less than $9...impressive to find food of this quality for this cheap in a town with so many overpriced establishments. The chocolate shake was also very good. My only complaint is that the fries, while tasty, were a tad undercooked, hence the one star deduction. Highly recommended.

photos.caption: Photo of In-N-Out Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chocolate shake. It was a little melted here by the time I got to it, but it was still thick and good.
Photo of In-N-Out Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Double double burger
Photo of In-N-Out Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Double double burger. Amazing

sO96IGx0dwi4uy-eLye0KA.text: The burgers are great and the service was quick. My kids loved this place and it was worth the wait.

photos.caption: Photo of In-N-Out Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States

P3AnJfpoDK33sNktoKQ8Yg.text: came on a Sunday afternoon and it was packed. This was my first time at an in-n-out and I had high expectations going in. Service was great but it seemed like service was longer than normal to get the food because of the crowd. Burger reminded me of McDonald's but just better quality. Really enjoyed the animal fries.   Great spot for affordable bite where all restaurants seemed to be expensive in the area of the strip.

cdvX-FW4SBV16bXSIrHfWA.text: I would have eaten here more often, but long lines, long wait times, and nowhere to sit just really makes it absurd. I wonder how long it'll be before this place is so busy that nobody goes here anymore, but hey, it's vegas, people are used to being treated like the cattle they are in line to eat. ;-)

IuPQe0w8x7JXPhDVgLK7aA.text: Every in -N-Out I been to i always receive good customer service! This In-N-Out as well, even on New Year's Day they are working with positive and calm and a smile on their faces! Thank you !

gTmRUA27xH03X01zF5MFng.text: Conveniently at the Linq to satisfy your post day club drunchies. Sober or not, definitely a must when you're on the west coast!   Cheeseburger, well done fries - animal style. Don't forget the peppers!

photos.caption: Photo of In-N-Out Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cheeseburger, well done fries - and of course, all animal style

uIKQVzdhkKMSHuczrvPdKQ.text: This place doesn't taste as good as some of the other ones that I've had in California. The animal style burger wasn't as flavorful and the fries tasted like cardboard.

g1GSpmjB87pzeK5F6vXl2g.text: Happy there is a location on the Strip now! For a fast food burger this place is tasty & much safer than going to McDonalds by Harrah's. Don't be intimidated by the long line it moves quickly. TIP stand out OF THE WAY while you wait for your food. Gissel was nice; wonderful smile & pleasant customer service.

YLw7nkUqDRuTTK8t2TFXIg.text: Best and cheapest place to eat in vegas. Don't even need the fries. Just a double burger and you're set to go for under $5!!

photos.caption: Photo of In-N-Out Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Most perfect food and cheap for grab and go - in the area.

FZsT2dUMSHsQQ28so7MqEw.text: You can't go wrong with IN-n-Out. After hearing about this place open up recently I was wary of trying it. I assumed oh well it's on the strip it's going to be overpriced and slammed in there. Sure enough I was right about one thing. They are slammed. Surprisingly it's the same price as any other In-N-out. My boyfriend came on a Tuesday around 2 o clock this place was busy. No seats to sit inside or out but we got our food fast. Service was really great and efficient. The decor in here I love. There is a clean red and white theme with the little palm trees all over the wall and the outside is bright and neon like any good place is in Las Vegas. We got our usual two doubles with animal fries and a chocolate shake. The food was hot and fresh! My fries were nice and crispy with lots of spread. Definitely coming back to this location

photos.caption: Photo of In-N-Out Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of In-N-Out Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The walls are cute!
Photo of In-N-Out Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Neon signs ftw

yieJeE44rtzvihXmW7fgNg.text: We went here to grab something to eat that would be relatively inexpensive but filling. Eating at the hotel was really expensive. Love the burgers here because they put in a lot of lettuce and tomatoes, just like their stores in Texas.

1SqbxVjjf2gDUSx5jTZp1Q.text: I had to at least try it. I'm usually not on to visit chains during vacations or conferences for food, but I wanted to try the burger alot of the locals rave about.  I have the #1 - Double Cheeseburger combo with fries, without onions. Over, you could taste the freshness of the items, especially the bread. However, the burger was good, not as great as the locals rave. Personally, outside the bun, it tast d like Rally's/Checkers stores.  It's was good, but not good where to the point would make a special trip out of it me.

8orm8VXMoCCV4AG4fAUQoQ.text: I had heard a lot about In-N-Out Burger so I was quite eager to try it while we were in Vegas.  To be honest I was a bit skeptical as I've eaten at a lot of burger places in my life and I hear all the time about how great some shops like In-N-Out Burger are but they rarely live up to the hype.  A good burger is a pretty rare thing, a truly fantastic burger is almost unheard of in my opinion.  So one night after a night of fun in Vegas the wife and I decided to try In-N-Out Burger finally.  We arrived late in the night, after many a drinks, and stood in a pretty long line.  Thankfully the line moved very quickly so it wasn't long before it was our turn to order.  I ordered the animal style burger and some fries and the wife got the same.  After waiting about five minutes or so our order came out.  There was a lot of people in the restaurant but we were able to find a spot.    I was pretty impressed with just how truly tasty the burger looked in it's little container and the fries were very tasty looking as well.  It didn't take long before I ate a few of those and wow, they were really good!  Very crispy and not too oily. Very much like the king of fries: McDonalds.  I am not a "fry guy" so for me to like fries is almost unheard of.  Nearly everywhere aside from McDonalds I never get fries (Burger King=onion rings, Wendy's=chili, etc).  But finally it was time to actually taste the burger and I was blown away by the explosion of flavor.  The animal sauce wasn't quite like 1,000 Island or Big Mac Sauce or anything like I thought it'd taste.  It is really difficult to describe, but I will say it was delicious and I loved it.  Will definitely have to get that on the fries next time.    So to say I love In-N-Out Burger is an understatement.  The wife loved it as well.  We honestly were tempted to go back again the next night and came very close to doing so but ultimately our desire to try some new places won out.  I sort of hope they never get these in Ohio or I may end up gaining about 10 pounds a month from pigging out on their food.  A must try, I am definitely coming back here for a burger next time I'm in Vegas or any other place that has In-N-Out Burger!

PzKfcxJoNSAq8xJdUvB7Mw.text: I'm from southern California where In N Out was born and this location is a disgrace to In N Outs. All I ordered was animal fries, well done. No burgers, no shakes, just some extra crispy fries with cheese, onions and sauce on top. We patiently waited over 25 minutes before my husband went up and asked someone the status of our fries. The guy behind the counter was amused for some reason, as he laughed in my husband's face and stammered like a burn out "well, you see, the thing is... uh, there was like... a disagreement on what well done was?" What the heck does that mean?? The manager comes over and asks what's going on, and come to find out they burned my fries, threw those ones out, then just forgot about our order all together! Not ok! Took us about 45 minutes to get just one order of animal fries. The employees obviously don't care to live up to the In N Out standards.

D-arhE5Zk5izm0tmfymKxg.text: We stopped in for lunch while on the Promenade and each got a burger and split some fries. Per the reviews, we got the fries extra crispy which was a huge mistake, they looked normal but were completely overcooked and horrible. I got the sauteed onions on my burger and really liked the whole combo with the sauce. I mean, I'd definitely get this if I was craving a fast food burger and in the area. Still not sure why people say this is a must stop or even a first stop on their trips to Vegas, but overall, I'm still a fan.

leX68ieMVTFEqACDNrc7Zw.text: This place is really good. The line goes rather quickly and they got my order right. I almost got attacked by a bird here so watch out!!!

CoSnS9oaPwtBCRuh2BtM7g.text: #51 for 2018  Located in the LINQ, this is one of the largest In and Outs I've been to.  The lines were long but processed quickly.  It helps if you know what you want.  There are tables outside but nobody wanted them with temperatures over 100 degrees.  All the tables inside were occupied.  I placed the order while Gabriel stood close to the seating area ready to rush in for a table.  Not sure if the girl taking my order just came in because she was cheery as can be.  Not.  Maybe over whelmed 1st day on the job with the heat and the endless line of customers.  I'm surprised it didn't go out the door.  She took my order with some difficulty because the  noise level was so high. She did confirm my order of a 4x4, dbl dbl and animal fries. I also asked to load them up  with everything especially the fried onions.  I then walked over to the other side of the seating area.  This way we had both sides covered hoping we would get seats soon.  Then It happened.  A table vacated and I swooped in before the last person got out placing my rightful clam on the table.  Gabriel came over sat down while I loaded up on napkins, ketchup and those delicious hot peppers.  I was proud to have this moment with Gabriel, my son.  Having his 1st 4x4 and animal fries.  I wasn't sure if he'd be able to eat it all.  I know I can't that's why I just had a dbl dbl.  Well,  he did finish it all proving he is a carnivore.    Something about the taste of these burgers just keeps everyone coming back.  Clean, pure and feels healthy with the tomatoes and lettuce.  It's how I would make it at home but not as good.  Well, you don't have to go off the strip any more to get your secret menu craving.

photos.caption: Photo of In-N-Out Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 4x4 and a dbl dbl with animal fries
Photo of In-N-Out Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of In-N-Out Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States

ArQ6xBwWkypg-sGtcMJ47A.text: This is as good as a 4$ fast food burger gets. We dropped by for a quick meal (it's hard to come up with a reservation for a party of 20 last minute).   And since everyone was hungry and this was the closest establishment, we went in for a quick snack. I went in with low expectations,m. I guess I should also disclose that I avoid fast food joints like the plague.   However, the service was fast and polite. The burgers were hot and well cooked/seasoned. Overall, not too bad for 4$. Heck, probably the best burger for 4$.   Lastly, will still continue to avoid fast food joints like the plague. This was a one time thing. Lol.

JbblhZXAjwvUeagCt9irGw.text: Food here is a bit more expensive (about 15% more) than In N Outs we go to in California and I assume it is a LV Strip surcharge.   I got take out food our usual double double and a cheeseburger both with onions plus animal fries to take to our hotel room and although the food was cooling was still good.   Lines and crowds on a Sunday evening looked daunting but the wait was surprisingly short less than expected anyway.  As I've written in some of my In N Out reviews - the first time I had one of their burgers over twenty years ago I thought it was the best thing ever but since then the experience has varied and it's never been quite as good as that first time (maybe it never was quite that good and it's just a rose colored nostalgic memory :-).  Come to think of it - a recent burger I had at Holstein's at the Cosmopolitan (Rising Sun burger) was probably the best burger I've ever had at a restaurant but then that was 18.50 and a double double at this In N Out was 4.45 so can't really compare fairly.

biz6MMPzqAD0QBKx0HL5ow.text: I've been enjoying In N Out since I was a child and we could only have it when vacationing in California.  Now they are all over Las Vegas and this one in particular is one of the best.  It's clean, friendly and easy to get to for locals and tourists.    We got to enjoy this while coming down to the Linq to enjoy a ride on the High Roller.    We got regular cheeseburgers, a protein burger (wrapped in lettuce), fries, iced tea and a shake.

photos.caption: Photo of In-N-Out Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of In-N-Out Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of In-N-Out Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States

bm4qUbltwGhkwzp97cN9SA.text: I love In and Out, but don't get a chance to visit often because they don't have a franchise in my state. This place is busy, but don't let the line out the door deter you! When we arrived, the line was well outside the door, but we only ended up waiting about 15 minutes total time from when we got in line to when we received our food. They are used to big crowds and the staff is well prepared. The bigger trick is finding a table if you're planning on eating at the restaurant. What we found most people doing was having one person stay in line to order and the other start scouting out seating. A table will open up, you just need to be patient. The food was excellent, as usual. We got double-doubles and fries "animal style," trust me, having the fries "animal style" is a must. The next time I'm in Vegas, you can bet I'll be back!

gG0kNfTsLUf6H09G5X0pmg.text: The food at this location is consistent with every other location on the west coast. The only downside is, this location is very dirty. Yes, it is located on the strip so you'd almost expect it to be dirty.. but they could do better with the upkeep of this location. Also, apparently non service dogs are allowed inside? I'd prefer to not have a dog sitting next to me while trying to eat.

photos.caption: Photo of In-N-Out Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dog hanging out inside the restaurant
Photo of In-N-Out Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Protein Style, Double Double, Regular &amp; Animal Fries

pudSr0-fTpFreFvWZVGDWg.text: We stumbled into this place early in the morning for food when the nearby breakfast buffet at the Flamingo had over an hour wait in line.  I was greeted by a homeless man exiting with his fly down and his junk exposed.  The staff was super busy, the location was packed at 10:00 am, and there was trash on the tables, overflowing from the bins, and food crumbs on the floor.  My first thought was that I had made a huge mistake.  Well, it wasn't as bad as expected as the staff got to work and quickly got things under control.  We eventually found a table that was semi-clean for our food and snarfed it down before departing the place to clean up.  Would repeat again only if hung over.

GM3liNhSD7NaJF8F_Mm0-Q.text: Location/Service - Along the Las Vegas Strip, there's a big sign pointing towards it - so not hard to miss - Restaurant is relatively big, but it is super packed since it's in the heart of the city - Line ups go out the door, but they have a pretty good logistic system that makes it go pretty quick - Staff are nice and friendly when taking orders. Also, they don't panic, remain calm despite being it very busy and heavy with traffic  Food - Ordered a regular hamburger and french fries (classic item) as it was my first time - Overall, it's a pretty plain, simple burger - Patty was done well, a little dry, but it didn't give me any 'wow' factor at all - Cheese and lettuce compliment well - Burger size standard size (around a hand palm) - Fries are pretty regular as well, not much with a 'wow' factor as well  I'm not entirely sure what's the overall hype is for In-n-Out. Price value wise it's very cheap (~$6). I guess for a quick snack or late night food, it might be quite comforting. But I would prefer Shake Shack more than this.

photos.caption: Photo of In-N-Out Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Busy line! Out of the restaurant!
Photo of In-N-Out Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Regular Cheeseburger + Fries

uvMLIVbx0VWBcwq86Dwi5A.text: The burgers here were very hot and fresh. Loaded up with ingredients, not a slimy burger. There was a good toast on the bun. It's a great option for a meal on the strip under $10. The atmosphere is also very family friendly and fun!

GwoTEg81F3HlSFizZCuG7Q.text: Not sure what all the hype is all about.  It's a burger.  You get your choice of cheese or no, onions or no.  Add fries and a drink for a combo, but don't expect a savings.  Its the same price if you order ala carte.  We got a cheese burger combo and added an extra burger for me.  The burger and bun were very dry. The special sauce did nothing to add flavor or moisture.  The order of fries was enough to share.  This would have been great, if the fries were good.  The  fries were dry and tasted like dehydrated potatoes.  Between the two of us, we only ate half of the order and it was not because we were full. Looking around, we were not the only ones who did not care for the fries.  Every table we saw has a half eaten basket left on the table.

photos.caption: Photo of In-N-Out Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of In-N-Out Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Such a long line at 11:30 pm!

GGUGrfeqqAEtxYpIBNjD4Q.text: I love coming to this In-N-Out but the service I got today from Ranae was just horrible. No positive attitude, doesn't even acknowledge you are there, doesn't ask if it's to go or dine in... Just miserable.  I'm sorry but In-N-Out service today was just horrible.  If she could atleast smile it would've made it somewhat better but she was very serious the whole time.

ktKwyWQiwnlsISkPfShvEw.text: I know so many people who just don't like In N Out. I get it, not everyone has to be a fan. But what I don't understand is what's not to like??? I mean its probably the freshest, fast food burger chain in the west coast. I get that so many people may hype up things for you, but its always good. I've never had In N Out and be disappointed. For me its nostalgic, coming in with my family and having a good meal and times.   So if you don't already know, yes there is a secret menu. What I have discovered is that it really isn't a secret anymore. If you don't know its because you probably moved from out of town and don't know how it works or you're just lame... jk. I remember how I reacted my first time I saw someone eat animal style fries(fries covered in melted cheese, house spread, and grilled onions.) AMAZING! Must try if you've never had them. You can pretty much order the burgers or fries to your liking, temperature, style, add ons, etc.   I remember ordering the 4x4 and just not being able to complete my fries and drink. It was quite a mouth full. For me its the #1, Double Double with onions and add pickles. This is what its all about. I love you In N Out. Never stop being you.

XTB6s7Hv0VdyKwWECEbL8A.text: This was my second time at In-N-Out, and first time ordering off of the secret menu. Unpopular opinion, but I'm not a fan of In-N-Out. After hearing so much praise about it (especially that it was comparable to Shake Shack) I had such high expectations for it, which weren't met at all! The fries are so unbearably dry. I thought the sauce from the Animal Style fries would help, but I personally don't like the chipotle mayonnaise/ onion taste. The burger is fine, but also on the drier side. The shake doesn't have any texture! Overall disliked the food, but I did like the cheap price point and atmosphere of this location, especially with the outdoor seating. I would compare In-N-Out to a McDonald's or Burger King.

photos.caption: Photo of In-N-Out Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Two orders of Animal Style fries, three orders of Double Cheese burgers &amp; Half vanilla half strawberry milkshake
Photo of In-N-Out Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Outside In-N-Out Burger

v2GbhroXvaFN9WJ8rWTaPw.text: There isn't much to say about this place except that it is very over hyped. For fast food, the food is great and hits the spot for any burger cravings you might have. Considering this is a busy location on the strip, service was relatively quick. Definitely don't skip out on the animal sauce with your fries! All in all, if you're in the mood for fast food, in n out is the place to be.

RL7LBIGJMWWyZXPfjTI2jQ.text: Super efficient and excellent fast food. In n out is everything I heard about in the east and more. Animal style is the way to go. This branch is surprisingly well organized despite being over crowded due to its location on the strip.

2CCyPZa-D1Ms4DIGXq_4jg.text: The last time I visited the west coast I wasn't able to visit this place but I made it my mission to this time. While waiting for check-in I decided to grab a bite to eat because I was starving from traveling.  I walked in and there was a long line which is expected, however, it went by quickly. I ordered the cheeseburger and fries with a drink. I believe it came to $8 which wasn't bad.  So as I receive my food, I was lucky enough to find a seat on the patio because it was crowded. The first bite I take was the French fries and they were very crispy. I thought it was a couple but no it was 80% of my fries. I don't know if that's what it was supposed to be like but I didn't have the patience to wait in line for a new batch. I then took a bite in the burger and it was pretty good. Very fresh. Overall I guess my expectations were too high and I was slightly disappointed. It was average to me.

photos.caption: Photo of In-N-Out Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of In-N-Out Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States

WXqbCJ7IKXprVJxOvN14lw.text: Everyone treats In-N-Out like Tom Brady, they say how it's not that good and so and so is better. But when it really comes down to it, they are just jealous that these burgers are consistently so good.     I bet most of people are closet In-And-Out burger lovers.   A few days ago, I paid three times the price for a famous chef's burger. Sure it was a half pound of perfectly cooked, hand-massaged beef, but it didn't invoke the visceral pleasure that these guys do. They are just great everytime you have one!!  Like Seth MacFarlane says "There is no doubt Eeeeeaat Innnnn Nnnnnn Ouuuuuut"

Ew5jpUAV3H3sf72WmpiDSA.text: In-N-Out really compliments their name 110%. The work station was straight up hustlin from the cashiers, to the cooks, to the person that calls out everybody's order (keep in mind it's usually only one person... and they are very efficient). Super fast coming in and out of this place, just like how I felt my vacation trip to Vegas was...  Anyways, the burgers aren't bad. I mean what do you expect from a fast food restaurant? To find something as cheap and good as this on the strip is definitely a win-win. Single burgers are a little under 4$, while doubles are a little under 5$.  There is also a secret option that is not so secret anymore. I heard a lot of people mention "animal style" which is some special sauce with fried onions and cheese. You're able to add this with your burger or your fries. To be honest, I didn't think that it was all that. I was thinking gains... try it tho before you stick to the yummy basic order menu

photos.caption: Photo of In-N-Out Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Animal style burger and fries

MhE4pI0JxNwy_gUXeZafxA.text: This is what I craved -cheeseburger with grilled onions, fries and a Neapolitan shake. And of course it tasted fantastic! Right off the strip, inexpensive and great food - you can't beat that! The line to order was fairly short, but when I got my receipt, I realized I was number 74 and they mere merely in number 31. Great, I thought. But the wait really wasn't bad, less than 10 minutes. There were no tables open inside but I sat by the fountain that is right outside so I didn't mind. The seating situation is the reason for the 4 stars as it is clear that small of a space won't seat enough guests. Otherwise I would have given it 5 stars because I love the food. If you are on a budget and crave a good burger, this is a good place to get your fix.

photos.caption: Photo of In-N-Out Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of In-N-Out Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of In-N-Out Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Xl2pIMrWMVRM6BWGXPNNig.text: I've eaten at In-N-Out Burger before when I was in Las Vegas (required me to drive from my Strip hotel) but this location is the first (and currently only) In-N-Out located on the Strip. It opened somewhat recently (less than 1 month ago). People are always comparing In-N-Out (West Coast) with Shake Shack (East Coast) and now that In-N-Out is located on the Strip, people can enjoy both while strolling on the Strip.  This In-N-Out is located in the Linq Promenade area.  When I went in, I was immediately greeted by people behind the cash register. I wasn't sure what I wanted yet so I didn't line up. After I quickly looked at the items advertised above the cash register and decided to get a double burger combo. The prices seemed higher than "normal" but I would assume that it is because it is on the Strip. I asked for the animal style fries (which isn't shown on the menu on the top of the cash register). I was handed a cup so went to the soft drink dispenser to get my drink. I opted for Dr. Pepper since they didn't have the soft drink that I normally prefer which is Coke Zero. After a few minutes, they called out my number and I went to get my tray.  Even though there wasn't much of a line-up to order, the sit-in area was almost completely filled. I managed to get a seat when someone left. Cellphone reception was somewhat spotty inside the restaurant (I'm with T-Mobile) but the restaurant did have free wireless so I was able to update my status of Facebook as well as include pictures of my meal on social media.  When I finished my meal, I went to refill my drink and asked where the washroom/toilette was in the place and one of the employees informed me that there wasn't one inside the restaurant and I had to either go inside the casino or go to the public washroom within the Linq Promenade. Not knowing where the public washroom is within the Linq Promenade was located, I opted to walk to the casino to use the washroom and wash my hands since my burger was messy (but delicious).  Them not having a washroom inside the restaurant and their prices being higher than "normal" are the reasons why I gave them 4 stars instead of 5 stars.

photos.caption: Photo of In-N-Out Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. My double burger combo with animal style fries.
Photo of In-N-Out Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Counter area of In-N-Out

P6roEHOf1UAXmMvI4LfUVg.text: The late 1940s saw the birth of two icons. In 1946, the first Las Vegas Strip mega resort the Flamingo opened. Two years later the First In N Out opened in 1948. Fast forward 71 years after the first Strip mega resort & 69 years after the first In N Out there was finally a link connecting the two icons. This link is spelled Linq. A couple of weeks ago, the Linq made headlines when this location opened as the very first In N Out on the Las Vegas Strip.     The first In N Out on the Strip is drawing in the crowds. And the demand is exceeding supply. The famous red, white, & yellow colors adorn a an average size eatery. During peak times there are insufficient  booths and patio tables. This was the case last time when I left disappointed. In hindsight I could of ordered to go then walked nearby to the Wildlife Habitat to have an In N Out picnic in the company of flamingos, ducks, and exotic birds.     The next week it was a different situation. On a rainy day we experienced the sunshine of In N Out when startlingly there were vacant booths. In N Out is fast food sunshine on a cloudy day & anyday. I have yet to see a gloomy employee in their restaurants. During the grand opening era, employees opened and closed the door for me. Now if I needed to use a restroom they would open and close the door for me because there are no restrooms leaving me  to use the public  one in the Linq. Across from the door in the open kitchen there were at least 29 employees greeting customers and creating the food.     Comparable to all In N Outs ordering is done with ease. The menu features 3 burger items that include lettuce, tomato, onions, & a thousand island style sauce. They are also offered as combos that include a medium Coke beverage and fries. The prices are higher than the other locations yet a bargain for the Strip. My cheeseburger combo came to less than $10 around the price of a beer on the Strip. It was $ well spent. Contrary to its namesake the food is never "In N Out" of a microwave or fryer. It was freshly made from the time of order causing a good few minutes of anticipation. The In N Out sunshine that permeated the delicious burger & fries was worth it.      In conclusion I anticipate a perpetual extraordinary busy In N Out. I foresee patronizing the local In N Out and leaving the a booth for the out of towner that craves In N Out. Now if there are a few available tables, there will be one for this local when he is craving In N Out.

photos.caption: Photo of In-N-Out Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The very first In N Out Burger of the Las Vegas Strip.
Photo of In-N-Out Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Burger that you might as well call the King of the Strip burger. This is the combo with fries.
Photo of In-N-Out Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Talk about customer service. Look at all the people behind the counter.

bGJ4DySYtzOSJj8PB9Rbcw.text: Juicy burgers need no comments! Quick service and friendly staff. Fries a bit salty for my taste, will ask for salt free next time. You get to sit outside with fountains in your view. Love the fact that they offer unsweetened lemon tea besides soda options. Will recommend to anyone in town for a quick bite!

hZ-7B5m08ye5z86Xp4pd_g.text: Not a review on the service (it was great! Quick and thorough), but the food overall. I don't have any In-n-Out in the Midwest, so I was excited to finally try this burger place and see what the hype was all about. Its... very average. I didn't feel like the food lived up to all the hype I've heard. The food was good, just not amazing. Good place to grab some good burgers.

oQDZlOOa2QTKwV52jSfiTg.text: It is GD In N Out and they are finally on the strip!!! I came from a thousand dollar dinner at e by Jose Andres and this is still good!!! GET IT!!!!!!  This was the freshest, hottest and tastiest double-double animal style I have ever had! Better try it before the line is around the block!

qxJq0tPaHpOCJDnr5usyuA.text: Great burger. Lives up to its hype with the succulent double-double cheeseburger. This was my second time at an In-N-Out and I was not disappointed. The burger is juicy, consisted, and feels of quality despite this being categorized as fast-food. One thing is I tried to like the 'animal style' fries (ordered it two times now), but it is not good and a bit overrated. The price of the animal fries are about the same as a double-double and does not satisfy me. The dressing makes it soggy and sticky and I generally prefer the regular cut fries to be able to add to my burger or add on ketchup to it. Ordering the animal fries also added an additional 12-15 minute of wait for me which was a bit annoying.   In-N-Out is great and hope it makes it out to the Midwest in the future!

photos.caption: Photo of In-N-Out Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Yum! Double Double (5/5)
Photo of In-N-Out Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States

yDjTf1osFrI9CVnkFKvrQA.text: YASSS!!  This was the best find of the night! We landed really late and were scouring the strip for food. We had to resist the urge to run in when we saw this ON THE STRIP. This location is really new and just opened a few days ago.   I ordered a double double with grilled onions, animal style fries (gotta have that) and a Neapolitan shake. Delicious!    Sorry Shake Shack, In-N-Out will always win in my book!

photos.caption: Photo of In-N-Out Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. These make me so happy
Photo of In-N-Out Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Two double doubles with animal style fries

SdIO3IfSPTA_Ci5rSV92SA.text: Worst service ever. If hungry, I would skip. The wait staff will mess up your order, then act like they didn't hear you. Very big disappointment.

5YuzyfUSEEGIsvlE9D0nxg.text: I'm giving In-N-Out Burger 4-stars because it does what it's supposed to do - provides good burgers and fries.  But I've been to at least three In-N-Outs now in my lifetime (I live in Indiana, so we don't have them) and I still don't understand what all the fuss is about.  It's certainly better than McDonalds, but it's basically the same level as a Five Guys or a Steak n Shake.  Higher end (but not quite gourmet) burger places.  I almost gave it a 3-star just because it doesn't meet the hype level everyone places on it, but that seems unfair.  If you want a great burger, go here.  If you need to do it because you've always heard about it, go here.  But don't make the trip because you expect some mecca of burgers - you'll be disappointed!

uP12pNjgXWIjJuL6b4Ha5w.text: Finally, the real reason people come to Las Vegas has a location that doesn't require a car. Right off the strip in the somewhat new strip of restaurants is a large location of this pilgrimage-worthy burger joint with a nice large outside too. The line can be long due to all the tourists but it does move quickly.

oMDY_EC1aWBCqqlYKtL6pg.text: As always an excellent experience. I ordered the double double animal style, fries and a chocolate shake. Then sat outside, watched Vegas's area of crazy people walk by and savored my meal.  A great chance to get my California groove on. Living in the Midwest I miss getting my fix of In-n-Out burgers.

photos.caption: Photo of In-N-Out Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of In-N-Out Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. As always an excellent experience.
Photo of In-N-Out Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mmmmm!

OIejtNr6eQQBANKa-YwaZw.text: Get outta here shake shack...   Even as a California native in Vegas, I still had to get a double double with whole grilled onions, with a side of light well done fries. This location was a little bit pricier than at the regular CA chains, but nowhere near what you'd pay at that God forbidden shake shack.   It was really interesting to see tourists from all over the country and the world try In n Out for the first time. You could tell from their expressions and how empty their tables were that they enjoyed this California staple.   Just FYI: There are no restrooms located inside this establishment.

eHi3pDTuRURpwwxPaz8jPA.text: Easy enough to get to from the highway.  Stopped here on my way home from Vegas.  Place was packed but moved fast.  Normal great in n out food.  Attached to a merchandise store so lost of space to park and eat.

photos.caption: Photo of In-N-Out Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States

YF-ALZHnOvuhk5GlHDDzEA.text: This place is a well oiled machine.  We already know how good the food is, but to handle a non-stop crowd of drunk Vegas tourists is impressive.  We went twice on our recent trip, and both times the line moved incredibly smooth and the food was ready to go incredibly quickly for how busy the place was.  A great option to save a little cash too while in Vegas.

yYzSr9s5T87Yib_uKIXu6w.text: You can't give a fast food burger place anything higher than three stars, but it is way better than a McDonalds. The food was good for what it was. Hard to find a seat.

Rb8-aq3TAsHk2zgzjsEN-w.text: Wanna eat in Vegas quick and cheap this is the play for you. Good food, super quick, filling and will last you a while.   Also doesnt want a finger and toe like some of the other places near the flamingo where I am staying.  Suuuper nice that's its so easy to get a meal here

RXuE9cEosAmPmWPJ4FhEQA.text: As if In-N-Out Burger wasn't a busy spot to begin with outside of Vegas...put it on the strip and multiply that by 10. Soooo worth it though. Can never go wrong with an In-N-Out burger. What can I say that hasn't been said at other In-N-Out spots I've been to. Great burgers, great service. Definitely outdoes any burger spot on the East Coast....maybe Smashburger comes a decent second place now. Either way, I can NOT take a trip to the west coast without having an In-N-Out burger.

FxV3ltZcrty5Gp6hoRTAZg.text: It's a good burger and was reasonable priced (especially for food on the strip). I got the cheeseburger and fries. It was good and I would go back.

xBhu6P6pqrD0bivgBfPdnw.text: Being an east coast foodie makes you wonder about different restaurants on the west. In-N-Out is one of those, I was excited to try it and I was expecting way too much. The menu is very simple, the burgers are steak burgers which are small. Overall the meal was good for a quick bite on a busy day.

VvnRbYCwyo_coJ8826MkPw.text: I'm from the East coast, we have a ton of places here that try so very hard to be In-N-Out and just don't do the job.  This isn't my first time at one, but it definitely has been a while.  This location is in the Linq Promenade.  It's terribly busy.  That's why I gave it 3 Stars.  Just sheer busyness makes it a bit annoying.  The food as always is top notch.  The burgers are delicious and the fries are as always very good.  Getting a seat is a bit of a chore.  Also, once you order, however long it took you to get to the register, double that time waiting for your food.  It is what it is, but honestly it's a good bargain for the Strip and a tasty meal.

aa_mBwD8UaP3ms3MULEHww.text: Fresh ingredients great flavor.   It was loud, super busy, hard to get a table yet it was all worth it.

Fi0k0220rPjTXlotxzwBdA.text: Busy place! Definitely glad I finally had the chance to eat at one. Burger was tasty & fresh. Prices were cheap! Too bad they don't have these on the east coast!

photos.caption: Photo of In-N-Out Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Cxudp2_q5j86miTgi4BxVA.text: Comfort food with a comforting price!  Made to order quick bites is just what you need if you are on the go.  Burgers always filled with crisp lettuce, and a firm slice of tomato...topped off with their secret relish, you cannot go wrong with this combination.  Don't forget your order of fries as well.

C9xcZx8M7gM7lI0E9v8Ugw.text: Great price ! Awesome food ! IN and Out burger  last night at the linq ! Vegas trip is awesome ! ANIMAL Style baby! Juicy fresh beef smothered in that delicious sauce!  I can see why people line up! Not the best burger in the world put pretty friggen good for the price ! $4.5o for a double double ! The combination of great quality and great value brings the crowds in.  And those little peppers ! Bomb dot com!

photos.caption: Photo of In-N-Out Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Azh8sNBUvisIOyRCITQIfg.text: I love In-N-Out in general, and this one is no different. It's busy but they get your order to you fast. There are seats both inside and out, just look for a place to sit while you are waiting on your order. Burgers are exceptional and fresh. Nice to have an In-N-Out Burger so conveniently located.

OTr9nsbfobYOAITrFInVzw.text: Not only are the burgers and fries incredibly fresh, the staff here do an excellent job in maintaining the restaurant.  They had people always moving around doing stuff, like cleaning the windows, wiping down surfaces, helping people throw out trash, etc.  It was really busy when we came in, but we just asked to share a table with someone and they were totally cool with it.  We ordered two #2s, but after reading some of these other yelp comments, I think we might have missed out on some of the secret menu stuff.

photos.caption: Photo of In-N-Out Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Two #2s
Photo of In-N-Out Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Two #2s close up

JY6MY69thvGwSc_C-C_gJw.text: Amazing staff, amazing service, excellent experience. I placed an order and there was a minor thing left out. The staff, Itzel, Angel, and the white dude went above and beyond to make sure everything was perfect. Restaurant is spotless despite the amount of foot traffic it gets. Absolutely awesome management of a great restaurant. Thanks!

BbnL_hMgWsv4Gl59qEZDvQ.text: I finally got to experience the hype of In-N-Out Burger on a recent trip to Vegas.  This location is conveniently located next to the High Roller and it packed no matter what time you go in.  The staff does an excellent job of getting orders and dishing them out at a pretty rapid fire pace.    I ended up trying the classic burger with cheese and some fries.  I was not disappointed and it beats any of the burgers you'd get at the usual fast food joints.  I enjoyed my experience and wish they'd expand out to the east coast.  Maybe one day!

RGBvUUKcqwzCvnOI90G7uA.text: Very good. Line out the door but moved fast. Was lucky enough to find seating.  Cute shop out front to get a Vegas in-n-out shirt

photos.caption: Photo of In-N-Out Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States

JTTTOMIn7XvVmG18y0hkGg.text: It's In-N-Out! How could you go wrong? The line was out the door and yet it moved very quickly. Upon arriving, it looked like chaos, but the line was filed through, orders were taken and turned out in a very organized manner. Kudos to the staff for handling the crazy volume of customers!

OwSoFsVCxLlZ7PZl68E5Bg.text: This is my first time coming to an in and out burger and I really enjoyed it. Very fast service for being pretty busy and the food was great. Wish there was more seating inside had to sit outside while the birds attempted to eat our food.

RZLGVZD0rRt-twR-Bh5hpQ.text: Your typical In-N-Out. I live in the Midwest so whenever I come to the West Coast I try to get my fix in. I saw last October when I was in Vegas that they were opening one on the Strip, in the Linq/High Roller area, so I was very excited about that.  I was looking for more of a snack today, so the only thing I got was a hamburger, animal style. I love that they marinate it in extra sauce when you ask for that and they also add chopped onions on top. The hamburger was delicious and I wish we had this chain closer to me.  This location does lose one star for me because it didn't have any bathrooms, as far as I could tell. I had to backtrack to the Linq and find a bathroom to use after my meal, instead. Also, they need more seating, I was lucky to get a booth but a lot of people were eating outside due to the lack of seating inside.  That being said, In-N-Out is delicious and my burger was very good.

photos.caption: Photo of In-N-Out Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hamburger, animal style

de75uVMLELuwdFtlfm84qw.text: I'm from North Carolina where there are no In-N-Out Burgers. People from the left side hype this place up. "Can't wait to go home and stop by in and out". I thought this was going to be comparable to Five Guys and I thought wrong. This was a McDonald'sesque burger quality establishment with maybe 25% more real beef in the burger than McD. Cute concept and decent service, but I was expecting so much more. Do not get suckered into thinking that this is something great. As a matter of fact, skip it. Sorry In-N-Out, you're a victim of high expectations that you didn't set.

8_TCmGWqIETF16lxenw3UA.text: Had our best service ever tonight. No wait at least an hour long wait. Food is always great people are friendly plenty of places to sit. Make a regular of going to in N out Burger when in town.

lvu30P9otKnus-s14uzmtw.text: Service was quick. As clean as it could be for so many patrons coming in and out of this very busy restaurant at a hot location on the strip. Good prices. Decent customer service. Bad cell reception and no bathroom in house but one right across the way. Would visit again for sure.

FEJ4x4VE8osIskGExza8cw.text: I have not had a chance to eat a burger at In- Out since I lived in California! The burger is good, but as far as flavor goes I would take 5Guys or Shake Shack. The fries are excellent but you need to hurry and eat them before they cool down. Shake are also excellent.

XLT7zapZoSXJHxtAAMOg1g.text: Food was standard in-n-out fare. Much more delicious burgers to be found around vegas such as shake shake, Gordon Ramsay burger, and more.

83NN-nLZT3brVwRaeLwR7Q.text: The best burgers and chips in town. food was fresh. It was worth the wait the long lines do move fast

wuYFTAuAZS5jGNAoSbtOgQ.text: Busiest In n Out I've ever seen!  Beside, all of them are busy. It's crazy!!  Wish they'll come to Florida!!!!  My favorite Burger!  Everything about it is so amazing!  The way they work and the way it taste!  Love the burgers love the fries.  Just cant go wrong w in n out!  LOVE IT!

photos.caption: Photo of In-N-Out Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States

a7hx5e-QxRiTCpDA4CngrA.text: I've heard about these burgers and had to see for myself what I was missing. I have to say I absolutely loved as I bit into a tasty roasted bun, felt the cold and totally delicious tomato on my tongue, then made it into the crunchy pile of lettuce. So far I totally got the appeal. Then I just never really tasted the burger or cheese. I looked around for the burger flavor and it just blended into or was overshadowed by the rest of the sandwich. Now, I absolutely loved the rest of the sandwich, but I am a burger fan and wanted to taste the burger. The fries were very bland snd I didn't sense any real flavor from the potato. I did get the salt, but it didn't help the flavor profile.   I did find the service to be good, and liked the atmosphere. It was crowded, but I found the end of a table and shared it with strangers. Had fun sharing travel stories while we ate. Awesome!

U6hCd82s1EEGoOT_dwtxAA.text: Usually I am a fan of In N Out, but the experience at this location was just mediocre at best.  I ordered the double double animal style and something about it just didn't taste like it normally does. Not sure if it was an off night, but it was just lacking something this time.  The speed is still quick and friendly as they do know how to be efficient.  I had to stop by the pizza place next door to satisfy my hunger.

Qo-yAU1NAJu8c7jFJipPxw.text: This is where you find #burgerheaven for our blessings #hereonearth ... so grateful for @innout #burgers (protein style for my #glutenproblems ) and if there is one #whereveriam I will make my way to one of them ~ proud addict since 2008.  When in #Vegas, we all know to #gobigorgohome ... I bet high on the #innout 3x3 or THE #tripletriple  and #proteinstyle for the best #glutenfreeoption ... made of three 100% American beef patties, hand-leafed lettuce, spread, three slices of #americancheese with raw onions, tomato, pickles, chopped hot peppers stacked high and all wrapped in hand-leafed lettuce .... #dropmic!  #AnimalStyle #Fries. For many fans {which definitely includes ME!!!}, no In-N-Out meal is complete without them. #animalstylefries are perfectly made with melted cheese, #grilledonions and secret spread sauce drizzled all over #goldenfries ... it's a top #gultypleasure!   It is a busy and friendly atmosphere in the heart of the Las Vegas strip!

uvb1XINxd4ZHVqxbStgJ2Q.text: The burger was good and the fries were decent. The milkshake was off the charts. I forgot to ask for the "animal style" so I will have to go back. Be prepared to eat by the fountain, because the seats were packed.  Considering the location, this meal was a bargain.
