WW95_qsndTDfVloZcGve8A.text: This In-N-Out was definitely busy. But then again what on the Strip is not busy? They were very fast at getting people through and the order was made right and done well. The burgers tasted amazing and were very fresh. In-N-Out burgers I would say are the best out of all the fast food burger places hands down. If you want a bite to eat that won't bankrupt you on the Strip then this is the place to go.

photos.caption: Photo of In-N-Out Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States

wtesOGavJtgKkiNHZhcFFQ.text: I don't care if people don't love In-N-Out.  This was my first time having it this June and I swear it's the best thing I ate in Vegas the whole time I was there.  The cheese is melty but stays thick.  The burger is not excessively greasy.  The bun has a nice toast to it.  They got through a 40 person line in like 15 minutes which was awesome--especially with the big orders (Vegas reasons).  If they open one of these in Denver I'm totally down.

8yGNKrb3ysiSFlyWb-OIYQ.text: Had to try In and Out Burger for the 1st time. We all had the Cheesburger which was very good.  Love the Toasted bun!! The Cheese fries were less than appetizing.  The cheese on the fries was hard and not good what so ever.  It had no flavor. The cheese on fries is supposed to be creamy and gooey,  not like plastic.  We threw them away.

photos.caption: Photo of In-N-Out Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Zfz2Bp_QE2YYnrb8XusO3Q.text: It was my first time eating In-N-Out Burger which was totally everything I expected. The location was had the place packed out so be ready to run and get a seat but the food is worth it.

photos.caption: Photo of In-N-Out Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States

xmMeE_VRQysnW6kzuVB8cg.text: In-N-Out Burger is still the most comfortable of comfort foods.   After all these years, I will still go out of my way, plan my day, and not care what I weigh to have an Animal-style Double-Double Cheeseburger with an order of In-N-Out Fries Well Done.  This Las Vegas Strip location (near the High Roller Ferris Wheel at the Linq) is just as busy as all the In-N-Outs in Southern California. Our wait time for an open seat was about 5 minutes after getting our burgers. My recommendation is to grab a table or seat as quickly as possible after walking in while someone else in your party orders.  The delay to pig out was worth it though because In-N-Out Burger remains the best Hamburger and Fries at this price point. Obviously, there are a zillion choices of what to eat in Vegas, but if you want pure inexpensive comfort food then there really is nothing like getting the most comfortable of them all: In-N-Out Burger.

photos.caption: Photo of In-N-Out Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Animal-style Double-Double Cheeseburger - In-N-Out Burger
Photo of In-N-Out Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. In-N-Out Hamburgers Storefront and Entrance
Photo of In-N-Out Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Protein Style Cheeseburger - In-N-Out Burger

QNUy_dSPPvXbnEvMQFlxsw.text: Ok tired of eating and paying hotel casino food prices.  Took a walk across the way from Caesers Place to the LINQ promenade.  Encountered so many eateries and shops along the way to the roller coaster/zip line.  Lo and behold. In & Out Hamburgers.  Across from the Linq Hotel. Its was Friday around noon during Valentine,President day weekend.  Not too crowded since it rained all day long the day before. Walkin only, no drive thru. Only a few minutes to go thru the ordering queue.  But 5min wait for my special order pickup since I ordered my burger with extra veges and no added salt.  The pickup area was congested with people waiting for their orders and the drink fountains. My burger was perfectly cooked and seasoned.  Prices are just 25 cent - $1 more than the normal.  But not those exorbitant hotel casino strip prices.  Plenty of tables inside and out.  Or just ask and share a table.  I don't bite.  The staff is constantly clearing and cleaning the tables.   Please don't feed the pigeons.  They develope a bad habit and become those unwanted guests you can't get rid of.

photos.caption: Photo of In-N-Out Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Off the strip prices

LOFDVZc5Bg_l2u9S4Q9cnA.text: The burgers are very good.  I went there twice the week I was in Vegas; the first day and the last.  The reason for the four stars are because their fries are more like those canned potato sticks and their milkshakes, at least the chocolate, are just bland.  I loved the burgers.  I had the double-double.  The first time, I had it with tomato and grilled onions. I'm glad the cashier told me that grilled onions was an option.  The tomatoes, however, were refrigerator cold and I don't like the taste of a cold tomato next to a warm burger.  So I left off the tomato the second time and it was awesome.

nMhh0yzB-4nN8E_K38l3zg.text: In-N-Out is always 5 star consistent goodness. Wherever we find a place, you always know you're going to get a good meal. They have always managed to keep their food fresh and deliver it just the way I want it... animal style.  I suppose most people reading the reviews are going to be those who have never been before (because those who are regulars will have already ordered their 4x4 animal style with animal style fries and a neopolitan shake). The first step is to understand that they have burgers at pretty much whatever size you want. They through in fresh lettuce, tomatoes and a secret dressing (which is likely a spin off of thousand island). The cheese is perfection and the patties are always so moist. For those of us with a wide mouth, this burger is for you. For others, it may be a challenge until you have squished your burger into a manageable size.  You look at the menu and you see burger, fries, drinks and shakes. Yup that's about it until you discover the secret menu that everyone talks about. Google it, is my advice. Animal style will give you grilled onions/cheese/extra dressing that you can add to both your burger or your fries. Neopolitan shake blends all the flavors of ice cream together into a wonderful milkshake. They can also do a patty for your dog, remove the buns for those on low carb and add extra patties who want a larger meal than just a double double. They will also do a grilled cheese which is essentially vegetarian.  Go early because as soon as lunch time comes around they are hopping. Before this location by the Linq opened up, we used to have to run across a lot of traffic to get to the other. Thank goodness this opened up on the strip! We were able to grab a meal before we hopped on the plane. Needless to say the calories we ate that morning lasted us all the way until the evening time! Always a winner. Always delicious.

zJi4Yrdyl1Sx21rHuTuz0A.text: In-N-Out is probably the cheapest meal you can get on the Strip. It is also one of the best meals you can get on the Strip too. Conveniently located at The Linq Promenade, In-N-Out is a hot spot with a line that can be a long zig-zag. However, the line moves quickly, and everything else is a speedy process too since the staff stays on top of their game. Despite the heavy traffic, the store stays pretty clean since there is always someone running around bussing tables and sweeping the floor. Seating is available inside and also out on the patio, and people are constantly coming and going so it will not take you long to find a seat.   If you are new to In-N-Out, the menu is simple. There is the hamburger and its few variations: cheeseburger and double-double. Pair that with some fries and a soda or shake, and you have a meal. There are also some secret menu items, but it is no secret since everyone knows them. Like stated on the menu, ordering is as easy as 1-2-3. Though simple, the burgers are amazing. The bread is perfectly toasted. The cheese is perfectly melted. The burger patty is perfectly thin yet juicy. Everything is fresh and made-to-order.   In-N-Out Burger ranks among the best burgers out there. Some call it their favorites while others beg to differ. I call it my favorite. People come from afar to In-N-Out for a reason. Try it yourself and determine if it is the best burger out there.

photos.caption: Photo of In-N-Out Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. double-double cheeseburger

AbpbG_CLHW-j0A7GJoHoOg.text: So being a lifetime burger lover and being from the Midwest I had always heard about how awesome In and Out Burgers were.  So when we visited Vegas for the weekend and having one right next to our hotel (The Flamingo) it was a sign that it was time for me to finally try my first in and out.    First off the inside was nothing special, it was super busy and they did a good job keeping it clean.  I have to say, I was a little worried when I walked in because there were so many people.  But wow, do they know how to put out the food!!! They must have had 20 people working while we were there and they do push the food out efficiently.  I got the Double Double and my wife and daughter each got just a plan cheeseburger.  Weill I can now say that I have finally had an In and Out Burger and it did not disappoint.  I thought it was a really good burger, and I enjoyed their fries too.  Bottom line, they need to open one in Milwaukee!!!

gHZbs60koGCvt2KOX_t0sg.text: Love this place. I can not get it back home so for me this is a must anytime this is available for me to eat.

photos.caption: Photo of In-N-Out Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Zy_79vQOhJ3BdQsrQOYTrQ.text: If only the East Coast gets an In-N-Out, it would put Burger King and McDonald's and Wendy's to SHAME! Better than fast food! Awesome taste and friendly staff! Best burgers on WEST coast there is! Jersey and NYC needs them here! Animal style!!!!

pNIaJetBr0RDfIrb0AyRBQ.text: Love this Vegas and California classic! I love all their options and very much enjoy the sauce on the fries. You can order the burgers to be as extravagant as one wishes (eg double double) or as minimalist as one would want. I always like the bun-free protein burger. The animal fries are also my favourite- regular fries also good!

h1SUcoSHKg6HLhgGWIdnvQ.text: A lot of hype, very chaotic for a typical burger joint. I don't get it. Burger was fine with a reasonable price. The setup is terrible and can be more efficient. But hey, it's Vegas where over the top and chaotic is part of the menu.

CrzhkfoC3jWYGZrDYP_Mbw.text: Well my 1st visit went all wrong!!!!! When I'm away on vacation l look forward to trying new places that are not located in Illinois. Don't get me wrong, the facility was really nice, staff was friendly and moved quickly. However, the food was terrible!! I ordered a cheeseburger combo that included fries and a drink. I figured, how could you mess up a burger right? Boy was l wrong! That was the worst burger I've ever had. It was so bland that all l tasted were the condiments and bread. No seasoning what so ever. And let's not forget about the fries. Cold, and also no taste to them. I was so disappointed and l hate spending my money and not getting anywhere close to what l was expecting. Bottom line, this place is seriously overrated.

photos.caption: Photo of In-N-Out Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Menu

OpQNnlLQZOucAyQ2wwwHlQ.text: This was my first time at In-N-Out burger! I ordered the cheeseburger meal with cheese fries and my fiance ordered a burger and fries, both animal style. Our burgers were so good! Juicy, with a good sturdy bun and the special sauce gives it an extra kick of flavor. The fries I could do without. They were cold and the cheese was congealed over, but it wasn't much of a dealbreaker because the burgers were so good! The service was excellent too! It's a good thing this place is only on the west coast! Lol

pYvTMrNbscyq1lrnPj4OXw.text: Horrible quality control! Meat patty was burnt and fries undercooked. I would have returned it but was already 15 numbers deep the first time and starving.

6eunmYvIZFrx8frNIK_uVA.text: Everything was amazing except for a bit of a long wait for my grilled cheese. ANIMAL STYLE EVERYTHING!!

photos.caption: Photo of In-N-Out Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of In-N-Out Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of In-N-Out Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States

7W6a70pCASWN5oxqYGg1HA.text: AMAZING. Still in awe as to how a burger is less than $4. There's a lot of people at this location so it can get quite hectic, but they take care of the line pretty well. Get the fries well done and animal style.

F_UzAXxV7OSc4R9Eg08FPA.text: This is In-N-Out.  As it's name implies, you are not there long.  You weave your way to the register and place your order.  A few minutes later, your number is called and pick up you sack of deliciousness!     One of the best bargains near Linq and Flamingo.     Don't forget the "secret menu".   You don't have to order what is on the menu board.     Now, is this the best fast food burger?  I don't know.  There are so many choices.   But for overall speed and quality, they do a damn good job at a great price.

rZmlBkOydrB9hL2FiKah4A.text: Finally put one on the strip! The location is out of control busy but the staff has no problem keeping up! You might not find anywhere to sit though with how busy it is, I would suggest ordering "to-go" just in case you can't find a table. The food is delicious as always!

fpHkHdFZ3oj0I0D_1QaMmw.text: The best In-N-Out Burger I've ever had and I've eaten at ~ 10 diff locations throughout Cali, this one in Vegas was the best. Animal style done to perfection on the double double and the fries, good prompt service that you expect from these folks too. What better place to grab a late night bite to eat than In-N-Out Burger on the strip in Vegas!!??

6gVgkOyOJUnS5HjqXg5W1g.text: I am probably out of the norm based on other reviews but I really don't get the hype here.  The place was packed at 11:30am...the line was literally out the door and a 20 minute wait.    I had the double double and fries (not animal style).  What I got was a double double animal style and soggy fries.  The burger is way oversauced and super messy.  The taste pretty good but I don't think it is anything ridiculous that I haven't had at other decent burger chains.  The fries should definitely be ordered well done as another yelper suggested.  Mine were soggy and lack luster.    I'm not one for crowds or lines for burgers and fries...but that is just me.

FT_Evj3VDqHtra5pDj4YMA.text: In n Out's only location on the strip.  It's located on the Linq promenade on the way to the high roller.  Got me a double double combo animal style with chopped chilis, animal style fries and a drink.   Cheap eats.

5jJdy1x8c8rxpiGfWRT-ZQ.text: We are from Cali and this still tastes the same! Even though it was very busy the staff didn't look overwhelmed. In addition, they where very courteous and respectful when they needed to get thru. Without a doubt glad that most of the employees had a smile and got our food in reasonable time!   P.S. Try the Freddie Style:    A Double double well done. Extra toast. Chopped chilies. Raw and grilled onions. And finally well done fries with it. Trust me it's worth the wait! Also you can get animal style dressing to spice up your order as well!

p2Xj2JjtVlZjRbIqA3e9nA.text: Big props to In-N-Out Burger for getting it right with this location. It would be very easy to take customers for granted because of the captive audience factor. Instead, everything runs so smoothly, staff is so nice and friendly, and the food is great.  To that extent, I would say that the food is better here than at other locations by comparison. Very hungry the other night and ordered a 4 x 4 with mustard grilled into the patties, well-done fries and a chocolate strawberry shake. Absolutely hit the spot, only took about 15 minutes if that and the burger especially was exceptional.  I only wish that other Vegas entities, from restaurants to shopping, could replicate this experience. All too often, Vegas almost 2019 takes its visitors and customers for granted assuming they can't go anywhere else and will take whatever they get. In-N-Out is the exception in delivering stellar food and service...very much appreciated.

r7fen78rgA8Ce5xj9BVdjg.text: My first time trying in-n-out burgers and fries and they were AMAZING. I ordered it animal style of course, because as an Instagram foodie, I've always wanted to try it the right way!!! That sauce was SO GOOD. It honestly reminded me of Big Mac sauce, but it was so flavorful and the burgers were juicy and so perfect. Ugh wish I had this place in NYC!!!!

photos.caption: Photo of In-N-Out Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of In-N-Out Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of In-N-Out Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States

EaCgJmHPwFQFdp1NyJ25cw.text: Prices are slightly marked up here, but let all visiting Californians rejoice as they stumble upon this shiny In n Out, conveniently located on the strip!   Stop by and order your usual (my personal go to: burger w/ chopped chiles) after a long day of shopping or clubbing, and this will seriously hit the spot. My friends and I ordered to go, and I devoured my food before we were even halfway home. No regrets.

Ad6qDRtqHfXJr1IRtfP-9g.text: I have wanted to try this west coast staple for a while now. It wasn't anything remarkable as far as presentation but the taste was better than five guys and the fries didn't look special but they sure taste special. I wish we had one on the east coast!

GVHTEpP58587ozHI4pH5zg.text: OMG you guys! There's an In-N-Out Burger on the strip!   Well, technically it's "off the strip" at the LINQ. This is like an open air shopping and dining area and it is totally on the strip.   This place opens at 10:30 in the morning. I showed up at 11am and I was order number 76. These guys knock out orders hardcore from open to close. Ain't no doubt your food is fresh.  The burger is absolutely perfect. The fries operate well as a side without upstaging the burger. This place changes my life every time I have it.  Cancel all your fine dining reservations and go to In-N-Out Burger instead.

photos.caption: Photo of In-N-Out Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. We have arrived.
Photo of In-N-Out Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. How cute are these two?

6kSWxxrQ-Mtkk_l-WAk7kA.text: I love burgers and I've heard about In-N-Out good things, so I decided to try. I was there on November 29, 2017. Fries was the worst I have ever tried, dry and weird taste. Burger - nothing special, not good.  Staff was bored, I heard when one of staff was talking to another that their boss told him to go home because there was nothing to do. Not so many clients. I'm not gonna visit this place again:/

RmG94dLOSzox-HZpHhXMqg.text: I really dont know what the hype is about this burger joint. I been to several different locations and it isn't all that great. But my friends that I was with never had it so they wanted to try it but they weren't impressed either.

kt5YqFOn0KRcR9CycJYHkQ.text: I'm so glad it wasn't as packed as it usually is. Two double double protein style and one double double burger. Also had to get animal style fries with extra sauce and some peppers as well.

photos.caption: Photo of In-N-Out Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States

dKk8O5gJnyCVF2tzUtJuWA.text: I'm in burger heaven! Let me start out by saying this was not my first food choice for today. I wanted a nice brunch....I planned for the Venetian, but it didn't happen for reasons beyond my control. I decided that since we wanted to try In and Out Burger this was as good a time as any.   The very long line moves quickly. I was so surprised. There is a fairly decent wait for the actual food to come out but it's not unbearable.   Now for the food!!! Yummy squared. Since I missed breakfast, I got a double double with fries. The burger was fresh and juicy. Well cooked. Tasty without accompaniment and filling. The fries were super salty, but not so bad if you skipped the ketchup.   The only negative was that sitting outside seems to attract the drunken men and women looking to get over their Saturday hangovers. I never heard so many f bombs in such a short period of time...unless Richard Pryor counts.

photos.caption: Photo of In-N-Out Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Double double with onions and Fries. Simply !

BfHbbJMFSLiycF-8jfgTJg.text: I wouldn't normally review something that basically everyone has tried, but I just wanted to bring awareness to the fact that there is now an In-N-Out walking distance from the strip! It is located in the Linq promenade, and great if you need something quick and familiar without having to visit a food court. It gets packed and it may be difficult to find a seat, so keep that in mind or take it to go. The food is on par as always!

28QHOjI3CI9K7grFMXdCOw.text: This was my very first time at in-n-out burger, since they are not in the chicagoland area.  It is a new addition to the LinQ promenade.   We stopped for lunch, because only 1 out of 6 of us had ever been there.   There is so much hype about it.  It is a buger place.  A fast-food burger place.   Honestly, it was a good burger, but nothing to write home about.   I'd go back if I wanted a burger and was in the area, but if I never went back, that wouldn't phase me either.

JvJYVY4VlSaoY3k72V-QSQ.text: Finally an In-N-Out Burger that doesn't require a car to get there. This is right next to the Linq and the lines aren't bad either. I usually like to get the double double animal style and my friends well cooked (so its actually a light brown, not yellow). The people who were here are super friendly and our order was pretty quick too. Too bad they close early because this would be amazing at 4AM in the morning. Oh well.

photos.caption: Photo of In-N-Out Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Tll3iavpmv9CSX8zXaUWSA.text: What you have heard about In-N-Out is True.  It really is that good.  Now please take into consideration that I had been drinking vodka sodas for 3 hours prior to consumption, but it's Vegas so it just elevates the experience!    There was a line but it went quickly.  I ordered what my west coast friends recommended fries "animal style" and a burger "protein style" aka no bun.  All the ingredients tasted fresh and the burger was really all about the meat.  The sauce was delicious!  Now if there was a Steak and Shake right next door, it might a coin toss between the two.

photos.caption: Photo of In-N-Out Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Animal fries and burger &#34;protein style&#34;

5GAO6ZqxcDrHd6htygZlBQ.text: The west coast's prized gem burger place.  How does it live up to 5 Guys and Shake Shack on the East coast though?  well, it was just OK.  5 Guys is still the best, and I'd give Shake Shack the edge over In-N-Out (and thats coming from somebody who doesn't really like Shake Shack)  Maybe it was just this location, but overall In-N-Out seemed like hype  that didn't really deliver

photos.caption: Photo of In-N-Out Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States

eLdTtFOIBV_xFdE17o2qZw.text: For my first In-n-out experience, it was pretty good! The place was packed, the wait was total time about 30 minutes. But my God what a delicious burger.  Our group had two different orders, mine came out swimmingly, the other not so much. Their burger was cold and tasted questionable.  The other reason there's a star knocked off is the chaos of the place, there's no real guidance for where to wait to get your order. Some people form lines, others gather around the soda fountains, others find a seat and then can't hear their name being called. Some consistency would do wonders.

photos.caption: Photo of In-N-Out Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States

fc7DS7obkenKXBPLgpiXyg.text: I have never had In-N-Out, so I would rate a 5 on food and a 1 on location, so I will even it out to a 3. The menu compared to other fast foods is pretty limited, and even their combos are just an easier way to order (as in, there's no discount to ordering a combo vs. ordering parts individually.)  The place was packed, which is why I am not a huge fan of this location. I'm going to guess that it's hard to find cheap eats on the Strip, so that's why the situation. There was just a huge line to order, a while to wait, a number system that didn't seem to be in any order so you really had to pay attention, and no where to sit. I will give them credit, that they did a pretty good job keeping things moving, all things considered. I just personally don't like being in big crowds and then eating standing up because that's my only option.  The burger was nice and juicy and lettuce and tomato provided the perfect contrast. The fries were great, described by my boyfriend as "too salty" but I say there's no such thing. Is it worth all the hassle of getting the food? Ehh I'm glad I tried it but brace yourself if you come here. I would be more than happy to visit another INO when I am somewhere else on the west coast, provided they are calmer.

photos.caption: Photo of In-N-Out Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Look at the beautiful burger

BVZVvaAbBWlGYHd2D2NI_Q.text: first time ever at an in-n-out so i had a good time. the burger was pretty tasty. like a more upscale mcdonald's. however just 30 mins after consuming said burger i felt gross. like a witch was inside me, using my belly as her cauldron to stir up something nasty. loved all the merch though. i even got a shirt. the food was average, but the fashion was fabulous. def check it out but don't forget to bring an anti acid

0gsqwT1pOUKam4PV9S05jA.text: In N Out Burger is one of those places, living in the Midwest, that everyone who has gone out west tells you to try asap. Well they aren't kidding. This place is a gem! The location I visited was off the strip near the Linq, and for a Friday night, it was super busy, but they keep that line a-movin'! Their menu is smaller than most fast food joints, but honestly, that makes it easier. No frills- hamburger, cheeseburger, fries and shakes. They DO have a secret menu that you can find online (I found out after leaving Vegas, boo!). The food is GOOD too, guys. Like the fries are perfect and the burger is so juicy. There's a little area that you can get all your condiments including peppers. It was kind of difficult to find a place to sit at that location, considering the time we went but they do have a lot of outside seating as well!

I don't know but the double double cheese burger and the hamburgers are delicious like the gods themselves whispered in someone's ears how to create the perfect master piece ....best burgers hands down ....ya just need to get some better fries  to go with things lol

hvv5ZW9dJp0RJ87EhbhsJQ.text: I was at this In-N-Out Burger the week the controversy came out and the service did not lack at all. I love a Double Double with ketchup and mustard. The only knock on this location was that there aren't public restrooms.

ur1jSLq9E4yJs2mpDSZ9NA.text: So back when I had much more hair and much less weight, I used to attend a hacker conference every summer in around late July - Black Hat/Defcon, it was called, and it used to take place at the now defunct Riviera hotel on the north side of the strip, close to the current location of Circus-circus.  One of the rites of passage for a journeymen "hat" is to make the trek up Las Vegas Blvd, walk about a click on Sahara Blvd and brave your way across Interstate 15 to hit In-n-out for a meal.  It's cheap, reliable food that is pretty much universally accepted by those who are not burdened by salad guilt, so to speak.  Of course, the last time I was at the Riviera for Defcon was during DC18 back in 2010.  For DC19 (2011) the venue was switched to the Rio, which it stuck to until it was moved onto the strip after DC22.  My last Defcon was 20, which was work financed with all sorts of employer sponsored hilarity involving roller derby girls, vodka cocktails at the Red Square in Mandalay Bay and an M249 SAW in a firing range (not necessarily in that order)  Fast forward today - different gig, and less happy reasons to be at the strip - job sent me here for ensuring smooth operations at trade shows (Freeman, the operator of the LVCC are the real one-arm bandits of Vegas), and I got put up in a hotel that I would prefer not to be in, but it's next to the monorail.  Of course, there's the small problem of finding a cheap place to eat close to the strip that won't go over the rather stingy per-diem allotment.  I mean, granted, if I have a rental car I can hit the $8 buffets at the Station House casinos off-strip, but I...don't.  So, I need a cheap, honest place on the strip, which by any sense of the concept is a contradiction.  Vegas is here to hustle, and the strip especially so.  Oh yeah, there is that bible passage quoting fast-food joint from SoCal on the other side of the Cajon pass...  So, In-n-out is rather famous if you orbit between the coasts.  It's supposed to be the west coast counterweight to Shake Shack, something that was known for its no-nonsense approach to the seemingly simple task of getting burgers, fries and shakes to the consumer without compromises to quality.   Unlike Ray Kroc's soul-less Scottish clown chain, In-n-Out is famous for not pushing for rapid expansion and "consistency" via shortcuts like using pre-cut frozen fries, frozen patties and soy based frozen beverages (you know, instead of real milkshakes).  They are also still an ostensibly family owned chain with its own idiosyncrasies (like biblical verse call-outs in the cups and hats).  In fact, it was the only burger chain welcomed to the Fisherman's wharf area in San Francisco due to its family owned nature and flexibility blending in with the local businesses.  The vision of a '64 Impala with the hydraulics deployed on an In-n-Out parking lot in Compton is as much a California thing as, say, the tricked out Integra Type-R in Daly City or a Tesla Model S at an In-n-Out in Malibu.  In-n-Out is a part of the California car culture transcending ethnic and class lines much like fuzzy dice or cruising down the Pacific Coast Highway.    So, what's so great about this particular location?  Well, it's cheap (compared to the rest of the offerings on the Strip), and unlike the other nonsense out there, it's a beacon of honest value.  If you blew a few hundred on Texas Hold-em and the casino won't cut you slack on the comps, you cash out your chips, walk down to the LinQ promenade and grab yourself a double double with animal fries and a Neapolitan shake.  It's a $12 outlay and it'll fix you right up.  If you enjoy it fresh (my recommendation is to eat right outside) it's a tasty repast that is invigorating.  If you are on the company tab, well, that and Capriotti's sub's represent good value for your limited meal dollars.

QnVXz8Wf8_tKuD_WU1I-Vg.text: Ok, so the food would probably get three stars, but for my first time to this chain, and at a very busy Vegas location, it was a really good experience.   Burger was good, but definitely more salty than I'm used to - I think it must have been a fluke because surely their burgers aren't always this salty. I was hoping for leaf lettuce, but it was more like chunks of iceberg - just personal preference. The tomato was fresh and I liked the sauce, which is basically thousand island dressing. I ordered cheese fries but that was a mistake as I was expecting a cheese sauce but they a steam a slice of American cheese on top of the fries...had I known that I would  not have ordered cheese fries, haha, but again that's just personal preference.   It's quick and convenient, free refills on drinks, and for under $20 for two I was really pleased. Happy that I finally got to try it out.

photos.caption: Photo of In-N-Out Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States

91eH10K6xxq3IytXKZTuqA.text: My first In-N-Out burger experience was a good one! The service at this location was impressive--so many people in the kitchen scurrying around, BUT, completely organized and accurate. It was greasy, hot, and tasty. I wish they had In-N-Outs all across the country!

cVYO81QHXMylf_6EG_JG3Q.text: Love In-N-Out burgers and shakes but not really a fan of their fries.  Wish I could have an In-N-Out burger with McD's fries.  LOL  This location was packed when we went.  During the time that we were there, the orders went through almost 100 numbers.  Not enough seats but you can take your food outside and sit in the mall area.  The burgers and shakes are delicious and cheap.

oDSTKDalfWHb6O3AHPXefg.text: Oh boy, this is good!    When you've been out on the town and are in need of a late night burger, this is the place for you.  The burgers are fresh and the fries are perfect and bottom line, they are priced right.  For a LV strip place, you can't really do better.  I suggest the double-double with cheese and animal style fries.  Yum!

oORU0gFMjmDObD2wb1QSrA.text: I hear a lot of mixed reviews about In-N-Out, but I had to try it out for myself! I am happy to report I have no regrets, other than not getting a double double. No but seriously ever since I had my first experience a month back I haven't been able to stop thinking about it. My first trip out west was in June and we didn't have time to fit In-N-Out into our schedule. When I found out I was going back in September I couldn't leave it out. I had to leave knowing I tried the famous In-N-Out.  I ordered just a single with fries because I didn't think I could eat a double double at the time. However, after one bite I wished I had ordered the double double. That burger was so juicy and the animal sauce was smothered all over the burger making it that much better! It didn't taste like a garbage burger. It tasted like a quality burger produced in a fast food setting.   We have something similar in Pittsburgh called Five Guys, but it doesn't give me the same feels. If I lived out west I would be frequently making trips here. The price is right and the burgers are tasty!

photos.caption: Photo of In-N-Out Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of In-N-Out Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cheeseburger with fries

eWvV-Ss0N7A8y5_yqAD4FQ.text: The best bang for your buck close to the Vegas strip. The place is always packed (for that reason) but they are very efficient in churning out orders. You will probably have to wait a bit to get a table but turnover is high because people don't hang out there for too long.   The burgers will definitely hit the spot after a night out. I would recommend doing animal style on the fries and not the burger if you get the combo. However, the fries in general were really disappointing (friend described it best as cardboard). The animal style with cheese and onions made the fries more tolerable.

photos.caption: Photo of In-N-Out Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States

mGLQSxXctsYdz0q82kko-w.text: Everybody always talks about how great in n out burger is but it seemed like a very generic fast food joint. I would say it's better than McDonalds, but I wouldn't make it a habit to go eat there.

s_0JbqcJhaEbP5gWp22wuw.text: I'm happy that there is an In-N-Out Burger on the strip now! When I arrived I was able to order right away and got my food in about ten minutes. This is actually faster than some of my experiences at other CA locations. I ordered a double double animal style and it tasted great!

arRCT9C56sBS2G-TG388hg.text: Ah-mazing! I visited In N out burger for the first time back in May 2018 on the strip. Now I've heard that it's pretty good but I was really impressed ! Staff at this location were super friendly and service was fast. My friends and I chose to eat out on the patio and a staff member approached us asking if we needed anything else (extra ketchup, napkins etc) the restaurant was clean and prices were low !   I had a double double and cheese fries which I couldn't eat all off and the burger was perfect ! I'll be back again soon!  They also have a gift shop attached which I had to hit up after having an amazing burger

_tlSRIBU4Uu1HS5ZxSVT2Q.text: It was ok not all that wish it was hot. The service is good so why not the food???? I would give them another try

dFUyTqCMYao379dsIqglvQ.text: Everything was good, but if IN N OUT knows how busy they're ALL the time, why did they choose the smallest location?!

zPOtnCt9TBbiU3F-nYsJ5w.text: Burgers are fresh and delicious, cheese is melted and gooey. Meat tastes great and not dry at all. Buns are fresh and soft but don't fall apart from the juicy burgers or condiments. Was disappointed with the fries, the texture was completely off. They were not crispy but yet the potato inside was brittle. Maybe that batch was cooked at too high a temperature and taken out before they could get crispy or burn. I'm from Texas so I'll be happy with Whataburger when I go home but try this too while you're in town.

vmn44lCLBfOIjOpjaewgXw.text: I am still trying to figure out the hype of In-N-Out. The Animal Style Burger and fries were good but nothing special.  I think 5 guys is much better. Maybe I'm missing something but to me it was a little higher class than McDonalds.

gP9qYj9DjIfGQQXN8bgf4g.text: No wait, service was good, and tables clean. Only 4 stars cause soda was off a bit. Co2 to coke was off.

Zu4I96Ku7PQR8WBFreoSOw.text: Obligatory stop at In-N-Out on our first night in Vegas after we checked into Caesar's across the street. The line wasn't too long and it moved quickly, with all enough employees manning the cash registers. We ordered some of the off-the-menu items (like fries well done, animal style fries-hold the grilled onions). Somehow our order got skipped over, along with about 10 others, but we got our food soon after we brought it to their attention. I thought maybe I had a bad experience when I had In-N-Out in LA, but nope.. everything just tasted overly salty to me. People ate and didn't linger, so by the time we got our food, there was an open table for us to plop down at. Since the turnover happens so quickly, the tables are not wiped down. All of the common areas (soda dispensers, condiments area) were cleaned and restocked often though. Overall, I'll eat here if someone requests it, but I wouldn't be the first to recommend it. Food isn't great, but the service sure is!

dYCvq5CFbWQufIzh9jgl-w.text: believe the hype. yes, it's super crowded, but staff makes quick work of the crowd. as busy as it is, order comes out correct and with a smile. given that it's slightly off the Strip, it's relatively hidden all things considered. grab a bite, find a bench, and enjoy 30 minutes of people watching while sorting out your next move.

Pp9H67ehefa3_wkqK41i7Q.text: First time here after years of watching people eating here and talking to people and getting their options about it. I got the double double animal style and it was awesome and everything I ever dreamed about lol. Definitely top burger in the fast food industry (sorry Big Mac we had a good run bro)

QC4EzzDxSr0z-8mQHvxv3g.text: honestly, the burger was good, nothing extraordinary- the fries were TERRIBLE, wouldn't go back solely for this reason, for a place so well known and famous you would think they would invest in better fries!

evGhysDlasq5mjmkkv-1WQ.text: Burgers to die for, fries I could live without. Awesome awesome burger yum! There was a stupid long line but I'd wait forever in line to eat this. Which I did. And it was hot. Vegas hot. And the line indeed extended to the outdoors. Worth it.

4dyWu7jqX9Jt8i_-C0GzuQ.text: I was beyond excited to finally try In-n-out after being to California twice and not trying it there. As a Canadian the hype is pretty real for this place. Because it's cheap, good quality and of course the not so secret menu items. I tried the 2x2 animal style burger and animal style fries. Everything was good, don't get me wrong but I was way to hyped for this place. The food was good, and animal style adds good flavour but everything seemed cold and really greasy. I'm definitely going to try it again if I have the opportunity. But if you're visiting and don't have these around your home try it. It's cheap, decent burgers and filling. Ps the lemonade they had was amazing.

HQYHl7MWxOGeyqWrQggCbA.text: Wow i havent had in & out in like 4 years.  And i am in love with them again!  Nothing has changed, their simple but delicious food and amazing quick and friendly service!  Those strawberry shakes are sooooo good

GNXxdK6cC7YbhZKhKEEL9A.text: Not impressed.  The burgers were the thinnest I've had, the fries were thin and no flavor.  I had heard a lot about in and out, won't be back.

JdzQjqJXNn5mvUHKAjnNIQ.text: Came to Las Vegas from the east coast, was excited to try good burger as I've heard all the rave....the restaurant was great and fast..just don't get all the hype about these burgers.

KgZjUB93HmdB81FWLAAixQ.text: I'm not even sorry for this review. What is the insane hype about this place? I had been out west before, heard of In-n-Out before, and was always berated by people when they found out I had been in California/Vegas but hadn't gone to this burger place. I finally made my way back out to Vegas and tried it out with high hopes. Took me about 5-6 hours to realize that it was so average/below average that I couldn't even believe it. The patties are thin, they have no flavor, and the animal sauce is nowhere near as special as Mac SauceTM. I'm shocked that people think this place is good, almost to the point where I think I must be wrong. I'll try it again tmrw but I am sure that this place is missing many of the fundamentals of a good burger; needless to say their fries are also garbage. Johnny rockets is better than this place, and five guys wins without a conversation. So disappointed, in the restaurant, of course, but also in the percentage of humanity that advocates so heavily for a garbage burger chain. Good logo

JZ_0KyckkyuIZjgqmgqwig.text: I have always wanted to try an In-N-Out burger but not living near the west coast...that isn't available. I finally got to try it and it was so worth it! It was hotter than Hades out there when we went to visit (late June 2017) when it was around 110 degrees+ every day. Seating was taken inside so I went outside to wait for my husband (the concrete seats were incredibly hot - wish I had had a towel to sit on...that was my only complaint). The burger was spot on! The fries were equally as good. It was much needed on a day when I was struggling.

3sd3fgmNAeW4XWGoa0n9GA.text: By far the best fast food burger place in the  world. It's no wonder why this is the place everyone has to go when they come out west. Delicious burgers at a very fair price. And with a huge crowd at every location, they still manage to serve each persons order (made specifically for them) quickly.

jMkj6ik5OfMKYUW9Wk34Zw.text: Food was fresh . The restaurant was A little crowded , but the service was pretty fast . Very reasonable prices, and WAAAAY better then spending $20 on a mediocre burger at the hotel .

XatrPHRYpAqAaMhbE8IY5Q.text: It seems like everyone and then some was here to eat! This place is super busy but it is amazing how clean they keep it they have plenty of people on staff to get through the line quickly. It took a little bit to get our food but that is to be expected. The restaurant is beautiful and the staff really tries hard to do keep it clean. We even had someone attempting to smoke in the outside seating and the security from In-N-Out came out and told them to please put that out. Great job Mr security! We really appreciate that you guys really made this restaurant feel like they think the customers are really important. Try the 3 by 3 animal style with animal fries...You will love it!

n6W2LjDPBYU4zxO6N5VI3Q.text: This is a very busy place.  Easy menu. I ordered the double and my wife the cheeseburger. Fries are average but the burgers are very good. Price is very reasonable and outside seating is nice to have on a sunny day to watch people.

FWNtrSNhO6dbg-U_T1PPhg.text: Always crave for an In n Out burger. Hawaii doesn't have the joint so that's always on my to eat list!! Got the #1 all animal style! Always soooooo good!! I will have to stop in before I leave. And not to mention they always got the friendliest staff. It's always super busy but these workers are giving 100% Of their customer service!! Yesss!

Qq3QdduASMGNVbujeqQG4Q.text: Man, the restaurant prices in Las Vegas have gone through the roof!  Absolutely insane, and many of the restaurants don't even serve any memorable food.  After eating an expensive dinner at Caesar's, I went to see the Beatle's Cirque du Soleil LOVE show.  By the time the show ended, I was kind of hungry again and went for a stroll on the way back to the hotel.    I saw a massive In-N-Out neon sign on the strip and made my way over.  Here is a tip, the restaurant is actually kind of hard to find.  Just keep walking towards the ferris wheel and it will be on your right hand side, if you're coming from the strip.  Anyways, I stopped in and they were doing brisk business even though it was 11pm.  So there was a bit of a wait but the cheeseburger I ordered was excellent, the bun was crispy and fresh, the fries were tasty and the lemonade hit the spot.  The In-N-Burger was way better value than anything served at the restaurant's on Caesar's properties.

Tp0UHxZMU-IwjqPdj5GI1w.text: Pretty good burger spot, nothing out of ordinary, but nonetheless it satisfies the taste buds!    P.S.- When you go ask for animal style for a extra umph to your burger!

photos.caption: Photo of In-N-Out Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States

yeuKK1iiRopEk0hh_6A7yQ.text: As always In-N-Out was BOMB!  Went to LV for a day out and about.  Decided to take the kids to the strip location @linq so they could have a cool experience.  Location didn't disappoint!!!  The outside motif allowed for cool, fun photo op.  The inside is definitely not big enough to provide adequate seating for the business of this location.  We were lucky and just happened to grab a booth right before our food was ready.  However, while eating I just felt bad for all the people that didn't share our luck.  It was 115 outside so getting stuck eating out there could not have been enjoyable.  The staff was amazingly friendly.  They did a great job keeping tables cleaned and dining area presentable. The line to order was long but the crew moved it super fast.  They had at least four order takers on front cash. It was great.  As always, food was fresh and delicious.  Considering how busy they were, our order seemed to take no time to come out.  They have a merchandise window outside selling all kinds of shirt choices, souvenir pins, etc.  That was cool.  Do be advised, unfortunately prices are higher at this location.  That is the only reason for 4/5 stars.  I get it, companies want to take advantage of location/people but it still sucks.  I though In-N-Out would be different and stick with their prices and I was sadly disappointed.  It cost $35 for 3 drinks, 3 fries, 2 doubles, and 2 singles.  I was floored.  Due to that, unless you just want to check out the decor of the location I would eat any of the other dozen locations within miles.  The money you save can pay foe your parking when you do get to the strip!

hz5t9nrvLk6YW1vA4JEYyA.text: A and I love the burgers here and they did not disappoint! The service was exceptionally good, with a waiter bringing our order to us the first time we visited and it was super crowded. The second time we came, we were a bit inebriated from the high roller so the burgers really hit the spot. When we came around 6, it was pretty empty so don't come around lunch time if you don't like crowded places. I ordered my usual cheeseburger and fries animal style, which comes with grilled onions.

photos.caption: Photo of In-N-Out Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Animal style fries, double double, and animal style cheeseburger

aVsRTFavFqSThntrsmx2Xw.text: I go there the place is always packed but they are really fast at getting the food out. I give them credit most of the help are teenagers  but there always working and clean. The foods alright  Ive tasted better hamburgers but I can't say anything bad about a place that is always packed.

2qcYkyy41WxycsPPH1yinw.text: DO NOT BELIEVE THE HYPE.  This has got to be the worst burger and fries I've ever had. I was visiting Vegas for a girls trip and we decided to come here since everyone knew how excited I was to try this since it was my first time and it was in a convenient location for our plans.  Our fries were hard as rocks. No amount of cheese or whatever "special" sauce they put in their animal fries could have saved that disaster. Our burger was dry and tasteless. The seating was overly crowded. Not worth the hype at all. Shake shack would have been a way better option. This will be my first and last time. Not worth your money or time.

Y5qnlMMZj487rhClTPEYzw.text: My favorite fast food burger hands down!  I live in WV and it had been 5 years since I had one of these burgers.. it was everything I remembered when I took a bite . The grilled bun and special sauce are incredible. The location of this particular one is very cool.  Located on the Linq promenade, you can sit outside and people watch (the best part of Vegas) while eating.  Long line that moves really fast so don't let that deter you.  I can't wait to go back already!

vPbUdDbnX-CS128EBt05KA.text: I always try to make it to at least one In-N-Out whenever I come to the west coast. Out of all the burger joints I have tasted in Vegas, In-N-Out is the only one where you get a ton of food for under $10. I had the Double Double Animal Style with spread (their special sauce) on the side along with fries and a drink. It was delicious!

photos.caption: Photo of In-N-Out Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Double-Double Animal Style with Fries
Photo of In-N-Out Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States

9LUpJanw1syk1qv2OG8tVg.text: This is place will forever be busy no matter what time of the day . But I truly do enjoying eating here when ever I get the chance . 100% would recommend eating here .

photos.caption: Photo of In-N-Out Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States

utY4vhtAxrZhZGQtmMnD4w.text: I'm far more excited about finding this place on the strip then I should be. I live on the East Coast so I only get to enjoy "in and out burger" when I travel for work or visit my left coast friends. It is by far the best fast food anywhere and this new location does not disappoint.   It's a little hard to find because it's way in the back of the courtyard  on the right near the Linq Ferris wheel. Worth the hunt   As is typical with other locations the service is unbelievably friendly and welcoming and surprisingly efficient for the crowd. I had my usual which is the double double burger (they are thin patties if you've never had it before so it's not as big as it sounds) vanilla milkshake and fries.  I was traveling with my boss who had never even heard of in and out burger so this was his first experience. He loved it!  The way that they advertise peeling the potatoes and cutting the fries daily just makes all the difference in the world. So good!!!

photos.caption: Photo of In-N-Out Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Simply the best

Pr1gRSL9zKdVQtXvXT1tkQ.text: I can always count on In-N-Out to taste the same anywhere I go and that is one of the best things I love about them. No matter which location, I know that I will get the same great taste that I remember them to have. This location is really busy as it is in the Linq promenade so there is a lot of people nearby and stopping in here. There can be super long lines so just account for that especially when it's lunch or dinner time. The only thing you have to realize is that since it is in Las Vegas, there is a slight upcharge than what SoCal-ers may be used to.

IMAEP7T197p7sYsLf3PvMQ.text: This location is extremely busy all day because it's near the High Roller and other attractions. The line is always out the door but the staff works fast. Before you know it, you are inside the restaurant and placing your order. The food is always fresh, restaurant clean and outside eating area is clean too. Only downside is that there are no bathrooms. You have to search endlessly in that area full of tourists, shops and restaurants just to find them. Very frustrating.

oU-TYqKztPm5Q5M74-PqEA.text: Always a fan of In-N-Out. And being steps from my hotel (the LINQ) lobby, isn't such a bad place to be either. Like all locations, this place is cranking out the food! And being one of the more affordable options on the strip, it's definitely busy at all times of day.   Seeing I didn't know when we would be making a trip to California again, it was a must to check out the new Promenade location and get my fix while I was in town. First visit I went for my standard Double Double Animal Protein burger and Animal Fries (well done!). Instead of braving the crowd, I took it back up to my room to enjoy in peace. Second visit, I just got a simple double double animal style (no fries); the lettuce wrapping takes a little longer at this location then I've experienced at other ones so I went without this time.   In-N-Out definitely ranks up there as a must stop whenever I'm in range for a visit.

3-YZQXfAPBBmSiLgVCvqVw.text: What can I say it's in and out. I'm from Canada and I love it. Get the animal style if you are feeling adventurous but it's all good and tasty

photos.caption: Photo of In-N-Out Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States

ujEjgpcL53WEMmmAr228rg.text: I don't get the draw for this place.  I ordered the double cheese burger and cheese fries.  The burger was overcooked, had too much onion on it, and overall was very runny.    I will call the fries "fry chips."  Most of the fries in the bowl were teeny, tiny pieces with about a dozen actual fries mixed in.  The cheese on top was kinda bland.  All this being said, this place was packed.  It takes some time to get your food so be prepared to wait.  Everyone seemed to have a good time and enjoy their meal.  When I think of Gormet Burgers I think of the restaurants at the Burg (St. Petersburg) or many of the fine restaurants in the Midwest.  I just did not find this burger up to that level.    The thing with this place is I was starving.  I had not eaten for 18 hours.  Anything should have tasted good.  I really wished I had gone somewhere else.  Maybe I had an off meal, but I won't be going back.

jVrcDT6RpLnPW8zekYlyyg.text: It was my first time having In&Out. I wasn't particularly impressed by the burgers. They were pretty dry. I was really excited to try animal fries but they were surprisingly not good & also soggy. I would probably pass on this the next time I see one

PtqketfXvw5zwuIvbTf8gw.text: I don't know what the hype is all about this burger place. The fries tasted stale, the burger meat was so thin. The burger itself had just bunch of lettuce and no meat. I would have to say the sauce was tasty. Tasted like their homemade mayo or something. The service was quick, which it should be for a fast food restaurant. There are limited seats and they are not sanitary. It would be a great drunk food burger but shake shack is much better from NY area.

1QNSRs6v7oNw32ktQ_j85A.text: My wife is a California transplant. (We live in seattle) and I'm praying Monday was an off day. We came straight from the airport with luggage in hand cause we had to have our fix. I've never had a bad in n out burger until now. If I'm in the area again I'll give it one more shot. Otherwise I'll go out of my way to go to the one that's just west of the luxor.

neLv82pPYigiPZlIYx-rDQ.text: Right on the Link this is the best deal for some quick food in the area. Unlike most places they don't jack up theirs prices just because of the location. Two of us ate for the pice of one basket of fish-n-chips just up the way! Lookup their secret menu if you are not aware or just order two Flying Dutchman, mustard grilled, add onions with fries well done! Thank me later.

t1JJUaXstQb5FHR2qYEtjw.text: Soooooo good. Animal style everything. Whole grilled onion. We need this on the east coast

blXjGP34ZZ7Dg38YenRD3A.text: We at here on St. Patty's for lunch.  It was very busy, but service was fast.  The place had several  people cleaning too.   I don't drink soda pop, so light lemonade was a great option.  The burger was fresh and made correctly.

photos.caption: Photo of In-N-Out Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Single with LTO and spread. Fresh cut fries.

l_qKkhgTR7ZYH43-Y0uT4w.text: My favorite fast food joint in Las Vegas! My only gripe is how insanely packed it gets and it can be hard to find seating. Other than that, it is incredible place to get a burger. My mom loves topping her fries with cheese!

M1QAdDi_mz3wrJpDvS-oDw.text: Great taste, but a long line. Best value for food on the strip. Pop is thick, so I liked it

qrtax3GIvv_u9kDHDzNVkQ.text: Wow talk about a location being all hype and reputation. I think the burger patties might have been thinner than McDonalds. It's mostly lettuce and tomatoes. The fries... don't get me going on the worst fast food fries I have ever had. Terrible value for the price. In and Out? I'm just OUT. Five Guys is way better and even though I'm not the biggest fan so is Shake Shack. Gonna check out Wahlbugers next.

Oe5RIgjdDjgl_6_iMZTVqw.text: The seating here is terrible but they do a great job at getting people their food very quickly!

AFl2Da3vO0KKtqUCdl_23A.text: OVERRATED. East Coast Burger Chains *Greater Than* West Coast Burger Chains. Sorry im not Sorry; dont believe me? Visit Five Guys, Smashburger, Burger Bistro, Corner Store Kennedys Fried Chicken, etc

0rgeVCgL63D7SQ_HKTie2g.text: This review is going to be short and sweet. The lines will be long, but it's worth it. Everyone knows this is a must during any west coast visit. I got the double double. It's delicious, juicy and a step above a regular fast food burger. If you haven't been, try it out at least once. Order off of the secret menu and get an "Animal Style" burger. Grilled onions, pickles, a special sauce and a mustard patty. Yum...

_3DBMK4ZxytuYDRWGmjYtw.text: Amazing food! Great choice for a quick bite to eat! Friendly staff, and accurate service. When we visited it was very busy, but our orders came out rather quickly and accurate. I will be visiting here again when I return to the West.

photos.caption: Photo of In-N-Out Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States

OaMACHr1WT4Y6mhKAIQbXA.text: Haven't had their food in a few years and made sure to make a trip when we were here in Vegas. Line went fast, and got longer as the afternoon progressed, but unfortunately there wasn't a lot of seating due to how busy they were.   Fries came out cold and onions were very hot. Burger meat was fresh and sauce was good.  Would not go out of my way to eat at tnhis location due to my experience, but would stop if I was in the area.

tNqZ6521utTwCa6OgsmWsw.text: Simply perfect!! Animal style fries is the way to go. Drive through time was short. The employees were very friendly.

98GnFb_5RRnk0HnJs-_nrg.text: First time trying this place on the west coast. Pretty darn good, cheap price for cheese burgers, insane quick service even though the line is crazy long. Obviously not the best burger I had but when your cheese burger is $3.50 and the ingredients are fresh, I really can't say much. It's obvious why this place is a hit on the west coast!

photos.caption: Photo of In-N-Out Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cheese burgers and animal style fries

IWdnIspBcaELZ7Ds3ynyGQ.text: was my first time in In-n-out today (and the first time writing a review actually) the location was very busy but we didn't have to wait for too long at all and the food was great.  actually just wanted to write this review to say thanks to Luis again, he was extra helpful where other stuff was trying to move quickly he took time to help us with everything we needed. Luis thank you and good luck!

Br-tq5x7JLajugw2FHq74g.text: The food was really good is the best burgers to eat Is good I like it is my frist time to try it

yczaa9i9az8AZAuLU5gjrw.text: Very overrated the food had too much salt that's the burger and the fries the shake was too thick to use a straw so let's call it the low quality soft serve ice cream it is. Shake shack, 5 guys sheesh even wendys would be a better option.

KgTFBeOJRjZl28odlHuqlg.text: I was really looking forward to it after many Californian friends recommended.  It is not bad for a fast food place, definitely better than McD.  But i wouldn't want to waste a meal on it, since there are so many other great restaurants in Vegas.

RcIGpTS8D2SLiZhlp8drTw.text: Newly opened In & Out on the strip!  Small joint but the customer service was outstanding.  Came in three times in four days and each time the food came out quick, hott & the staff was pleasant and quick to wipe down tables for other patrons to sit.  I have been to a few different locations in various states & this location was my favorite!

NmZDyKl3LXhRD4ZKmvmK4w.text: I love In-N-Out Burger, and I typically jump at the chance to go when the opportunity arises (I live in Canada), but I have to say that it's not worth going to this Strip location if you aren't good with crowds. It was insanely crowded with a crazy long line. No hope of getting a seat indoors or outside. They also messed up my order, so we had to stand around even longer. I was desperate to get out of there. We ended up awkwardly eating our food in the blazing sun by the fountain outside. The staff (as per usual In-N-Out fashion) were attentive and polite, but that was the first time I've ever had an order messed up at any In-N-Out location (we usually do the drive-thru). If I'm desperate for In-N-Out next time I'm in Vegas, I may take an Uber to a different location.

EP9spKvMOBXec1uVjX-WBA.text: Although In-N-Out doesn't need any description, still felt the need to review! So glad Vegas got a location on the strip. Usual fast and friendly service! As busy as it was still a clean location. Great experience as always!

jsYsgTyfi50xXXFJ2ywFOg.text: Very fast for not having a drive through and heavy traffic. Burgers were consistent and fresh like other locations!

cS4yIe-TvxnaLA3IJWavSA.text: Okay but if you go out west and don't eat in-n-out are you even American? Just kidding..... kind of......   Last time I went to an In-N-Out I was vegan but did some research and was able to order a lettuce bun, onion, vegetable sand-which haha. It was good honestly though. So if you are vegan and have family or friends that want to go here, don't feel like you won't have any options because technically there are secret things you can order.   We were having dinner later so just decided to share some animal style fries (see picture to see what this means) and animal style cheeseburger. Basically animal style is when they put dressing on top. It's really tasty. Everything was good and tasted like it typically does, it had been many years since I had a burger from here but I would Return.   Also, I've never been to an In-N-out and it not be busy, so have some patience when you arrive. The staff are always super friendly though, at least in my opinion.

photos.caption: Photo of In-N-Out Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Animal Style Fries
Photo of In-N-Out Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Animal Style Cheeseburger

uZ6ckUrDViIY_GiP_7seww.text: I've had plenty of In-N-Out and this location was by far one of the busiest which was expected because it's located on the LV strip and pretty much all In-N-Outs are busy. The most disappointing part of my experience here was the service: the cashier who took our order was plain rude and he really wanted to show how he didn't want to be there. This part of the In-N-Out experience was weird because I've never really had a bad service before even on their busiest hour at other locations.   Food was still good.  Restaurant was expectedly crowded.  I'll only go back here if I really crave it that I won't care about bad service.

L-XCTPoYyl4eAie7jrc4JA.text: Let's start with the pros of this particular In-N-Out location. First the location is nice, it's right off the strip in a colorful and busy area where there is plenty to keep you entertained while you eat. Second the service is extremely fast even though it was packed we didn't wait more than 10 minutes for our order. Third the food is worthy of an IG picture especially if you're from the East Coast-ish area like me where these don't exist. Annnd that's about all the pros I have. The 2 stars are for the customer service and location only. After all the excitement I felt when finally entering an In and Out it was quickly turned into disappointment once I bit into my Double-Double combo Animal Style. It was one of the most underwhelming experiences I've encountered while eating at a big name spot. It was just a bland patty and even blander fries even with the sauce and cheese. Needless to say I won't be back, but I'm still happy I was able to check In and Out off my Foodie Bucket List.

photos.caption: Photo of In-N-Out Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States

xqMEkPRjQIVLdBeE5BbbPQ.text: It's in-N-out so you know the food is going to be delicious. If you're not from the west coast you should definitely try their burgers. They had a lot of employees working and because it is located on the strip it gets really packed. When I got there there were only 2 people in front of me but there were a lot of people waiting for their food. All the tables were full but my food was to go because we were going to eat in the room. It took us about 10 minutes to get our food which I was surprised, I thought it would take longer because there was a lot of people.  The employees were nice and they made sure they gave me enough ketchup. They also had enough chili peppers so you can grab.  Overall, I really enjoyed my experience here and I will go back when I stay in Flamingo again because it is so close to it.

rN8lUz_Tz0zJ0asBGQ6gug.text: It's a no brainer that when you fly to the west coast, you need to eat at an In-N-Out Burger, so that's exactly what I did on Saturday afternoon. Being my first ever trip to an In-N-Out location I needed to make the most out of it. The place itself was absolutely packed but they went through the line super fast, so kudos to the fast staff. I ended up giving the double double cheeseburger a try along with a side order of the French fries (I totally regret not trying a milkshake here as well). I've been waiting many years to bite into an In-N-Out burger and I didn't know if the hype was real or not, but boy oh boy, the hype is real. Don't get me wrong, this is not some revolutionary burger that's going to change the way you look at food, but it's the best possible version of a fast food cheeseburger I've ever had and for that, it gets a huge thumbs up from me. The French fries on the side were also really good and had some pretty great seasoning on them also, which made them the perfect companion for that double double.  Overall, my first trip to an In-N-Out was wonderful and they definitely lived up to the hype for me. Will I be hitting more of these up on future trips to the west coast? 100% yes!

photos.caption: Photo of In-N-Out Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. I swear this is not all mine.

qdIwjCuFcRqNQKX4rdIInw.text: "This place was really great. Excellent burgers." I've been to In-n-Out multiple times before but this one tasted the best for sure. It was super busy as expected but the food lived up to expectation. I got the double double burger which was so tender and cheesy, I wish I got another one but the line was insane so I didn't get to. The fries were ok, nothing special in my opinion. It was really hard to find a seat but we got to eventually. The place was super hot, it didn't really seem like they had AC which was a bummer, would've enjoyed the burger more that way but of course there was just way too many people. Overall it was definitely worth the trip to Vegas.   Thank you, In-n-Out...

photos.caption: Photo of In-N-Out Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. In-n-Out Burger
Photo of In-N-Out Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. In-n-Out Burger
Photo of In-N-Out Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Double doubles

RpO7IMcmr-ruHUBgsGKRyg.text: Woohoo! So happy there's an In-N-Out on the strip since my last trip to Vegas. It's crazy busy. Small markup (about 20 cents more per item) compared to what I remember paying elsewhere. That being said, it's amazing value for the strip. Hard to find seats inside... if it's nice, probably best to eat outside in the promenade.  Usual In-N-Out menu... still my favourite fast food burger. Fries are mediocre, but better if you ask them to be well done. 5 stars for their burgers at a price that can't be beat!

8H2_1YxTSejqEpPskf1fWw.text: We finally tried an In and Out. The crowd here as large and they were able to handle it. The food was good but didn't quite meet the hype. We all preferred 5 guys hands down. Still a decent hamburger joint.

9_klasZpfgc4cZIkERFqyQ.text: First stop In-n-out! After checking into the Linq, I headed straight to get me a double double. This location is within walking distance from the Linq hotel, high roller and many other eateries. The lines are long but they move quickly. Don't let the crowd discourage you as the staff get the food out to you rather quickly.  Great location, friendly staff, prompt service ... I'm a fan! I'll be stopping by here again soon before checking out of the

Photo of In-N-Out Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. It&#39;s never too long of a wait for a great burger
Photo of In-N-Out Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Double double and animal style fries.. heaven !

Z20vrrPU5M4KQHfGzT5_Fw.text: Over the last few years, Las Vegas' food scene has evolved - given In-N-Out's success as the West Coast cult favorite, it's great to see the number of locations emerge across the Strip. I've dropped by The LINQ's location several times and did so again this past CES 2019.   My standard order during lunch is the double-double, fries, and a coke (burger and fries animal style). As always, there is a line and a 15 minute wait (but I commend the managers and staff for being as efficient as they are). My meal was served quickly and I ended up eating in the outdoor pavilion area. The burger is always solid - thin, crispy patties with cheese, animal style toppings (chopped grilled onions, thousand island sauce) but the fries, when prepared animal style, require a fork and knife (delicious but very messy).   Overall, a great product, solid pricing, prepared with focus and limited deviation from best practices. It's what makes In-N-Out a success!

photos.caption: Photo of In-N-Out Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of In-N-Out Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of In-N-Out Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States

UO4j5JnkKXEkEmGZB4RZZw.text: I loved it. I was skeptical for sure. I've heard most love it, but those that don't love it, hate it.   We've never had in-n-out before, so if this location sucks, we wouldn't know it, because our experience was great. We went down at about midnight, the line was long, but moved quickly. We ordered, then waited about 5-10 minutes for our food to be done. It was located a short walk from the high roller and right next door to sprinkles cupcakes.   Now, the food. Goodness, it was fantastic. The menu is tiny, but they do what they have well. We got cheeseburgers and animal fries and couldn't get enough. That sauce is something else! The only thing we didn't love was the chocolate shake... just because we've had some amazing shakes. This one was ok, but not amazing.   So, that's it. We are hooked. We don't live in the land of in-n-out, but when we are near one again, we will for sure be stopping!

Photo of In-N-Out Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cheeseburger and animals fries. So freaking good. The sauce is amazing!

kw0D8O6AA1VN1iIhCnlZLg.text: Quick.   Simple.  Fast.  Fresh.  Delicious.    Ticked off all the boxes in a area/location that can be expensive.    First time but not my last time.  Thank

-iUUpcL8hOclGO5v6ixpYg.text: In-n-Out is worth the hype. You can't go wrong with it. I'm sure every Californian will rub in your face that In-N-Out is the best fast food joint out there while all Non-Californians uselessly argue against it. Forget about it, if you're near California, at In-N-Out, and aren't from California, you're gonna lose the argument. Take your opinion elsewhere.  Since I live in Miami, my opportunity to frequent In-N-Out is few and far between - relegated to the times when I am at West coast attending conference. So we tried the double double with animal fries. You won't never go wrong with this. The best part of In-N-Out burgers is that they are not greasy. You don't feel gross after eating one burger. Two, maybe... I'm a huge fan of their French fries. They just taste more potatoey and fresh to me. If you get it animal style, make sure you have mints because your breath will smell like onions! Ah yes, I need not mention the "secret" menu cause everyone and their mother better damm well know it by heart by now.  This is not your usual fast-food restaurant.  This is In-n-Out, and it's earned its reputation. It's undoubtedly very busy when we were there. But the lines went by very quickly and we managed to get our orders in within 10 minutes. And for some reason, despite the craziness, we were still able to find a seat to sit inside. This particular location has great service. The staff are quick, yet are always very personable when you come. I also appreciate how informed they are and not totally lost like other fast food employees. I love their outfits as well!   If you want a quick inexpensive meal, In-n-Out is your fallback option.  You know what you'll get:  high-quality burgers and fries for under 10 bucks.

photos.caption: Photo of In-N-Out Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States

ajKXE0iY3NiVty6FimhUkg.text: Convenient location on the strip for my parents first time at In-N-Out. We ordered cheeseburgers and animal style fries (a must try) and service was surprisingly quick considering how many people were in the store. Inside seating is limited so be prepared to stalk for open tables or bring your food to go.   The burgers are delicious and aren't greasy and feel heavy in your stomach. I've had the fries the past 3 times I've been and they're never as crispy as I would like, so I take off a star for that. Overall, can't beat the price and the quality if you're looking for a quick and cheap eat.

photos.caption: Photo of In-N-Out Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States

32iU4IqgCucOnOYSYwGtJA.text: Glad to see that there is an In n Out on the strip, practically outside the back door to the Flamingo! I scouted this out before I left from Seattle, so I had my hopes up. As expected, reliably good food, just @ Las Vegas prices! Should have run there the night I arrived (11:30 pm) but waited until they opened the next morning @ 10:30. No line, but by the time I left 10 minutes later there was! 3x3 animal+protein style, + a Neapolitan shake. Second trip that night for a quick bite before the Celine Dion concert. My wife, not a burger fan, enjoyed her cheeseburger, daughter also liked her hamburger. Small Company Store window outside, more offered than the regular outlets, but more limited than the full-fledged Company Stores. Picked up a ball cap and two t-shirts.

BYWa0-nEUly74kUUKHwjLw.text: I have mixed feelings about In-N-Out Burger, that is because I'm from the East Coast where we have a cookout but this is not a cook out post in it out burger was a very different type of taste . The burgers are very needy and enormous the latest with the catchup in the mustard mixture made the In-N-Out Burger great I love In-N-Out Burger.The only problem I had about In-N-Out Burger in Vegas was the service was terrible the line was out the door it takes about 45 minutes to get your food you had to wait sit in the hot heat in order for your number to be called other than that they had only four things on the menu so it wasn't a lot to choose from. It was just something to try if you on the west coast !

i_OVSvFLOB4sksu-0TOnmA.text: I have friends who fly home to California, and the first place they go to off the plane is In-N-Out. That being said I had very high expectations going in. People on the east coast often compare it to Shake Shack, but it's far from that. The restaurant was very crowded, the air smelt like fast food, and the tables were all dirty.   I decided to order the animal style fries, which I was very disappointed by. The fries were didn't have much flavor, and the ketchup mayo sauce tasted artificial. I would go back to try the burger and shakes as the prices were very fair, but I wouldn't go back for the fries.

mvpPMZZfvMS5cRqm8VoEHQ.text: I'm so happy they finally added this on the strip! I used to uber off the strip just for this LOL. Great addition to the linq promenade, with all the other bars and businesses around already.  Anyway, this place is busssssyyy (which in n out isn't though). The flow is quick and efficient, probably had 15 people in line but it cleared out within a few minutes. I got so excited for my cheap in n out burger I forgot to ask for animal style on my burger... *face palm*. Ended up asking for the spread and adding it to my burger which will have to do. This is probably the "best" meal to get on the strip if you want something cheap and affordable. I was eating at other restaurants costing me more than $40 each time so this was a major plus in my book.  I love the water fountain area in front of in n out to just sit and enjoy your burger, and just the atmosphere of it all. Perfect November weather for Vegas and perfect view of the high roller and the new zipline they just added!

At this particular location the lines get pretty long and finding a table is a bit of a challenge. The only upside is that bcz your order takes so long you're able to nonchalantly stalk and grab a table before your order number is called.   We tried burgers and fries plain and animal style and it was great going down but this grease sensitive tummy sent it right back up within the hour. The highlight for me was the milk shake.   Would I go again?  Nah.  But i'm happy to say I had the experience.
