Photo of In-N-Out Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of In-N-Out Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States

PqBErgzAACuYwWUOBzxjgQ.text: This location is on the Linq Promenade and is always busy.  Nevertheless, the staff does an amazing job.  They have a good attitude and they are very efficient.

LXqoZD7jzYhCTXlLt8zwOw.text: Good burger. Ok fries. Reminds me of steak n shake. I ate it, but don't think I understand what the hype is really about... Maybe it's just because I'm not a burger person... I dunno.

QX-6nLJPAXSgdwSbawxZKQ.text: Waiting to get our burgers an fries! It's dinner,our last dinner here in Las Vegas! Hamburger is delicious- fries an a chocolate milk shake!

Ky79OGLmxQCayjug1gPm3A.text: The burgers were tender. But it's an average burger nothing to die over. Fries weren't good and salty. Milk shakes are good.

2moe4TcMXeSdC2gvi-6eBA.text: Tastes just like you are in California....no disappointments.  The space is big enough and there is outdoor seating.  The staff is courteous and prompt.  Great experience and great food!

FwsxfZNYQeHy-2fOtF9LRw.text: Was not impressed.... Five Guys and Shake Shack are so much better. The signature sauce is the coverup to the burger (it's there filler since the burger is so thin). While in Vegas if you want a burger... I mean a REALLY good  burger go to Bobby's Burger Palace.... you will enjoy

rlk8hy0NCUh8AtZcqXbvpw.text: Old fashion hamburgers were great just hamburgers w ketchup and mustard. The fries are great. We have to have whenever we fly to Vegas for our annual trip. Can't eat till next year!!!!!!

Hxs3YUYche2klkF1Wk2cnw.text: I don't think I've been to an In N Out any time when it wasn't busy, or even mildly busy... like all the others, this one was a well oiled machine.  We stopped in late afternoon/early evening after flying in that same day from the midwest (can't get in n out in these parts!) and there was a small line, and seating was minimal if at all...but we scored some seats, and given the crowd, we didn't have to wait long for our burgers and fries.  I'm absolutely stoked there is now one of these on the strip since the others require transportation to get to (not walking distance from the strip) and plan on visiting every time I'm in vegas!  I just got back from trip #11 and can't wait to return!

tEUqMxv2HWVqjZ9CNu6BQA.text: No vegan options except a lettuce and tomato sandwich.  Really?  Lousy half cooked fries.  Never again.   I can live without a burger but at least make a decent French fry!

TwD_b2suVpPBO3T2CM8L4w.text: I'm from Socal and this In-n-out is honestly no different than any other in n out. Besides the fact that it is WAY more crowded than the one located off the strip. My friend wanted this instead of tacos el gordo, I was so sad. I guess the location was convenient because it's in the same plaza as the LINQ. It's actually right next door to sprinkles.  I got the double patty w/ cheese protein style and fries. The food was good, my burger wasn't all soggy and dripping with juices like other places. The fries were fresh and crispy.  I docked a star because it's like a massacre in there. The restaurant is so small and there was A CRAP TON OF PPL. You literally have to stalk for a table! It's so awkward standing next to someone half way finishing their meal so that you can get their table when they're done. The wait for food wasn't too bad considering how many people were squished inside this tiny restaurant. A lot of others had to get outdoor seating and even took over Sprinkles' outdoor tables.

d1zSowL09E1lhv9EePy8eA.text: Great! Super busy pretty much constantly but the line to place your order moves deceptively quick!  Friendly workers!  And the usual great food!   Great location!  Thanks!

cpFdzQhOT-BipHBhv27pxg.text: I usually enjoy my visit to in and out but this Vegas location just didn't hit it for me taste wise. However, service was good and quick, also had someone come up to the table to make sure everything was OK. Appreciate the service but food was off during my most recent visit.

photos.caption: Photo of In-N-Out Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Animal Style Fries
Photo of In-N-Out Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Double Double with Fries, both Animal Style

biJiFvZSo2XmDg9n6R7Smw.text: It is In-N-Out, how can you go wrong. This location is so busy that the food is always fresh and fast. The seating area is pretty large too and was appreciated since it was so HOT in summer. It is in the LINQ promenade so it was nice to be able to eat a big burger and walk around.

photos.caption: Photo of In-N-Out Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Double, Double double animal style!

Zi0wo-L7y55yKMeyvWVZdw.text: Location is very convenient if you're staying on the Strip. That's the best thing about it. If you haven't had it before, it's worth to try when you're in Vegas. Always a line.  The burgers and fries, IMO, aren't the best. Good, but nothing to rave about. Shack Shake is better. But try it for yourself, if you haven't tried it.

S7_-2sj9367kU0hR5UwnbA.text: Crazy busy! Not sure if it's because the food tastes good, or because it's one of the cheapest place to get food in Vegas. In my opinion, I think it's the latter.  I got 2 hamburgers: 3/5 - which were just ok. Nothing to write home about.   The secret menu fries which they call Animal fries: 1/5 - toppings consisted of cooked onions, cheese and a sauce that tastes like the thousand island salad dressing). Fries were soggy :(  Don't think I'll eat it again.

photos.caption: Photo of In-N-Out Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Animal fries
Photo of In-N-Out Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of In-N-Out Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States

rDoUEndh0sDNB5PSr8_Kzg.text: Ordered a double double and animal style fries. So amazzzing!! Burger was fresh, juicy! Busy location, but the wait wasn't too long.

photos.caption: Photo of In-N-Out Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Animal style fries and a double double

85pYJePtx54l1MyuXpBDYQ.text: Delicious burgers. Everyone always greets you with a smile and ready to take your order. Fast service. Well kept and clean. They also have a merchandise store next door which is the first in n out I see that has one. So of you are Andie hard fan you can purchase a shirt or some socks to show your love for in n out.

x4t2RHwPMJVm5D6IYsnshQ.text: My first time having In-N-Out. SOOO CHEAP, SOOO WORTH.   Very good burger, but I am an East Coast burger chain girl at the end of the day. The patty is just better at Shake Shack/5 Guys!  This location is pretty busy. I ordered one burger and probably waited 10-15 minutes. During the day, there are so many pigeons outside???!!! They aren't afraid of people, AND THEY FLY CLOSE TO YOUR HEAD. But they disappear during night??

photos.caption: Photo of In-N-Out Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Animal-Style Cheeseburger
Photo of In-N-Out Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States

fGGcdBL0R0wgguRoXcFpIA.text: This was my first In-N-Out experience and I unfortunately wont get many more since I live on the east cost, but the burgers were really good!  I would suggest going animal style but only on the fries because they were quite dry without the sauces. The quality of the burger is evident with your first bite.  As far as price goes you really cant beat it compared to other food you will find in Vegas, butttt you better be ready for a wait.  We went for lunch and it was packed out.  We ended up waiting for the 25 minutes in line and then having to sit outside the restaurant near the fountain.

9s3w0l_pb8bnGwwma0vrDg.text: There is so much hype and rivalry with Shake Shack, Whataburger.....  It wasn't too busy when I went. The line to order was short, but the line to wait for food was all huddling around the drink area. Luckily for me, I only ordered a chocolate shake and animal style fries. Prices are pretty cheap until you want to make it animal style.  Chocolate Shake - $2.50 It was too thick to even drink out of the straw.   French Fries - $2.10 + $2.00 (Animal Style) - I guess I'm just not that big of a fan of In -n-Out like others. It was okay.   I think I prefer Shake Shack over this place. I guess I come hoping it'll be better then the last time.

photos.caption: Photo of In-N-Out Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Animal Style Fries &amp; Chocolate Shake

Qlu1sTnRnyDnOX2HILGRXw.text: In N' Out business model has no flaws. Simple, clearcut menu. Burgers are always freshly-cooked, and the lettuce-tomato-onion always crisp edges. Most quick burger places have the soggy tomato problem, not here.  Employees wear these oversized hats, straight out of Pizza Planet from Toy Story. Speed is a priority, but always have my order right. Food comes in little red lunch trays. Burgers are served with the wrapper support, facing upward. Food presentation checks every box.   This location is newer, and probably the largest In N' Out that I've seen. They're running through people here. Ticket numbers cycle 1-100 throughout the day. I was order #17. By the time I finished my meal, they were on order #94. Talk about speedy gonzalez! Mind..blown !   ANIMAL style is my favorite aspect of In N' Out, which is the Golden Goose of the franchise. Although not featured on the menu, Animal orders smear a blend of sauteed onions and thousand island sauce, to my knowledge. Anything you order can be served animal style.   Milkshakes are mediocre average, but they also don't claim them as a focal point. --PASS--  ***Affordable, quick, delicious. You really do come in, then out. HUGE IMPACT. My only complaint is the lack of locations around the country. Consistent end product, start to finish***

photos.caption: Photo of In-N-Out Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of In-N-Out Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Two Singles, one w/ cheese. Animal style fries !
Photo of In-N-Out Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States

UNiA_bfK2TykFlnxl8ijWg.text: I've been to several in-n-out joints in California and I've always been a huge fan. This location in Vegas gets a 5 star review for service! It was super busy when we went (not surprising) but the employees were all really friendly and nice. I was expecting it to take long because it's pretty typical that it's a long wait. Since I made two different orders, I got them at different times. When I told them which order I was waiting for they reassured me that it is on its way. They kept checking in on me and letting me know where they were at with my second order. I really appreciated how nice they were, it made waiting less annoying haha.   As for the food... one of my favorite burgers ever. I got the double double with onions. I'm not a big fan of the fries but I got well done fries. Finished it all and I was happy! Definitely coming back every time I visit Las Vegas!

photos.caption: Photo of In-N-Out Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States

ED1MXGWeHgca3GOzwvT7Zw.text: I usually have a general rule when eating in Vegas to not order anything that I would normally have back at home. Well, it was around 9pm and I just happened to be walking nearby In-N-Out at the LINQ and so you know, when you crave something you love, you gotta have it! I just ordered my usual two cheeseburgers Animal style without lettuce and tomatoes (bit.ly/2w4yKZl). Just the way I like it and totally hit the spot for me. I didn't order any fries only because I was craving the burgers at the time. This location is pretty similar to the San Francisco location at Fisherman's Wharf. There's no drive-thru, but a ton of tables both inside and outside. Plus the prices are inflated since it's literally on the Strip, but still cheaper than Shake Shack, and even White Castle. Overall, this In-N-Out location is a very welcome addition to the Strip and is another great late night burger option if you're in that area.

photos.caption: Photo of In-N-Out Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Two Cheeseburgers Animal Style, no lettuce, no tomatoes.  Just the way I like it!

3050_NqMX5tE4z_OxDNZpw.text: Just as good as I remember it! Milkshake, cheeseburger, fries, doesn't get much better for the price. Love it and anytime we travel somewhere with an In-N-Out we will definitely be stopping.

photos.caption: Photo of In-N-Out Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of In-N-Out Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of In-N-Out Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States

EcSlZLW76Iva2UDexODEKw.text: I love In-N-Out burger! The last time in Vegas it was the only place we are twice. It's nice to have one on the strip for tourists like me. I really like what they did with this previously unused area. It's quite the attraction now with unique shops, the ferris wheel, and of course In-N-Out! I always get the double hamburger because my sensitive palate can't take any processed 'American' cheese. It's reminds me of plastic and the consistency is quite revolting. I've heard of the 'animal style' but I prefer my onions sauted. I do like their shoestring fries and the unlimited spicy peppers that you can help yourself to.  This location is small but people don't stay long. You could even say they move In-N-Out quickly... I always like to look at the merchandise but I have a hard time buying virtually useless things at those prices. I'd much rather lose it at the roulette table or put it toward 1/10th of a show ticket.  I'll be back for more burgers and fries!

qs9rkdQwYy3IM7FwZp7Ulg.text: Way below average for an In N Out.  Salty patties, limp fries.  Price seems higher than an average In N Out, but can't tell for sure.

ar_5gW7-V9jlnEBm-xK7Pg.text: A lot of hype going into this because I am from the east coast so basically about 13 years I've been dying to try in n out burger. I loved it. So so delicious, and I love the hot peppers they have also by the ketchup. The bun is nice and toasty and makes for an amazing burger. We need one in NY. Line is long but moves fast. You have to play hawk to get a seat though as soon as you see someone getting up you have to strike to get that table.

fI1otwNtaPgGImGThHEb1w.text: Love it! Specially their wrapped in lettuce burger. Keto friendly! And good. Always come back! We need few here in Denver. They are so good! Can't wait to go back!   Keto friendly Menu! Thanks    so good!!

photos.caption: Photo of In-N-Out Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Me
Photo of In-N-Out Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Deliciousness!
Photo of In-N-Out Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Keto approved!

NjKVsyvTQKHqwsxkmApEBw.text: I was surprised this location wasn't open 24 hours given that it's on the strip. It closes at 1:00 AM Sunday - Thursday and 1:30 AM Friday - Saturday. Line was out the door when I got there around 1:10 AM on a Friday. Despite being busy, I still got my food in about 12 minutes.   Double double $4.70 + fries $2.15 + drink $2.00 = $8.85 which is slightly more expensive than locations I've been to in California, but it's forgivable since it's the Vegas strip after all. Tastes great. Tastes like home.   *****  My Star Ratings:  1 Star - Terrible. Just thinking about it makes me angry.  2 Stars - Meh. Unlikely for me to return.  3 Stars - OK. Open to coming back, but wouldn't go out of my way to.  4 Stars - Yummy! Will definitely return if I haven't already.  5 Stars - AMAZING!!! Would plan my day or even a trip around eating here.

photos.caption: Photo of In-N-Out Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Double double (spread only) $4.70 + fries $2.15

tFxHnlPYlTxo_hkVstM0yQ.text: This place is better than expected. During a busy lunch, they had no lines to order and an eight-minute wait. All tables were full but I snuck into Flamingo and found a table.  Tip: order a double meat to save a little money and let the burger flavor come through more.

fchjmJL7DNZBzrA9QjidZQ.text: This place was really busy but we got our food in about 10 minutes. There is a lot of seating but you might have to wait to get a seat considering how busy it gets here. The burger is great, it tasted fresh.

photos.caption: Photo of In-N-Out Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Double cheese burger

9J8Q7OuKUkeO8dd14cohgQ.text: Love this place. It's in the LINQ Promenade in Las Vegas. Like White Castle, there are no In-N- Out Burger places anywhere I live just a few miles south of Washington DC in Northern Virginia. Nearest one is hundreds of miles away and that sucks.   So, I thought d take a stroll through the Linq Promenade to find a place to eat lunch. I was thinking about going to the Tilted Kilt, but then just past it I saw it.... the wonderful, wonderful In-N-Out Burger. There it was in all its glory calling my name. Yes that's where I'd get lunch of course.   I go in and the place was jam packed. But no worries this place is as efficient as a fast food restaurant can get. They had a million people working there. The staff was great!!! Friendly, knowledgeable and nice looking. The store was crowded but it was clean. It was like a Rolls Royce, a fine running smooth machine. The orders were coming out so fast the long line wasn't a problem. I got my food within a couple of minutes.   Outside it was 115 degrees so every table in the place was taken, nobody wanted to eat outside. I stood to eat until a seat came open.   The double bacon cheeseburger was magnificent. Hot, juicy and full of flavor, the bun soft and fresh and the bacon? Well it's bacon so it's good all bacon is good. The fries were pretty damn yummy too. This was an excellent meal. Not quite as good as Gordon Ramsey's Steakhouse at the Paris or Hugo's Cellar at the Four Queens but it was fantastic.   I left feeling full and happy. I wish In-N- Out Burger would move into the Washington DC area.

photos.caption: Photo of In-N-Out Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of In-N-Out Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of In-N-Out Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States

G0cVnF0ElJtN-zJxYpcBPw.text: Always have to come to an in and out when on the west coast at least once.  Animal style double double and animal style fries always good.  Atmosphere has a 80's diner feel to it as well.  The shake was very thick and hard to drink though but managed.  Overall doesn't disappoint.

photos.caption: Photo of In-N-Out Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States

x3L8xaxgE9Idv87TgxdVdA.text: In and Out on the strip?  Genius!  I haven't had one of these in years and it just doesn't disappoint.  $4 for a great burger, loaded with fresh lettuce, a hefty slice of tomato, cheese, generous pickles, and most importantly, that rock on animal sauce.  If that doesn't get you hooked, how about the whole potatoes being cut into fries right in front of you.  Even better, get them loaded with the animal sauce and it's like nothing else you've ever had on top of fries.  There is not a better burger for $4 anywhere.  Only one complaint, when is In-N-Out going to open up on the East Coast?

photos.caption: Photo of In-N-Out Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The double animal style - cause who doesn&#39;t like animal style,...
Photo of In-N-Out Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. A single and a double animal style.

Qew306sN-BEeAVn5eVIZPA.text: The InNout here is busy so the quality kind of dips. I had InNout off the strip and it was amazing, but then had it on the strip a few days later and it was okay . It's still decent but I won't judge InNout by just this location. It doesn't do it justice..

photos.caption: Photo of In-N-Out Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of In-N-Out Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States

ob95b3ouqIBRgetuXvK95Q.text: First time that I have tried this chain, and I must say it is worth the hype! It's nothing fancy, but good burgers and good fries, plus excellent service!   This location is located in the Promenade, and you can't miss it! We went on a Saturday night, and while there was a line, it moved quickly.   My husband and I each had a number one combo, but "Animal Style" burgers and fries. The burger was delicious, and the freshness of the lettuce and tomato really gives a nice taste to the burger. The Animal Style fries are hearty, so be prepared. The cheese, onions, and spread really give a nice taste to the fries, but it is filling!   We definitely will be back, and I'm glad it was worth the hype!

photos.caption: Photo of In-N-Out Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of In-N-Out Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Number One Combo, but &#34;Animal Style&#34; for the burger and fries.

MEGQxtWFIIHgqtu4s4XaYA.text: Pretty standard as far as In-N-Out Burger locations go.  Obviously no drive through as it is off the strip.  This one is very well staffed and open from 10:30 AM till 1 AM. Virtually no wait during off hours, but despite having multiple clerks, when it is lunchtime, dinnertime, or late night rush you will wait a little bit.  Outdoor and indoor seating and very clean.  In terms of the chain in general; if you don't know it's basically the best fast food burger in the country.  Check out the not-so-secret menu online.  Animal style fries and animal style burgers are The Truth.

-1az6V6IQqrMnjHffbqj8Q.text: Just off the strip, so really easy to get too.  It's next to The LINQ and under the zip lines.    Came here on a Saturday late afternoon thinking it won't be busy.  Completely wrong. It was packed!  But they were well staffed and the line moved quickly.  Not a long wait for the food either.    We went with a double double and fries.  Delicious!   I compare it a bit to Five Guys.  But it does have its own flavor and style.  I like how they serve the burger half wrapped and laying down.    We sat outside and the guy cleaning tables checked on us to see if things were ok.  He even brought us extra napkins.  Excellent service!

photos.caption: Photo of In-N-Out Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Double Double and fries

wcQluj53fp-Yo3ybm62XIA.text: So, food wise this is an In N Out, the same as any other In N Out. I got a protein style 3x3 (tomatoes, onions, and lettuce--healthy, right?). I rate In N Out as the best fast food burger chain in the country.  As you might expect given its location, the atmosphere is chaotic. I've never been to a location that wasn't very busy, but even by these standards, this place is booming. As in, I think they were serving orders in the 30s and my order was 84.  You might think that would entail a crazy wait but it did not. Within fifteen minutes I had my food in my hands.  Now, finding a seat is a bit of a different story--i should have grabbed one once I poured my water. Instead I dutifully waited until I had the order, and then looked for a seat. And looked. And looked. I had some fries while I waited. Finally a seat opened up, yay!  This is wedged into an area that has no cars, only foot traffic. So if you go by Uber just have them drop you off at the Flamingo.

kCVXzZScH3V39OwAY53ihw.text: Stopped in during a walk through the Vegas strip. I've had In-N-Out before and decided to go ahead and have a burger for lunch.   We stopped in and they had a line out the door, but got everyone through in a short span of time. The team was very quick with orders and efficient.   I got the double double which is standard with fries and a drink.  Burger came out on about 10 minutes and was delicious and greasy as is what you would expect going to In-N-Out. For some reason, I had a very thick slice of tomato in mine.  I enjoy tomatoes, so its no big deal.    Inside was a little packed and had to share tables with strangers, and it was a little dirtier than I would've liked, but that's no fault of the staffs because the restaurant always seems to be absolutely packed.   Either way, you know what you want when you come here, a good fast food burger, and that's exactly what you'll get.    I highly recommend stopping by here if you get the chance.

VsNbnCLMGEe4-EYVBmz_OA.text: Mark this off my bucket list!!! Great fast food and I mean freaky fast!!! My wife got the single cheese combo and so did my son. I decided to do the double combo. This place was packed but they got our order out In less than 5 minutes (I'm impressed)!!! This is not a Military friendly place.

photos.caption: Photo of In-N-Out Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Double it was huge
Photo of In-N-Out Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Single combo
Photo of In-N-Out Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Menu

YpMTwTiksvbyw3JLnOmVDA.text: I really like In-N-Out Burger! I know people have really strong feelings about it, and my feelings aren't nearly on that level, but if I'm around an In-N-Out, I'm definitely going to eat there! Now, that may stem from the fact that I live in an area where In-N-Out doesn't exist, so it's a novelty for me. But, I also truly enjoy it. I think the food is great!   I've never had a bad experience at In-N-Out. I've always had fast friendly service, and my food has always been hot and fresh. If you're looking for a casual burger spot, I think In-N-Out Burger is a fine choice!

photos.caption: Photo of In-N-Out Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of In-N-Out Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of In-N-Out Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States

JyRRE2C0AClx-fStojl0EA.text: I usually LOVE in-n-out burger but this one just isn't the same. I can here with a group of friends around 4:30pm and after we looked in our bag we noticed we were missing fries! But we didn't want to go back in that long line. Usually all the food is there but this one lacked attention to detail - so double check your bag before you leave!!  I ordered a regular cheese burger and animal style French fries. The burger was good - as always! But the fries here - oh my - it was sooo salty and dry! If this place wasn't so convenient I'd pass on it!!

U9nL8CCIpbicfs1DmEhatg.text: Don't let the line fool you. This team turns out orders quickly. There isn't, however, much room to sit. So, I recommend being considerate and not lingering after your meal. If you chose to eat here, eat and then go and let someone else sit and enjoy their meal. Also, the price of the meal is great as far as vegas goes but I wouldn't go out of my way to go here again. Maybe I've grown out of fast food but I didn't love the quality of the food. The location was clean, the staff was on point, it was just that the burger was super greasy and my fries weren't very warm. I think everyone should try it once and see what you think :)

oYHXS3hpGcugbI07p6Ic6Q.text: Alright, so we went to Las Vegas for my Sons 15th birthday.  We asked him what he wanted to do while we were there and the only thing he really wanted was to eat at In-N Out burger. So there were a few sprinkled thru out the city and we chose one on the strip. Upon arrival obviously this place was no secret, and a popular place. The menu is pretty basic and it's easy to make up your mind as you either get a single or a double. Combo meals are optional.  I opted for a dbl and both my son and wife both had singles, we all had fries which are the skinny type almost like string fries if you will. The burgers were decent but honestly I could have probably eaten 2 of the doubles. I am a bigger fella but honestly comparison wise I do get full on Wendy's/McDonald's double burgers. But dont get me wrong they were a different animal on the fast food chain and we did ask the local Lyft drivers thier opinions and one said definitely once a week, and the other at once a month so its definitely on everyone's radar. If your by one give it a shot, and honestly if we had them here in Denver we would probably have this in our rotation of quick bite spots.  And yes, we did enjoy our meals.

photos.caption: Photo of In-N-Out Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Menu, not hard to decide.
Photo of In-N-Out Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 1 Double, double burger 2 singles and fries
Photo of In-N-Out Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fully staffed

IDxyEo9uVNjEO6vmlpr7hQ.text: Super super nice staff!  Super CLEAN kitchen. Unbelievable how clean it was. They are open 24hrs and extremely busy after shows/late night.

yOD_Sq8AISgIpJJHlsmBxA.text: Sometimes all one needs is a good fast food burger.  So when we were looking for a burger place, seeing this In-N-Out at the Linq Promenade was a very welcome sight.  To no surprise, this location on the Las Vegas Strip was even busier than most of the other branches I have stepped into.  They are also a bit larger as well.    Just like the others, the service at this In-N-Out was really good.  With regards to the food, the cheeseburger was yummy as expected.  The fries, though, were not as good.  They tasted a bit old which was disappointing.  Still, I'd drop in again for future fast food burger cravings in Sin City.

Photo of In-N-Out Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lines are long, but go by quickly.

a2YlP-Wd534I9emU8hzgIQ.text: They have the best burgers... I love me some animal style!  This food ally by the high roller was a nice addition for Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of In-N-Out Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Two double doubles and two fries animal style.

wQMpOCVS0Z1b0jlroDTMYA.text: Hit the spot, just what I wanted. This time I went really easy, double hamburger. Quick & easy. Good service. However, I did receive 7 dimes as change instead of fewer coins.

rAOgxkRbcLbGOtcvWP1U2A.text: Great burgers on toasted buns that were delicious.  Very friendly, efficient and welcoming staff.  Check it out.  I promise you won't be disappointed.

sGsjUwY0ztWSE7A-AR-vcg.text: Cold, stale fries, thin meat patties. Next time I'll go to White Castle.

zDHGfaCJskXghE2rXCQTyw.text: Burger was pretty good but lettuce was just packed on it.   Pretty good burger.  Fries were awful and gross.  Old and taste about day old and dry.    I would have asked for new ones but chaos in the restaurant.    Burger was good but did not come close to shake shack.  In and out good and shake shake Awesome.   Not even close

Cqze8CNcTY-gQ6CpJ7QY0Q.text: The burgers are the best...especially the toasted buns.  The fries are like potato sticks.  Love their hot peppers!

4bTS2CAjBF0LtJAGRb1JPA.text: What an over hyped chain. Let's start at the basics, the fries, nothing special, got them animal style and regular, go with the animal style. It's a basic burger which many west coasters over hype for no reason. There is no flavor in the meat, small patty that' over cooked. Stick with Gordon Ramsey BURGR in Vegas, so much better. Don't understand the hype behind this chain. Wouldn't go back again.

nVJSc-4rsbEDAWoDYcAJag.text: Was not impressed by In & Out.  It was very crowded with a line out the door.  The person taking orders was very friendly and they did have a couple of kids continuously cleaning the floor and clearing tables.  However, the food was sub par.  It took a while for the order (yes, i know they were busy) but you would think that with that many orders they would be constantly  making fresh fries, but 'no'.  And worst, not only were the fries not hot but they were like cardboard lacking flavor and dry not moist on the inside.  The best part of the burger was the lettuce and tomato.  The meat was tasteless.  Not sure it is worthwhile to go there just to say you have been to an I&O burger

6zPLSIQ8cnlNZwooe4m6Jg.text: Visited Las Vegas last weekend and I was excited to try this place! The line was long, but it moved quickly. Also the food is cheap and tasty! Can't wait to have it again one day.

8QPxzt3Eo_Nd5DOOu-NGjQ.text: All I'm saying is that this place has been extremely hyped up and when I finally get to try it... I leave disappointed. The burgers tasted good and the fries were okay but it wasn't all it's been hyped up to be. The best part about it was that it was way cheaper than everything else in the area.

HXa2vtehPRVw2wOiAGDSEA.text: If Their was a 0 star I would give it to them. I came from New York to visit Vegas everyone keeps taking about in n out burger i was like let's try it out. Had the food after not even 10 minutes my stomach was killing me. Had food poisoning shake shack will always be the best. I am happy I try it in n out burger first and last time.

EmTLXARGxF66qIu7RbhUTA.text: I cant recall giving out a 5 star review , but this place gets one! Not only the Vegas strip location, but other In N Out locations that I have visited. They are all consistent. best burger ever / period..... double double w raw onions , mustard only......keep it simple for me. 5 guys / no comparison shake shack / nope  it just doesn't get better. maybe because In N Out is not available in Ohio , and we only get out west every other year or so , but this place is the bomb . com!

qaaEZz1p_LwdMiso75mBTA.text: My husband is from California. We just landed and both of us were on the hangry stage. So when we got to Vegas we went straight to the Linq area. For him to get his favorite animal style burger and fries.  This is a chain and it was exactly what my husband wanted.

3TCWsYrA__JWuVrA2MPnbQ.text: We were so happy to hear there was a new In-N-Out Burger on the strip and couldn't wait to check it out. Coming from the Midwest where In-N-Out Burgers don't exist, we especially appreciated that we can now eat here during our trips to Vegas without having to leave the strip. We came here on a Wednesday shortly after they opened for lunch and it was packed. The line to order went out the door, so we had to wait quite a while to order, and then a bit to get our food. The restaurant isn't very big (was hoping for more seating), but it was clean, and there were a few tables outside. When we finally got our food, it was delicious. It's so great to have an affordable yet good place to have lunch on the strip-something we've been wanting for a long time. We'll definitely be back!

p94kc96AN8efaCppiCtksA.text: The best burger I've ever had. Reasonable prices too and nice staff. If you are really hungry make sure to get the animal fries.

-UAW979oTw5rKHQ7rL0trw.text: It's your average burger place. It was way too crowded and the best thing about it is that you can out "animal style" on your burger.

photos.caption: Photo of In-N-Out Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of In-N-Out Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cheeseburger with fries and animal style sauce on the burger and fries.

6o9CvONeLIA6BeECC0r_Cg.text: LOVE In-N-Out and brought my boyfriend here last night for his first time. It was really busy but the employees working were really nice and so patient.

gCD93Ys9eo0SuduPOOqBGA.text: Not as good as good as Whataburger, P Terry's, Mighty Fine, Dans or Fran's.  I used to think these guys were the top of the fast burger chain 10 years ago.  Maybe they should have just stuck to california as they definitely lost something over the years.

5I08f4UwH14qlT1-oDRwoA.text: Secret Menu: giph.site/v.php?pm=5BRE Take some to-go for a friend and they will thank you. Good eating!

eMtqSSsfCTzfI17oMxEqPA.text: Tried the new location on the Strip, there was a very long line but we moved through in about 10 min. Food was great as usual, Fast and Friendly service as well.

AiCZ32kXWkKImax6xPlNYQ.text: We arrived in Vegas from Ohio after a long day of traveling and just wanted something to eat that was fast and delicious. When I saw In-N-Out burger I had to try it. We do not have these in Ohio! The menu is very small- the focus is the burger. First off, this is Vegas, so there was an annoying guy in front of me yelling, picking up pennies, calling the cashiers "cute and sexy", and flamboyantly twirling around the restaurant. Not In-N-Out's fault but oh boy it was about to ruin my experience. Anyway, the service line was fast and efficient. I ordered the double double with fries and a drink. It was amazing! The burger was juicy and tasty. It had lettuce, tomatoes, onion (white), and a special sauce. Yum yum yum. The fries are "hand cut" and thin and I actually thought that I was going to like them more than I did. They were a bit bland. Not too bad though. I'm very critical when it comes to the taste and crispiness of my fries. This meal was much needed and so worth every calorie! If you need something fast, delicious, and cheap....come here!

photos.caption: Photo of In-N-Out Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States

N82_W6tdnc-hUeTi0rTlXA.text: I am so happy that an In N Out Burger is now on the strip. During my previous Vegas trips, I would cab out to the In N Out. Yeah, I'm dating myself here because there was no Uber back then.  This is solid. I love this place. You can even get only a piece of lettuce and a tomato slice alone (no meat, sauce, pickles, onion or bun) if you want to feel like you are dieting. I don't know if that has a secret menu name, but they'll do it for you and it made the fries I ate with it ok to eat after all  In N Out is so good. I love this place and am happy to say that it is of the same great quality as the ones in California. Yay!  Check out the little merchandise store outside and pick up a t-shirt or keychain just for fun!

Rw2H78hOxC33YGaSf9nDLg.text: So happy for having In and Out in the strip. Always great quality, very fast service with great staff and gosh delicious cheese burger with my favorite chilly peppers and for sure sweet price for late dinner.

qlcCNcOn6v9z8uUhRwPw0w.text: Never disappointed by the quality of food especially when we were taking newbies to In and Out experience. It is a walk if you are staying at places like the Bellagio.   A downside is that inside seating is limited and some people just hang out since there is ac. They do gave blockd off outside seating which is great but not when its 108 degrees outside.

nQaYzI0B1goWg4dJ_P8KCQ.text: I am from Rhode island and it was my very first time going to an In-N-Out burger spot. I wish we had them on the East coast. Id eat this all the time instead of Mcdonald's or Burger King.... their burgers are everything ! Love their fries too! Very cheap and fast service... I will be returning soon in the future.

_JmRI3n2D2hEqFWZN3iARw.text: Was expecting the best burger since the hype for this place is out of this world. So I got everything animal style and the meal was just okay. IMO way better than McDonalds but not near as good as FiveGuys. Glad I could say I've tried their food.

photos.caption: Photo of In-N-Out Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States

hoxIk3NVoDmttegLYERz2w.text: Big fan of the burgers here, double double Animal style all day, with fries and a chocolate shake. Drive thru is always slammed and even if you go inside you are still going to wait 5-10 mins for most orders, I think it's worth the wait, but if you are in a rush, head somewhere else

fckDLYBF5wFGNhNXd5SoWA.text: Got a chance to check out In-N-Out for the first time on my trip to Vegas. It's totally worth the hype! Had the Double Double and Animal Style fries multiple times during my stay, and still couldn't get enough of it. Be prepared for long lines at the counter.

ueUfmk8615TsBwO4KIGfGg.text: I love in-n-out burger! Every time I'm on the west coast it's usually my first stop. This location had a friendly staff and the burgers and fries were great! This place was super busy, and we didn't have to wait long at all!

Nlr_U018HCA-z30TaD-rAA.text: I FINALLY TRIED IN-N-OUT BURGER!! I went to Vegas for my birthday and lo and behold there was an In-N-Out Burger down the street from my hotel. This particular location is in between Harrah's and the Linq hotels. I got there around 2AM and I was surprised that it was not packed. The inside is well lit and looks very clean. The menu is extremely small which I thought would mean faster service. Thankfully my friend ordered for me and I got a double animal style with animal style fries. Animal style means thousand island dressing with grilled onions. The burger was delicious! Nice toasted bun, crispy lettuce, perfectly grilled onions, on top of melted cheese on a grilled meat patty. I was more blown away by it at 2AM than at 7PM the next night. The staff was very friendly and patient. They have a ketchup and hot pepper station which I loved because those are two of my favorite things to add to my burger! Now the fries also came animal style. Thankfully because they were not seasoned and were like thin straw fries. Not a fan of those. All in all, the burgers were pretty good but I was not blown away. I'll stick to 5 Guys or even Cookout.

photos.caption: Photo of In-N-Out Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Double double animal style with animal style fries and hot peppers from their condiments bar
Photo of In-N-Out Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Animal style cheeseburger with animal style fries
Photo of In-N-Out Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States

BZrpIKj2Ys6-a3khz2nkcA.text: How dare some lame group of people crown Five Guys over this place.  My order: 3x3 , no spread, no tomatoes, regular whole onion, lettuce, cheese, and chopped chilis. (I sometimes go protein style when I don't want bread.)  Having the burger dry (but still juicy) and with no tomatoes really lets you taste the crispness and quality in the meat.  The fries aren't amazing but they're not bad. Cheese fries are amazing. Animal style fries if you're game.  Their house lemonade is also in a league of its own.

1DDGmoTUCq4MhFIUrlLkGw.text: First time to eat here... delicious. Next time I'm out west-ish... I'll be back. Long line... moved fast... good people watching.

pZbZ0Bp2oGIq5Q_gpKYnSQ.text: I'm probably in the minority here but I did not love In N Out. The burger was good, but nothing to write home about. The fries were terrible. I'm a fry addict and I wanted nothing to do with these. Glad I tried it but it definitely didn't live up to all the hype.

photos.caption: Photo of In-N-Out Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States

xtA0eun2SBAIuzj-cFTTXA.text: I finally went to in and out burger after hearing about it and seeing it on tv. I thought the burger was very good because it was simple and I loved the toasted bun. Although the fries seemed bland and dry to me. Great experience and glad I tried it!

photos.caption: Photo of In-N-Out Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States

yBhP9KxSpqgf_b2hicEJ1Q.text: First time experience of the West Coast burger place. The burger wasn't bad at all. The plain fries I could of done without. Was a overall good experience and great price as well.

photos.caption: Photo of In-N-Out Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Actual product. Friendly service

RJrsS4Y03lKZd6PyxFevxA.text: Ate here with family while walking The Strip. Fast service, and a very tasty burger. Tasted like a better quality Big Mac. Will definitely eat here again when I'm in the area. Wish they had an In and Out in Florida. Oh well. Hopefully later down the line

photos.caption: Photo of In-N-Out Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States

QMaVaMXPwKWSgTLIgyp0rA.text: Who doesn't love In-N-Out? Even as cram packed as it I had great service with a smile, my order was accurate and timely, and it was very clean inside

ozDvJWrX8cZL-gTJSmLf_A.text: Even though they were busy, they filled the orders quickly. Food is always great. Good to see they have not jacked up the prices since they are on the strip.

amxJ43_ri8VP6UChcqUDYg.text: Let's cut to the chase.  Awesome food and great customer service. Came here on vacation and was amazed at how quickly they got us served. Their special sauce was out of this world.

63oehdU4BAGkZ2ONCsQHBg.text: this place was a mad house yelling out order numbers like it was bingo night! People every where waiting for the icon of a burger!  It was however a very delicious sloppy juicy burger, thanks for the burger wrap or I would have had that special sauce all over my clean crisp white t-shirt!  The fries ahh normal fries but it all was served up hot fresh and delicious!  Sit out side by the fountain and watch all the beautiful honeys walk by!  I love Vegas!

photos.caption: Photo of In-N-Out Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Juicy sloppy In &amp; out burger!!! Oh so good!

ZzHqT6m1rECCyzLSKDLMiw.text: I live in SoCal so of course I'm accustomed to In-N-Out Burger and I'm super happy that they've opened up a few in Las Vegas. It was a pleasure to see the location and to finally have a meal that didnt cost me and my wife $30+ dollars; lol  I had the Double-Double Protien style with whole grilled onions and some animal fries.  I've occasionally met a few people who don't think that this is the best burger out there but those people have no joy in their hearts.

6Qu_9RkYa41062s1raaTuQ.text: You could NEVER go wrong with In-N-Out. Whenever I am in the west coast I have to grab some tasty burgers from this joint! We stayed in Vegas for about a week and we went to this location twice and it was always packed! Even with how packed it was, the employees were GREAT with receiving and putting out orders. The pricing for this delicious burger is unbeatable. I just wish they would expand and come over to Florida!

rzaxUc9CBBhGRZhay0nIlw.text: You either like In-N-Out, or you don't. I happen to love it - can't get over how little everything costs - but the sheer amount of people in such a small space was overwhelming. They have it down to a science, but I found myself crammed amongst a bunch of strangers for 15 minutes while I waited for my food, and then we had to eat outside in the heat because there were no tables left inside. It hit the spot but I don't know that I'd go back to this location in particular.

bzJQcYw6udwhvk2S0uxFzg.text: Definitely an excellent place to go to eat a good burger although the chips were a bit burned

ubbIwo0aHyQZdhx4nVsyVA.text: This is the first time my hubby and I tried out this location. The last time we were in town this didn't exist. We ordered fries animal style, regular fries, cheeseburger and a Choco/ vanilla shake. I must say the quality wasn't as good as the one off strip. The place was extremely busy (labor day weekend) long wait for food.  The fries were good with all the fixings, but the plain fries were kind of cardboard like. The burgers also lacked the flavor that we remember. After we finished this meal, we already decided that we will head to dean Martin location before flying back to east coast.

photos.caption: Photo of In-N-Out Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Animal style fries, so so good
Photo of In-N-Out Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Crowded Labor Day weekend
Photo of In-N-Out Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cheeseburgers, must ask for extra spread!

z41ZosNULcJi3L841360vA.text: Pretty good service. Good price for a meal.   The downsides are: long lines + missing sitting places.

O_vSjGSaQ6VF4M1bxCjXwA.text: Let me start off by saying that I'm a picky eater. I don't like tomato, onions, or pickles on my burger. In the past 6 months I've been to this location 3 times, and every time they screw something up. I usually just take off whatever they left on and call it a day though. Want your fries well done? Probably not going to happen. Personally, I would suck up the Uber ride and head across the highway to the other In-N-Out where they'll actually get your order right. If you don't have any modifications and just want a burger, I'm sure it'll be fine. Oh and don't let the line fool you, they bust out orders fairly quickly!

SU03vQUmcpJ-c2FILRDHAg.text: I have had In-N-Out Burger in Los Angeles.  This is a poor representation of the restaurant.  Buns were dry French fries WAY salty and I was soooo upset. All we talked about before our trip was that we were going to eat at in n out burger.

L3wifJBzmIPhZPdjaRjjgA.text: Honestly, not sure what all the hype is.  The burger was average and so were the fries, and the line was too long.  I'm a bigger fan of Shake Shack for sure.

HiwF8S6QF6zj9_Ajfn0hJg.text: SUPER CHEAP!!  This is located in Vegas and it was a wallet saver for sure! They have very small menu so it's really easy to decide what you want.  Their food was not bad for the price. Their staff are nice and friendly as well. I like how everything was simple.  It's extremely busy so you gotta wait a bit and I guess that's the downside of it.  Their milkshake was excellent too! I gotta have more of those next time I go!

zuXlO-lXlnYY213h0x3YOg.text: You always hear from the West coast cult that In-n-Out is the best burger ever. I would have to humbly agree, the double double Animal style was outrageous! I really didn't know what Animal style was but heard it on TV. In-n-Out burgers makes Shake Shack seems like a poor relation. Sorry Shake Shack, In-n-Out is the clear winner

photos.caption: Photo of In-N-Out Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Double Double Animal style with fries

_Vt4TBt_nawtLPIZ2-rXFA.text: First time at In-and-Out and it was everything I expected. Busy restaurant is it good sign! Burger came out super hot and delicious, animal fries were ok and vanilla shake on point.

photos.caption: Photo of In-N-Out Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States

XJaJIphS4AEkRlkP2-x3Dg.text: I love In n Out and since I love it so much I know the menu and the prices. Today I was down with my work and I got a burger only and burger at it was 5 dollars. As a local it sucked but it is what it is. I normally pay 6.60 bucks for the mean so be ready for inflation major inflation. The burger was good like always but the prices suck

zERCUcuLbOC1miP9pqZjDw.text: They were just okay. It was my first time having In-N-Out and I was not blown away at all. They were just plain regular burgers. Their animal style fries were good but nothing to rave about. I thought that their price was really inexpensive which is a plus. Their customer service is also a plus because they were all so nice and accomodating. Overall, it's good for what it is.

photos.caption: Photo of In-N-Out Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of In-N-Out Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of In-N-Out Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States

XUTuYlP-gCKwgG24iIYZdw.text: Why bother writing a review about this place - it's very clearly and indisputably a 5 for no other reason than quality taste, perfect pricing, great service, and consistency among all locations. It is by far one of the only fast food restaurants I am happy giving a 5 for. Haters and some East Coasters may never understand, but West Coast folks do.

IkJq7bqlQnIxbPESO-Kpfw.text: This place is way overrated and we waited forever to get our food! waited in line at least 15 minutes before my order was taken and after I placed it waited at least 10 minutes more before we got our food! The burgers are delicious and fresh. However they put an entire slice of onion on my burger which ruined the taste and over powered everything else. Also did not put enough of their secret sauce on the bun and their french fries are godawful!  they have hardly any taste at all and are not seasoned with anything. Most of the fries were white in color when they should be a golden yellow maybe because they were not cooked enough but either way they were terrible. Strawberry milkshake tasted great but it was too thick to go up the straw I would take Red Robin over this place any day and get a lot more food, much better tasting fries and much faster service for about the same price!!!

photos.caption: Photo of In-N-Out Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of In-N-Out Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of In-N-Out Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States

kpB3t7DQffje_WNlUJLTCg.text: The double double and the double double animal style were quite good. However, the regular fries and animal style fries were average at best. The chocolate shake just didnt do it for me chocolate wise.

hPw2xdo40169gLFLiPDnsA.text: I have heard great things about In-N-Out burger so the expectations were high. To be honest, the experience reminded me of a 5 Guys. I will say the burgers were very good and the service was excellent. The place was jam packed with people in the heat of a Las Vegas night, and the service was quick and the staff were all very attentive and accommodating. Our one compliant was that our fries were cold and underwhelming. I rate it 3 stars because I wasn't blown away by my experience but the burger was decent. Good not great. Definitely a cheaper option along the Las Vegas strip and it is in a happening and cool area.

photos.caption: Photo of In-N-Out Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Single Cheeseburgers at In-N-Out

hPTdaOnKo3vY6Tib15IZ3Q.text: ALWAYS A MUST IN VEGAS!!!!!! Get yourself a double double and some animal fries and your set!!!! Make sure you get the yellow peppers. They are a little spicy and fresh after every bite of the burger.

tJITxr6cZ4TKZczhgms_9Q.text: Had the cheeseburger and fries last night. Fries weren't crunchy at all. Disappointing. I figure fries are supposed to have a crunch factor? Right?! Wasn't worth the hassle to replace them. It was complete chaos in there as customers were purposely standing in front of your table as you ate while waiting for you to get up and leave.

aHS5tbW8TRWHeF3ZAZGTqA.text: Just reviewing this location.  It meets the superior standard of what I expect from In-N-Out.  Helpful efficient staff for both orders and keeping the place clean.  Handles a very large crowd efficiently and is a pleasant place to sit down and get out of the crazy intensity of the strip.  For Vegas, prices are very reasonable.  They have a nice gift shop window that you do not find in most other locations as well.

BoeX8AsJqAIGqEfvJQu9hQ.text: Ok food for decent price ..  The Good: people behind the counter were nice to speak to. Food was ok  The Bad: wait time was 15 mins which seems to be not too bad.  The Ugly: none  Final thoughts: stop by if you crave cheap burger and can wait 15-30 mins, I personally think Wendy's  tastes better.

jZnbpAjPAiHCtfK031CkEw.text: We have eaten at many In-N-Out Burgers and this one was exceptionally good!  We went in on a busy Friday night and our sandwiches were amazing.  I usually am not a huge fan of their fries but the fries we got here were actually really good! I would highly recommend this location.

amjofg4r7rZ6-NzHSmo4OQ.text: When the opportunity presents itself, one  must try In-N-Out Burger at least once in their life.  Sorry, vegetarians and vegans - you're missing out on one of the best burgers on the West Coast.  This location can get super packed.  Finding a table will be the toughest thing you will encounter.  Although it gets packed, food is flying out to you, so don't get too comfortable.

c84wqnzOL1ZFiORmmQqiVA.text: Hey, it's In-N-Out Burger. What more do you need to say. If you're west of the Mississippi, you should stop in and give it a try. The burgers a fine. The fries a good. The lines are LONG. I don't know why. It's not that good, but I do like it. Pretty basic menu. This location is across from the Linq hotel about 150 yards off the strip. I ate here around 5:30 pm. I'd say late night the lines are stupid long.

CA3nIoAY6yohtNyKerURuA.text: We only come here for will. For how long the lines were we got our food quick and it was amazing.  The lines move quick and the staff is very friendly as I said especially will.

photos.caption: Photo of In-N-Out Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Long line but they move fast!!!

fZl0ZC0HU5Q9V_rFtVPAcg.text: The food here is so satisfying to my taste buds. The fries are so perfectly not salted I'm unnecessary salt  always always ALWAYS satisfied

qWqoDtb2Wn85hN1WGJM7wA.text: It almost feels pointless to review In N Out on  Yelp. What can be said that hasn't already been said? And regardless of what people on Yelp say or don't say, In N Out will always be packed. In n Out should just be given 5 stars on Yelp permanently. Anyone who gives it less than 5 stars should not be allowed to review restaurants.   But now that they are on the Strip in Las Vegas, it behooves me to add yet another 5 star review in the hopes of helping fellow tourists find the best casual food option on the Strip.  In N Out is the gold standard by which all other fast food restaurants should be measured. They value their customers and not just in a lip service type of way. Their restaurants are clean, bright, and shiny. They have a staff of smiling, hustling, efficient workers who can move long lines that would have caused a catastrophic meltdown at other restaurants. They will not compromise on the quality or freshness of their product. They only have a couple items on the menu so that they can do their thing (burgers and fries) and do it exceedingly well. Their burgers are everything that people hype them up to be and more. And "fairly priced" doesn't even do justice to their prices because they could DOUBLE their prices and I would still go there the same amount without batting an eye.   Unsurprisingly, I found this location is the same as all of the other In N Outs I have been to in terms of the above qualities. Go. You will not be disappointed.

JraNuH8XipkXPTb2E-y1cQ.text: Besides having literal Nazi's (the biggest talker had a great big Reich eagle tattooed on his forearm and proudly displayed it for all to see) talk shit about us the entire time me and my Jewish girlfriend were in line, they served 14 other people before they got our order out, and served it right next to order 88. In n out is run by and serves literal Nazis. Who knew? I won't be back, but I think that was the point they were trying to make.

_V4Ta7Ikyu_UeJjWIzUXaA.text: Sooooo this was my first time eating here and I must say it was chaotic. When we walked in we were first in line, we both got the double burger, 1 regular fry, 1 animal fry. We got our number, turned around, and there were probably a crowd of 60/70 ppl waiting for their food. Figuring it'll take a while, we looked for seats. There is a tiny sitting area outside and half of the restaurant has seating, a lot of ppl opt in to sit on the fountain outside. As you can imagine, it's tough finding a seat. Luckily for me, I have no shame in preying on tables and quickly found a seat where a couple was just finishing up. It was about a 10-12 minute wait and then deliciousness. The burger was great, they put their signature animal sauce on it and it was very satisfying. The animal fries were A LOT, there was cheese, caramelized onions and topped with a ton of animal sauce. I've never heard of onions on fries before, but I was feeling adventurous and I'm glad I was. While I enjoyed them, they are definitely not something I would get every time, because like I said, it's a lot. I could not eat all of my fries, I was stuffed after that burger. AND it was the cheapest meal I had in Vegas, only about $21 for 2 ppl. This is a franchise I will definitely be supporting again.

photos.caption: Photo of In-N-Out Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Nom noms

ctsDbpQ8_RqZLq0DXzTimw.text: Great fast food place! The animal fries are some of the best I've ever had! Great food all around.

3eNlL8D-nTG5D3AAE0bJkA.text: This is easily the worst In-N-Out anywhere in the country. Forget about the average service and complete lack of hospitality (which you get in spades in most other In-N-Outs), what does this location in is pricing. You will easily pay 30%-40% above standard In-N-Out prices for the same food. I get that the location is in a tourist mall on the Vegas Strip, but when you go to the Starbucks in the same location you pay standard national pricing. If a megalith like Starbucks can do it, why can't a Christian company like In-N-Out do the same?

_iei9P1XiXT6PpmyOqm8iQ.text: They don't have an In-N-Out where I live, so while on a trip to Vegas, I thought I'd try it out. It's a pretty decent burger. The fries seemed like they sat around for about 10 minutes and were not very hot. They also seemed dried out and not salted. Kind of hard to believe that they would be served that way, since the place was absolutely busy.   I will definitely stop by again if I get the chance.

YjuGpb8sU75sbL5cjmhS-Q.text: I ordered the Number #1 Meal double double animal style. Animal style is usually FREE I dont know if it is suppose to be Free here on the strip or not,but I was charged 4.50 for Animal Style Fries,and full price for the shake witch was 2.50. Instead of paying 8.xx something plus tax. I was charged $14.00 dollars total,ya thats right $14.00 dollars!!!!!. When my food was ready the double double had barely any onions or sauce on it, I asked the girl can I get extra onions. than I asked why am I being charged full price for a shake when I asked for the number #1 should just be a upgrade of a 1.xx something of small change,and she couldnt answer,or explain SHIT to me, very Stupid,Young,and Dumb. They food tasted like Crap out of a cleanser sink. So I went to in and out on Nellis and Charleston today to see what would happen if I ordered the #1 off the Strip. I got 2 numbers #1 for a little over $20.xx bucks plus tax. I was dumb founded. If at all possible I would go to the ones off the strip,or be sure to asked if they charge extra for how you want your food. I have photos of last night and today I will also be posting to show you the difference in Quality too!!!
