Photo of In-N-Out Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. On the strip next to the Link

KIt0wr6hzFlnZcfD2M3mSw.text: Um no, small patty to many tomato that made it appear bigger blah! Phone died so I couldn't take a pic.

3yyjStsMNQ9SI0Z7dFS6OA.text: The line was long, but it went pretty quick.  I've only had In-N-Out once before, the burger was really great but the fries were awful. Very bland, zero seasoning and not crispy at all.  So I wouldn't repeat the fries but I would definitely get the burger again.

3uTg_BpuDhzUD5nWKOz21A.text: Very busy and the air inside was heavy with grease but they were fast, friendly, and the food was, as always, delish!

LQbOuquC9X9LQzsnH6M1xg.text: Being a native NY'ker,  In and Out burger is something you hear about from west coasters but don't really pay much attention to the hype  mostly because I mean,  its a burger,  how good could it be? And generally,  New Yorkers are a hard to impress species anyway. Well let me just say,  In and Out has certainly lived up to the hype. This is one damn good burger. I recently visited this location in the midst of exorbantly overpriced food and drinks on the Las Vegas strip,  I was able to experience this tasty treasure for all of....$3.41!!! Granted I didn't get fries or a drink,  but this is a pretty filling burger and a steal for under 4 bucks. If you do visit this location,  prepare to stand on a looooong line and wait,  but it moves rather quickly and they have outdoor seating which if the weather is pleasant,  it's nice to enjoy your burger outside people watching. I'm kinda glad they don't have In and Out burger on the east coast,  I don't think my jeans would appreciate it.

photos.caption: Photo of In-N-Out Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. $3.41 for a single cheese...deelish!
Photo of In-N-Out Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Let&#39;s see what all the hype is about

_llHeLvPe-ckbr_fFozcQQ.text: The first time we came here we didn't love it, but this is a great option for late night food.  Would definitely come here again!

XX4q62G14Vp5SCFPNJGfAA.text: This was a must on our last day in Las Vegas being from the east coast.  The restaurant was pretty crowded during lunch time, but the staff was excellent. I've heard so many people talk about this place, but the burger and fries were okay. They feature a very simple menu, so not much to choose from. I doubt I will go again when I return to the west coast, but 4 stars for scratching it off my bucket list of restaurants.

SDV_QeQ6_AvaRkyhg27qMA.text: I wish they would come East!  The secret isn't a secret, other fast food just ignores the obvious.  Fresh ingredients make a better product.  Bun, lettuce, tomato, and onion all fresh and delicious.  Fries fresh cut.  It just makes everything good.  Great burger and fries period.  Cheapest meal on the strip we had.  $9.69 w/ tax.  Two cheeseburgers, one french fries, and two glasses of water.

photos.caption: Photo of In-N-Out Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States

sg-ymrx6fGNktD3OQE2wmw.text: "in-n-out ... in-n-out ... that's what a hamburger's all about !"  The menu is simple : burgers, fries, shakes ... however you want to order it simple or complicated, they'll take care of you.     If I want to be complicated foodie I will order a double single burger extra toasted with extra lettuce and grilled onions cut in half with well done fries with extra spread on the side and strawberry shake (don't judge me) otherwise if I'm being basic ... number 2 with a pink lemonade.  We had tickets to a show at the LINQ so we wanted to grab a quick bite to eat and of course I chose in-n-out.  This location is a bit more expensive then your local in-n-out, but it's expected to be that way because it's the strip.  Also don't be too intimidated by the large crowds, the line moves quite quickly.     I find it from people that either you love in-n-out or you hate it.   I am hands down always a fan.

photos.caption: Photo of In-N-Out Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of In-N-Out Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. menu
Photo of In-N-Out Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. keeping it simple

OEBG5S3DqheXGO_WLoZMRQ.text: This place is in a great location. Like all in n outs- it's rocks a line out the door from open to close. I love a burger with extra chilies. It's spicy and good. It averages about 20 minutes from when you order to that first delicious bite.

AJmRPD7JvR9jaUnPbLnSMg.text: This review truly is not fair as I am a SOCAL girl and will never lose my first True love of all things In-N-Out.  I think the one thing I can write that brought me joy to this aching heart of missing this classic menu is that they now have this location on the strip and we no longer have to travel over the freeway to get a taste.  Love it!! Everything about this visit was on point, organized, efficient and delicious! I mean come on!!

OpVY6okM2zYuFYr8vIIp4g.text: Excited that In-N-Out is now on the strip. Hooray! No more desperate taxi ride when. The line was looooong, but moved pretty quickly. The turnover in the restaurant was quick too so we were able to find a seat fairly easily. As usual, it was a tasty meal for a somewhat decent price. Darn "vegas pricing" gets you every time. But will still come here each time we visit.

photos.caption: Photo of In-N-Out Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Nom nom nom
Photo of In-N-Out Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. A fancy pants box to carry our meal in!

3Vz_KgQsj65f0gY-G6pOUw.text: I know, I know. I should give it 5 stars because it's such an exclusive West coast experience. And I do love it whenever I'm able to have it. But this was sooo disappointing!   First, the fries were cold and hard. How do you expect me to spend calories on cold fries? That's a total waste. Only $7 for a burger, fries and a drink but animal style is $2 more. My burger was good but mostly bread. They serve coke products with DIY free refills but no club soda. What the hell?? Please put a button for just club soda (no syrup).  Also taking off a star because they don't have a bathroom on premise. But the cold, hard fries such a fast paced environment is inexcusable.

photos.caption: Photo of In-N-Out Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of In-N-Out Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Kznb7yvHtRzcN3DFJ1impg.text: I am always a fan of in and out. I miss not having one in my area so this was a must on the stop list. Besides, who doesn't love a fast, tasty burger and fries for cheap?  It is packed, it is Vegas. They have so many employees working that you don't even notice a wait. We still had our food in under 10 mins which is awesome. Everything was tasty and hot with friendly service.   On the outside, there is a little window, blink and you will miss it. It is the "company" store if you want to snag some merch. The gal was super nice.   Love me some In and Out.

ZedCQmNvUoXHRE6DcyQF8Q.text: Some kudos to this location for not being as gougey as they could be. The Strip upcharge is only 25-50 cents for individual items and $1 for combos. You can get out of here with a double-double meal for under 10 bucks.   I'm sure it's a shitshow during usual busy times but if the Strip in general is slow, this place will be too. I visited on a slow weekday at 11 am and hardly anyone was there, no line to order and got my food in about 5 minutes. I've had way worse waits at In-n-Outs in non tourist areas lol. Not having a drive thru here helps with the wait time too, and it's kinda hidden away on the LINQ promenade where it's not convenient to get to unless you're staying at one of the CET properties just north of Flamingo.

pI4_1pMf-3TH9GRh92j33g.text: Grilled cheese burger for vegetarians is the way to go.   Been here twice, service is by far the best service for a burger joint, always busy with a line out the door, weekend or weekday.

c9fHddRELMATGBH9MD_sUw.text: So glad there's an in and out right on the strip! Just this past Vegas trip, we came twice in 4 days.  One night it was midnight, it was busy on a weekday! But line moves really fast.. just a little hard finding a table inside during the day, since it's crazy hot outside.  In and out is still our favorite fast food burger spot, given that my husband is originally from Arcadia CA, maybe he is a bit biased. Haha. However, I do love their burgers, but fries is just average to me. I always ask for their special sauce to dip the fries in or put extra on the burger, and it's free! Free sauce, can make your own animal style fries!  Rideshare from hotel to the linq is super easy now too, it's at the end, by the ferris wheel, where the valet round about is. Last year, it was horrible location, there wasn't reception and you had to go through the linq hotel.  Wish In and Out would open a location in WA.

-sSe6diMw3eLEKJbU1vSDw.text: In-n-out never disappoints and would be hard not to like. In my opinion what makes there burgers is that they properly griddle there buns. There are obviously all sorts of "secret upgrades" and combos that you can add to your meal. Really though what In-n-out is (which I appreciate) is good fast food. You can't beat the price for the location, you and another can be full for under $20 that's a steal in this town. Expect to wait in line for a bit, listen for them to call your number out loud and to stand in close quarters while doing so with hoards of other hungry people. You could argue that it's all part of the experience and that the anticipation of watching those ahead of you get there food makes you subconsciously more satisfied when they call your number. Regardless, expect your food to come out nice and hot and to satisfy your burger fix. As I sat and viciously devoured my double double I noticed staff constantly sweeping and wiping down tables, oh and there very friendly, great to see. This would have been a 5 star review except for the fact that my fries were a little bland and boring and they need more seating to accommodate there volume. Great job guys  see you next time.

EN9Hus3bJPKL7t8ML03Z5g.text: I heard all the hype on the East coast about In-N-Out Burger, so I had to try it myself once I found myself on the West Coast. This location is on the strip, and always busy. I waited around 10 minutes till I ordered my food. The menu is very simple, and for someone visiting this franchise for the first time, I say order the cheese burger. I ordered two Cheeseburgers with onions and a side of fries. The food is cooked fresh, and it tasted deliciously. Please expand to the East Coast, preferably the VA/MD/DC area.

photos.caption: Photo of In-N-Out Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Double double with fries

VGhi_K10GrHfldU3-NEcyg.text: What's the first thing you have to eat when you're on the west coast? In-n-Out!  My bf and I were staying at the LinQ and lucky for us, In n Out was right next to the hotel. As expected the lines can get very long, but that's no surprise considering it's 1 of 2 locations on the Strip (I believe).   As for my opinion of the food, it's very overhyped. I've had better burgers elsewhere. We had the animal style fries and that was really disappointing. It came out lukewarm and just tasted like mayo and cheese splattered over fries... which I guess is what it essentially is but I digress.   My only wish is for this location to be open 24/7. It's on the Strip, after all!

Ky4SyBJXDclkwRMut1HkVw.text: Diego who works the cashier is a wonderful example of excellent customer service.  He works with a smile on his face and a kind attitude.  Thank you Diego for giving me a great experience at In and Out

GZ9vtT7yw_bMEWRyCfu1Iw.text: Been to a few In-N-Out Burger joints and thought I would hit up the first one of the strip.  The food was just like every other In-N-Out that I have been to.  It was good but nothing special.  Service was slow.  I did order cheese fries but that put about 10 people that ordered after me getting their food before me.  Considering that it wasn't like food was flying off the line that was a little much.  Given all the other places in Vegas that I love to eat at not sure that this will be a spot I visit again.  If you have to try In-N-Out either because you are addicted or have never gotten to have it before this isn't a bad option for you since it is walk-able from everywhere on strip.

photos.caption: Photo of In-N-Out Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. double-double and cheese fries

Z7fyPGexT3UMTg3yb9YxzA.text: Second time in Vegas, so second time at an INO location. The first location I went to over two years ago was a little far from the Strip. So I was surprised to see this new-ish location here. But on to the food: delicious! No trip out to the West isn't complete without a stop to INO. Burgers are a perfect size and seasoned very well. Fries are average, but add their signature sauce to it and it'll make a little difference. Long lines may scare some, but it's seriously worth waiting. You will not be disappointed!

photos.caption: Photo of In-N-Out Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. A must try if you&#39;re on the Strip!

219ehEbeDDI9qHr_qgF5dw.text: It was alright! It would have been better if it wouldn't be so up passed, that way maybe they would have taken their time to make it correct or I guess not taste like a drive thru burger that had been sitting there for a good 5 hours.

photos.caption: Photo of In-N-Out Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States

QSrDBjrWa_vn3mSO8jwCbw.text: Stopped by on Tuesday June 18th around 11am. The food was great, the store was clean, the only downside was a couple of guys who looked high acting strange, but security was watching them closely.

P5IrY6NPJCKjG7fZXECa8g.text: I usualy would give 5 stars for ab In N Out but on this one we had to wait to long to get our food. Tgis is a fast food restaurant and we wanted it fast. It wasnt fast. The place is clean and nice.

photos.caption: Photo of In-N-Out Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Great athmosphere to sean outside

-tE7DHARWYEEtRLHyo8Q9g.text: Cheap, yummy, and quick. Perfect meal to have after drinking a couple beers. Service was fast, fries were fresh.

photos.caption: Photo of In-N-Out Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Yummy cheese burger!!!

X5WsMxMMh2MjpqB-GbyvHA.text: Busy busy as usual. This location is in the heart of the strip. There's a line always but it goes quick!   The food is very fresh and the staff is extremely happy and kind it's actually very noticeable. Staff is also always cleaning the tables and floors nonstop. Very impressive!

ar9JwmUkej1fiYQbFPEKvg.text: I know it's busy and all but my double double had burnt things in my burger. Really gross In and Out. Typically all in and out is super clean. Apparently this one is the exception.

photos.caption: Photo of In-N-Out Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Several burnt things inside my burger. Not cool.

uEc4qKVfHguW0n9b0HZ-nw.text: For fast food this place is pretty decent. This was my first In N Out experience. That being said I doubt I'll come back. I'm not much of a fast food eater. I appreciate they use better ingredients than others. I just didn't taste the difference. I prefer thicker fries and my food was pretty cold. I'd go back if my options were limited otherwise I'll keep walking. Not sure what all the hype is about?

p-TBbNVWus_Y5znOsw_0AQ.text: This isn't fine dining, but may help your budget. We'd tried this chain in Arizona and were impressed. Looking for a lighter/cheaper dinner one night we stumble across this shop. Less than $16 with tax for 2 people - 2 burgers done our way, 2 drinks - refillable - 1 fry. Tasted great. Very convenient to the Flamingo Hotel/Casino and the High Roller ferris wheel.

hSM_qOZcdpZu1nFtLWKDXQ.text: We were in Las Vegas from Ohio, so of course as soon as we saw the In-N-Out burger sign, we HAD to have it! It was completely worth the hype. Double double without onions, fries, and a chocolate shake - it was DELICIOUS!

photos.caption: Photo of In-N-Out Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of In-N-Out Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of In-N-Out Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States

O7nlYW5fTcc4UbxN8eM_Nw.text: I'm from NY and this was my second time at an In-N-Out. The first time was in Cali about a year ago. I think it was too hyped up for me because I was expecting it to be amazing. The prices are very fair, but the food itself leaves something to be desired. It's edible, but not completely enjoyable. I got a double cheese burger with animal style fries. The burger is ooook. Both times I've had it, the patty was a bit overcooked and dry. The fries are the let down. They're always cold and a little stale almost. I was hoping the animal sauce would help, but it was also cold and overly salty. Being from NY, there's always comparison between Shake Shack and this place and I'd pay a little more for Shake Shack any day, but if you're looking for quick (if there's not a huge line/wait for seating and cheap, this does the job.

photos.caption: Photo of In-N-Out Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Double cheeseburger and animal fries

OXrMzyW_f9sv0OTI_4ll8A.text: Oh this place is addictive.  I've heard so many good things about In-N-Out burger and kept saying that I wanted to try it when I was near one. We went to the High Roller and as we were walking around the promenade we saw there was one right in front of us.  Bingo!  We were in and on our way to try our first In-N-Out burger.  We each had a cheeseburger animal style.  Fresh and delicious.  I'll be honest I'm not a huge burger person and am a picky eater -- this was easily the best burger I've ever had out.  No wonder people rave about it.  The only thing that pains me to write this review is that there aren't any where I live -- yet.  Please In-N-Out burger, come to the East Coast!

Sk6tR_lhrgZ9PEww8qwxpw.text: This was closest one to our hotel. It was super packed!!! But service was pretty fast and burger was just as remembered from my last time trying it for the first time.

photos.caption: Photo of In-N-Out Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States

8my-hY3Fu072TVbHVRmLaQ.text: Tip: from the strip head onward towards the high roller Ferris wheel it's on the right side by the dancing water fountain.  Great burger, crispy toasty perfect bun, meat was thin but yummy seasoning.  Small menu which is great for the indecisive folks.  Service was friendly (as it's known for) and Christian owned! Thumbs up up up.

photos.caption: Photo of In-N-Out Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States

cRDBO1RcbbJ140AkJ7cxDA.text: Love In-N-Out. Always have to stop at least once when in Las Vegas or California. The location by the High Roller between the Flamingo and Linq is always busy, but super efficient. Animal style is the only way to go and well done in the fries.

photos.caption: Photo of In-N-Out Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cheeseburger, fries and a chocolate shake.

2I2hk9gL14qkJ12aOJeyiA.text: Really good burgers, the fries aren't that good though. If you're in the strip this is going to be one of your cheapest food places to go to. This place will almost always be packed though, so be prepared for that. Only reason I gave it a four star is because I think since it is packed, the workers might be in a hurry and try and rush the food they cooked. We went there twice and the burger was pretty pink on the inside. But overall this is a really good spot. People in the west coast love these burgers and I see why.

photos.caption: Photo of In-N-Out Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States

K2moEXtgcffa6-FLys0YRw.text: FINALLY.  It has arrived on the strip. Before when I'd come to Vegas, I would hop a cab over to the In-n-out to satisfy my craving for the fatty juicy burgers that would be adding greatness to my handles of love. And then, when there was Lyft/Uber, I started ridesharing it to this fine fast food establishment.    Now I can just cross the friggin street to get a double double or two. Yes, I'll have fries with that.    Definitely one of my favorite fast food burgers. So the fries are fresh and crispy, the burger is tender and juicy and the service is top notch. Nice fresh tomato slices and pieces of lettuce to boot.  The employees were so friggin nice I almost felt like I was on the set of Pleasantville. Food came out reasonably fast despite how busy it was. Who am I kidding? Even if it wasn't fast I would've waited to satiate my craving for this old west coast great.

rr7hI0D0V1mGTOHE5HfEsg.text: Hailing from the east coast I had to taste the burger that I have heard about for so long. Pretty chaotic when you walk in, but your attended to quickly at the register. Orders are back to you in minutes. I was particularly impressed with the staff and the way they come over to the table to ensure all was good, and cleaned up our table when we were done. The beef patties are thinner than let's say to a 5 Guys Burger. But delicious nevertheless. This is a prime location - meaning you can grab an In and Out Burger then step outside and get a beer. Very enjoyable - I would return.

SJcMyFYNOCc7g7T52WXoEg.text: Always delicious! Service was so helpful and friendly! Also very well kept. Employees constantly cleaning which is nice to see!

-PNl1miG-zE7Lw8mdfefXA.text: It's official.  In-N-Out Burger is at the LINQ.  This is also our first In-N-Out on the strip. This was news months ago and the predication was that this location is going to be the busiest In-N-Out ever.  I don't know about that.  The Barstow CA and Tropicana NV location is pretty crazy.    The girlfriend alerted me that this In-N-Out grand opened today and I couldn't resist. I've been to every In-N-Out in Las Vegas/Henderson and wasn't missing a chance at this one, especially since it was the middle of the week. I'm assuming that the lines during the weekends will be cray cray.  There was a line when I arrived, but it's In-N-Out and goes by so quick.  I found one seat open and took it.  I don't know if it's temporary due to grand opening week, but my meal was served to me.  I prefer a Double Double, spread only, extra toast, and well done fries.  But on this visit, I kept it Keto style with two Flying Dutchman's (Two Patties/Two Cheese x 2). Of course I had spread added (awesome sauce!!).  Both Flying Dutchman's were too salty for my liking.  In-N-Out is known for throwing a lot of salt on their patties, but mine was a little too much.  I'll give them a pass since they're new.    This is not your typical In-N-Out.  For one, there's obviously no drive thru.  And two, the prices are bumped up a bit.  For example, a Double Double is normally $3.60.  Here it's $4.35.  Two Flying Dutchman's usually cost me $4.76.  With a drink, I spent close to $9.00.  A Double Double Meal aka a Number 1 is about $1.50 more.  You get the point. The upcharge is due to location and rent must be exceptionally high.  I get it, I just don't agree with it.  This location is not going to be crazy, it's going to be Karazy.  I'm sure they'll make enough to cover expenses.  In my opinion, locals should get a discount.   Overall, I'm a huge fan of In-N-Out.  I just don't see myself going out of the way to eat here.  But if I am at the LINQ and in need of a good burger, then you know where to find me.   TIP #1:  Don't forget about the secret menu.  Animal Style!! TIP #2:  This location has a Company Store. It's small but good to know.   TIP#3: Expect tons of tourist here.  It was cool to watch excited customers walking in and out.  I even witnessed a few hi-fives and cheering.  Poor things...we are so privileged out on the west.    2017 In-N-Out Review #4 / 2017 Yelp Review #31 / In-N-Out Visit This Week #3

Photo of In-N-Out Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Two Flying Dutchman&#39;s w/Spread

SaszmAn8VxiYMLvuSyQdpA.text: To preface this review, I had never been to In-n-Out before and I am from the East Coast. So perhaps take my review with a grain of salt because I'm probably biased. Either way, when I found out that Vegas has In-n-Out, I knew I had to try it - if only to further support my argument that Shake Shack is better.   We arrived in Vegas just 2-3 days after the new In-n-Out opened in the LINQ Promenade, so we didn't have to drive out to bumblefuck in order to get it. The line at about 9:30pm was relatively short and we got our burger relatively quickly. We took them back to our rooms since half of us wanted In-n-Out and the other half wanted Shake Shack (In-n-Out's vegetarian option is...to be it frankly, sad).   The fries, first of all, were just disappointing. They're regular fries - but overly salted fries. I dare to say that even McDonald's fries are better! The burger itself wasn't anything spectacular. I got mine Animal Style and it kind of just tasted like a "real" Big Mac. I didn't particularly enjoy it, but I didn't hate it either. My friend from San Francisco has already disowned me.   To be fair, we did eat it after it's been slightly cold. BUT even cold Shake Shack burgers are bomb. Again, I might be biased. Either way, I'd have In-n-Out if it's in the area, but I don't think I'd ever go out of my way to have it again.

J7RAb0DkoAxXZAVHSXug6Q.text: Oh In and Out... The hype surrounding this restaurant in the Midwest is now comical. How do you have fries that suck that bad? The burger was ok, but not better than ANY other fast food joint. People please stop comparing this place to Steak and Shake, it's not even close.

eNncQRouGQknLIrmlLEvyQ.text: This is the most massive in n out I have ever been to. Granted and as expected it took forever to got food. There also wasn't enough seating inside either.   Brilliant location. Delicious In n Out worthy food. They just have some logistics to work out on how to serve the influx of customers.

keGKigPdWKkQ3acZIAdNHQ.text: Coming from the east coast, I was super excited to try out the "best" fast food chain that the west coast had to offer. My west coast friends would constantly rave to me about the juicy cheeseburgers and amazing animal style fries that I had to try. As such, those were the things I ordered. Here's what I found...  Pros - Lines were long but orders came flying out  - Service: Although a fast food chain, workers smiled and someone even came to clean up our plates  - Price: The best part. Two "cheeseburgers" (animal style is free) and animal fries (not free - surcharge of $2) for $11. Not a bad deal to get you full   Cons - Fries were soggy. Even the ones at the bottom not soaked in cheese were soggy :(  - Burger was good but not great. Lettuce and tomatoes were fresh but the patty was very thin. Bun was the saving grace. Maybe getting a 2x2 or 3x3 would've helped.   Overall: The food was definitely better than McDonalds but I'd prefer five guys or even shake shack. Five guys because their fries are much crispier and burgers can be customized with many more toppings. Shake shake while more expensive, has a better beef patty and much better tasting fries. Personally I think this place is overhyped but maybe it's just the one in Vegas. Will give it another shot when I get to California.

photos.caption: Photo of In-N-Out Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Two cheeseburgers and animal style fries

E1V2HmXXJPIKScm70-BE1w.text: It's In N Out, what more can I say.  We are always pleased to find these joints when heading out west since they are nowhere to be found on the East Coast.   We went in around 1115 on a weekday thinking 1. people wouldn't be awake yet, or 2. it was too early for lunch. Boy were we wrong on both accounts. It was packed, but the line moved quickly. Soon it became a "who is quicker" competition for trying to find a table. For the amount of customers they get, they sure need more seating when the weather isn't that nice outside. Luckily we found a table quickly and our food arrived shortly after (maybe 10 minutes or less).  The burgers were delicious with the grilled onions and special sauce. The fries were a bit cold and stale so I think we would have rather gotten bigger burgers and passed on the fries. The milkshake was super thick to drink through a straw. Walking around with it, the consistency thinned out and we were able to enjoy them.   NOTE: There are no bathrooms at this location.  (When walking by later at night it wasn't super crowded, might be better for a cheap dinner if you don't want to wait.)

tB5x3-D5jsmFVG46xA_IOw.text: Yummy yummy! Best burgers and fries! Make sure you get them angry ;) it's off the strip which is good... they're quick, polite, and the food is great and fresh!! This is a must try, especially for tourists.

photos.caption: Photo of In-N-Out Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States

lRrzJZ70QrPK_Wd0HqkSRQ.text: We walk in around lunch time on a Friday and it was packed. We got our order in quickly but it took maybe 25mins to get our order of two double doubles and fries, all animal style. Omg so delicious and worth that wait.  Why don't we have an In N Out in Seattle??

uEYJERILYK5YOyYEV7b_wQ.text: Maybe not as great or as cheap as the locations in California, but still a fantastic burger. I'll bleed In N Out sauce till the day I die.

Sn5IGdXL80j7Og1oZBOvWA.text: A staple to visit no matter where you're from. Coming from a small town where there's only McDonalds and Burger Kings, this place is a wonderful place to eat burgers and fries, which are just the right kind: not too salty, not too bland. The place itself is clean too, and always busy, so therefore if you're looking to sit down and relax like at a cafe, this is probably not the place for you, but you could still pick up some burgers before going on your way. One tip I would say is to ask for some kids stickers; as an older person, and coming here after a long time, I've realized the stickers are probably what made my waiting a lot more manageable. They're also a great tool to keep kids quiet and focused in the already busy place. Very fun to do yourself, may I include. Great food, great place, definitely check it out!

Uad_Hc7EPEJU4FfGYyNG2Q.text: Loved my experience at in-n-out. The line was out the door but I was able to get my food in 20 minutes. I didn't mind waiting because of the long line and it being lunch time. The burgers are very tasty but the fries could be improved. I got them well done and they needed some seasoning.

Eov2MbHuo19S8obj7eA2nw.text: Very crowd but getting through the line to order is fast, and you can get your food within 15 minutes. Finding a table to sit down would be another story unless you're lucky.  The spread is not the same from any other California location, it's more liquid.

ENamXH8j2bDtYQAjXNUDYQ.text: In n out In n out In n out In n out In n out In n out In n out for late night In n out for drunk  people so don't come to this one if you're a first timer with in n out    You're going to get below standards food after 10pm

ScdY6hatabwnWGUMwBwB-A.text: This is one of my stops every time I visit Vegas. Living on the East coast I don't get this at home. I have also hit this chain in Phoenix. The place is new but everything is efficient and pleasant. Your greeted at the door, your order is taken with a greeting and a smile, and your food is made to order hot and fresh! The tables are cleared and cleaned by staff members quickly, so that the next guest can be seated! Definitely recommended if your down in the Linq!

avjJbCGfHW723Ida-NDMfg.text: Overrated, but I'm from the south where food is delicious. It can't touch "Five Guys" but it's okay. I don't know what else to type. I ate it while I was in Vegas.

61jaY0jeEkknWM_06M047g.text: You know I've been a HUGE fan of In n Out burger for YEARS.....been to 15 or so in so cal, both in Reno, the one down the street from The Excalibur in Vegas, and have ALWAYS enjoyed my visit!!! Well....that streak came to a SCREECHING halt when we decided to try the new location in Vegas. They "lost" our order, the food was cold when we finally did get it, and the "animal style", which is usually how I order both my double double, and fries, was HORRIBLE. Just to make this clear, I'm a HUGE fan of In n Out burger, NOT at all a fan of this new location. SAD very very SAD.

BIRFkwlfNWZ8uw0h44r14g.text: Amazing In-N-Out ! So clean and nice and all the staff is wonderful! Probably the best IN-N-Out I have had !! If you are staying near here I definitely recommend stopping in. I got my burger Animal Style and my fries well done !!

9deSj-ln0Pv8-9WhsAi14A.text: I now live on the East Coast and it makes me so sad I can't get this on a regular basis. Every time I travel to the West Coast, I get In n Out!

WftMiUfPKTjYF_u23mLYog.text: The location is packed! Expect a line and be a shark when it comes to grabbing seats! I was excited to try In-N-Out for my first time, as I have had several friends rave about the taste for the price. In my honest opinion, it was good, but not as good as it's all hyped up to be. I would definitely pick it over Burger King or McDonald's, and even Five Guys because of the price, but the taste falls short for me. I wouldn't go out to seek this place, but I will eat it again if I am in the mood for a quick cheeseburger.

mveIl9fNhZcX1kdQ3qBPww.text: Is this place more expensive than other In-N-Out's?  I feel it is.  Either way it's less than $3.50 for a damn cheeseburger!  Lose all your money at Harrah's?  Busker for 5 minutes and grab a burger from here, your day will get better.  I'm still not a fan of the fries but I'll be damned if I don't stop for a burger.  The is always packed but they get through the orders fairly quickly.  I was waiting for sketchiness to happen the couple of times I was here but nope!

BsNlzYVe6usB6_M-ZGC3tw.text: This is a very busy location on the strip but they are quick to take orders and prepare them. It can be difficult to find a place to sit, especially during summer when the outside seating can be too hot.  The food is always fresh and delicious. I highly recommend ordering a neapolitan shake.

DBQhCiK-0Fm-QWYxXBEvaA.text: Brace yourself for an unpopular opinion about In-n-out burger. Maybe it was all the hype, maybe I was still full from the pretzels at Guy Fieri's earlier that day, but I did not love In-n-out burger. I know. Gasp.   I got animal style and fries, and I did like the animal style sauce with the onions but I think I just prefer a thicker, more irregularly shaped burger with grill marks. I wanted more after hearing about it for the past umpteen years from various friends. The fries were good, but I immediately regretted not adding cheese or animal style sauce. My favorite part of the whole meal was the strawberry shake. It was so thick and sweet and made with real ice cream, not some weird milk product.   Service was good, employees were nice, but next time, I'll go to Shake Shack.

rqfgZBao3z7CBKCn83RGEw.text: My gfs and I went to this newish In-N-Out location on our trip to Vegas this past summer. I'm so glad they have this along the Vegas Strip now so we no longer have to travel off the strip for some Animal Style burgers and fries. This restaurant is a decent size with ample seatings but due to it being at a prime spot it also means it's always busy and a challenge to find yourself a table. You have to be patient and watch like a hawk haha.

yeavLV2n-WI-6XB3PSKzQg.text: I finally got a chance to try the burgers here and well I wasn't impressed. I went with someone else who had experienced the burgers in California and they even said it tasted a little different. It was overall a decent burger, but I didn't understand the fuss over it. It was super busy but the line moved pretty quick so that was a plus. Finding a table made me cringe. It was so hard to find a table- to the point that I was ready to just take my food and leave. We almost had to run to get a table, it was ridiculous. I would love to give this place another try in California so that I can have something to compare it to. It was definitely an experience!

DvPGHYr6lQQD8bEbyWhyMQ.text: Talk about keeping it simple. There's a total of 4 options on the menu (burger, cheese burger, double cheese burger, fries). I love that!!! It makes decisions easy and they're good at what they do! I also learned that they have "animal fries" which is basically carmelized onions, American cheese and thousand island dressing.. very good except the way they melt the cheese really dries out the fries once it cools down and it may be too much onion for some people. The burgers are amazing... the meat is delicious and the bun is perfectly toasted. They even wrap it in a wrapper that you can hold and eat at the same time! Love this place!

cBnCERZePNUWw7EkFe6ZrQ.text: Came here a couple of times during my short stay in Vegas and I enjoyed the burgers, fries and the shakes. I do not have one of these where I am from, so I took it in. Good stuff and worth a visit after a few drinks on the strip

It's $6.01 I could have saved and for a cupcake next door at Sprinkles.

1g129OIIv3XAmevyoZA0LQ.text: We are here on an extremely busy Saturday night with the line flowing far past the door and we were literally in n out within 15 minutes with our food and even found a both to eat inside. It was clean, associates were nice and food was fresh!

I ordered the double double with grilled onions with animal style fries because I was told that was the way to do it. The restaurant was somewhat clean and it had a steady stream of customers. The food itself was just like steak and shake and had a lot to be desired. I left pretty disappointed because of all the hoopla. I tried it and unfortunately can get better food at other burger establishments.   I will not return.

We had just eaten so we told each other we had to try it before we left Vegas! The next day, we went to try it. It was good! It's wasn't something I'd go out of my way again for, but it was a simply delicious juicy burger. We both decided in n out is pretty alright! Service was good. Finding seating was a little issue because of the location being in this touristy area. But overall it was a great first experience! Thanks for taking our in n out virginity! (Lol)

5WTgQOqKYwdgUzCz4fYxOw.text: Well worth the hype we went twice which was enough for us l. Not a fan of the fries. The one on the strip more expensive but understandable. Didn't get any to go home with but that was fine. Get animal style it's the better way my husband said he tried both ways.

FF01gqGiGqVmbB6f2V53Rw.text: This is my favorite In-N-Out Burger location in Las Vegas. I like the location in The Linq Promenade. It has a unique and special setting to it. There is a vibe here that you won't find at other locations.

j9zJBlf8NLdpPRVH-yYCkg.text: You can never go wrong with burgers and fries animal style. Having this on the strip right next to linq and flamingo makes it that much better. I do have to say the seating during dinner time is very limited. It's a good idea to take it back to your hotel. We stayed at linq making it easier to take out and eat it back in the room.

tmcXQQ_yKZa66FV1eawA7A.text: Love In-N-Out Burgers sooo much. I'm terribly sad that we still don't have one in Hawaii. I stayed in Vegas for 6 days so my friend and I made sure we went two times before we head back home. This location is awesome! It's literally located in the Linq. The workers were very polite and enthusiastic. It made my experience very warming and inviting. My first time here, we didn't to enjoy our food fresh because we were on the go. Nobody likes cold fries. Second time we came here, it was super busy and my animal style fries and animal style burger was AMAZING!!! It is literally to die for. Can't wait til the next time we come back. I love places that give us great service and even more amazing food!!

mkpKzOjpRgDpFxBQLr35Gw.text: It's a good burger.  It was a short wait for my food even though it was a packed house. I split the burger with my husband and he said that he thought it tasted like Wendy's. I give it a 3 out of 5 stars because the burger could have been a little but bigger meat wise.

photos.caption: Photo of In-N-Out Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. I had to find this place.
Photo of In-N-Out Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. I got fries plain and they were better than I had expected.

x8rcX9iRHUJAohPXEqOhww.text: This place is like Pleasantville, but with burgers and fries. I love it. The fries are ALWAYS hot and crispy but never greasy and, unlike any other fast food fries, they actually taste like real potatoes. I also love that I can order a grilled cheese sandwich here. It comes warm on a toasty bun and the strawberry shakes are sooo good!   I also must add that I am amazed at how every single one of the employees manage to keep a smile on his/her face and take the time to greet each guest and engage in friendly banter, while still taking orders at the speed of light and never getting any orders wrong, even when every single person in the group has an addition or a substitution in their order. Overall great experience!

bSbbqtIHukTj16hqzKIkVQ.text: In n out has never ever let us down. Hands down the best fast food burger in the country. No comparison, period (I'm looking at you Texas. Whataburger is terrible). It always tastes amazing, the people working there are always nice. I have no qualms.

VeHSfFTc1Hmn0uYqsZo1zA.text: This classic burger joint did not disappoint. Located on the strip in Las Vegas it frequents a ton of visitors because of the location. Seating is an issue just because of the popularity of this establishment, however if you can find a seat and enjoy your burger it's well worth it. I had a classic for me and animal fries with a Coke and he did not disappoint.  Now the only reason you I did not give five stars is because of the outside seating is not well attended. There was a sign posted which stated not to feed the birds however, several people totally disregarded which made eating outside quite a challenge with birds flying in and over your food.

photos.caption: Photo of In-N-Out Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Classic burger and animal fries.

2GmEW3C5N4Wi-AXgw7VS-w.text: This was my first ever In-N-Out experience.   There was such a long line and a lot of people in the restaurant, but there were so many workers. I was amazed how many people were working being the counter and cleaning up the restaurant.    It's hard for me to judge the food because I am a vegetarian and don't eat burgers. The fries were okay, they were just whatever fries. My friend got a burger, and she enjoyed that it was cooked medium and said the meat had a great taste.   The only bad thing is when she ordered she asked for a "hamburger, make sure it's not a cheeseburger." Then she got a plain burger on a bun with no condiments, lettuce, or tomatoes. Then she went to the counter to correct it and they gave her a cheeseburger with all the condiments, and it needed to be corrected again. Everyone was very friendly and helpful though.

5dyqDnLRd11iCoXiHqN_kQ.text: Pretty good, got double double with fries and a coke. Delish!! Lives up to its rep. It was very busy and the restaurant was very clean.

yLkugDJOrHtMV6hFutwwFQ.text: The lines can get pretty hectic here, but the customer service handles it well. It may seem very loud from the constant announcing of numbers and customers moving about to find an open table, they handle the large crowd very well. My party of six found a table and got their food quickly. Wish I had one in my area!

photos.caption: Photo of In-N-Out Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States

HuA_OfM-X5narlemt9gj3A.text: This is a great place to go if 1) you want something relatively cheap in Vegas 2) Want a decent amount of food and 3) Want it quick. We were in and out within 5 minutes. Went around 11 on a Saturday. Plus this location is in a newer part of Vegas which to me, is better than the strip. It's a nice little hangout spot with plenty to see, eat and drink.

photos.caption: Photo of In-N-Out Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dank food

dmn8maQc02AJJ0d5ULuJdg.text: We came around 6:45 PM and line up was out the door. It was probably due to the holiday and everyone was in Vegas. I ordered a double double with onions to go. Even though there were a lot of people waiting to order, the cashier didn't rush anything but also repeated my order to confirm they got it right. I really appreciated that. However, the line up for pick up was just ridiculous. It was chaotic: people who just ordered stood in front of the counter even though there was already a line formed. There was absolutely no order here and I literally had to push my way through to get my food.   I enjoyed my double double. The two beef patties tasted great. The amount of the sauce was just right, it didn't make the bun all soggy and a mess to eat. It was definitely better than McDonalds. Other than that, it was nothing special. In-N-Out Burger is a great and cheap option if you are looking for a quick fix. However, that also depends on how bad the line up is, in that case, you might not be "in-n-out" at all.

photos.caption: Photo of In-N-Out Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States

V4RRa6RnzZDACe92m4J0dQ.text: I love the LINQ Promenade. Nice place to walk around. Boyfriend and I ate lunch at this IN N Out Burger (twice). It'll be the cheapest thing you eat in Vegas. Plus, as an east coast gal I have to make it a point to eat here since I'm deprived back home.  The only thing I have to say as a con is that while the service is incredibly fast for considering how many people go through the queue a day, it's also a bit sloppy. I asked for no animal style on my burger yet it still came with it. I ate it anyway because the line was too hectic and not worth it to change. Also, you have to scout and hunt for a table while one person waits for your food. That's the only way to do it. I felt like a vulture the moment someone was cleaning up their trash. I had to pounce!   But that's part of the experience I suppose. Overall delicious burgers at a great price.

photos.caption: Photo of In-N-Out Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Burgers and cheese fries
Photo of In-N-Out Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Exterior View - LINQ Promenade

QOHZeOn83PhDIky8stoGSg.text: I love In-N-Out Burger but this location has some serious issues with their security staff. I was in this Las Vegas location and the security staff kicked us out and refused to let us be served because "In-N-Out is a family establishment". There was nothing offensive in what our party was doing, we were simply waiting in line to order.

z3ooPOM-1CFGXIQq9UDnOw.text: Omg!   When you go here ask for animal fries!   I had onions, cheese, and it was to die for!!!  You have the choice of sitting inside, but if you sit outside you can enjoy the Vegas Strip view. You'll see tourists, bars, cars, and graffiti!!  I've been here 3 times, and each time the line is really long, but it always seems to go by quickly.   I couldn't find a restroom, so it's a secret path out here in there and it'll take about 8 minutes to walk. Wouldn't recommend for elderly.   Would give it 5 stars but the restrooms are really important to us, especially if you're traveling with children or alone.

UWeHkmEDY4_DpylkupMEJA.text: My first In-N-Out experience was definitely a success. Living in NYC, we are deprived of In-N-Out (although we do have Shake Shack) so I had to give it a try to see what the hype is about. The burgers are made to order so you should expect to wait 5-10 minutes for your food. In an attempt to be a little healthier, I ordered a double-double protein style (no-bun). At just under $5, this was well worth it. Good burger, good sauce. I had some of my brother's animal style fries which were quite underwhelming (hence the 4 stars instead of 5). The cheese is just a slice of what seems to be a kraft single melted over the fries with onions and sauce.   Shake Shack over In-N-Out  In-N-Out over Five Guys

MQ5hw0UZDyBbbhjFkdd37w.text: Best burger in the world!!! Everyone that has ever had a In - N - Out Burger knows how good they are ! I got the Double Double it was the best cheese burger I ever had!the meat is so tasty and juicy! And the lettuce and onion so fresh ! You can also have tomatoes. The special sauce they put on there burgers is delicious! You can also get the sauce on the side they serve it in packets it goes great with your fries. There fries are also delicious! Of course they are always busy especially this location but the line goes really quick they take your order then give you a order number on your receipt then you wait until they call your number they are really quick and well worth the wait. Next time I get to Vegas it will be a most have !

photos.caption: Photo of In-N-Out Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of In-N-Out Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Double Double! Best burger in the world!

hh3ByEsNpo8MMjIYOKDm9A.text: Just had to try it, after having seen various locations with vehicles wrapped around the parking lot & out into the street.    I thought it was very tasty.  & Since I have owned & operated restaurants, I especially liked watching their modus operanda & dissecting it to see what makes it tick.  The Formula works.  How the team turned out 70 fresh accurate orders in 25 minutes is a mystery to me.  Kudos to their unique system.  It's obviously a tightly-run ship.    I conversed with the Manager, who was minding the Merchandise Store.  California, 1948 . . . This is the only store that is not freestanding.    As the chain grew, in order to ensure high quality & consistency, the Owners resisted franchising or going public.  Textbook success.    The chain is currently owned by the only Granddaughter of the Founders, who will continue to open new stores, but has no plans to franchise or sell.

photos.caption: Photo of In-N-Out Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of In-N-Out Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of In-N-Out Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States

4_u8nMLMH0a2RhH2dZnc1A.text: Yum! First experience. Great fastfood option. Fries and burger here, can't go wrong!

_QIgfQqc6NuvHYNdEwiQyQ.text: Ah, greatness in simplicity.  When you first walk in, you notice kitchen is open and meticulously clean.  The staff is friendly and smiling.    I went with the #1, animal-style (double cheese burger).  The lettuce and tomato on the burger are cold, crisp, and fresh.  They help contrast the heat and texture of the two beef patties.  The carmelized onions/thousand island dressing add a bit of sweetness to compliment the flavor note.   The fries are shoestring and fresh cut.  They have that homemade taste.  These are my favorite fast food fries.  All in all, In n Out is a great example of how a fast food operation should be ran.  The quality control, pooled with efficiency and simplicity make the experience here great.

photos.caption: Photo of In-N-Out Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. #1, animal-style.
Photo of In-N-Out Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of In-N-Out Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States

rP6xpv2FPq99PoOJtpoF1A.text: UPDATE: Still an awesome burger for less than $10. Fries are still lame, but the Double Double Animal Style more than makes up for it. Love the sauce, the fresh veg, and the toasted mustard bun.

9I2v5yvSNNZaXIyjRRSjZg.text: Love eating In-N-Out Burger. We always go to the one off the strip, so I was glad they finally opened this one. As always, they were extremely busy and extremely fast. The food was fresh as always and the most delicious. Anytime I am on the west coast I make it a point to find a In-N-Out.

zaSH4ssZJWh4LAV61PIncw.text: First time having in and out and I already knew it wasn't going to be better than shake shack but it was still good. The double double was really good but the animal style fries are by far the worst things I've ever had. They were cold, old and just flat. It was honestly disgusting and I couldn't believe they would actually serve that. Please don't come here for the fries. Only the burger. The place was pretty packed even around midnight/1am

BaD7H__X9KN9VO1ryl0V0g.text: Delicious as always. The freshest ingredients at this location! Look at how green that lettuce is and how plump the tomatoes are. Sometimes they are going a little too fast because I ordered to go and they gave me my food as if I were eating there, so minus one star for that.

photos.caption: Photo of In-N-Out Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States

j6dcdb8ELNoAXou6wgm5fw.text: Great burger! It's incredibly busy but the wait isn't too long. You will have to wait if you want to dine in otherwise very enjoyable. My first time on the west coast and I loved the burger. I'll return when I make my next trip here.  I probably take the burger and fries to go next time.

photos.caption: Photo of In-N-Out Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States

tqUzrGMa-E2UUGDAII9h3w.text: So convenient, and they let you bring your beer in as long as you pour it in a plastic cup.  Worth walking to from any hotel on the strip for the best burger ever at the lowest price on the strip.

WkyMcJzzL7O0oOeEaOzrBg.text: Delicious experience as always. Being an East Coaster, I often dream about stuffing down a double double, but cannot so whenever I get the chance, I stop in. The Las Vegas location is no different than any other West Coast location, besides being larger than the average. The staff is super friendly and you can tell they are trying their hardest to move everything along as fast as possible without sacrificing quality.  Docking a star for ordering and food wait time. Not really unique to this location, but it was packed and we were lucky to snag a table (which was dirty). The sign outside says 'no delay' which is misleading as it took us ten minutes to get through the line and another fifteen for our food. I wish the hours were expanded a bit later than 1 AM. I can tell you that this place would see business at any hour of the day if they were open 24 hours, not sure why that isn't a thing since the Starbucks next door can pull it off.  This place is easily the highlight of the LINQ promenade and I cannot wait to go back the next time I visit Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of In-N-Out Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of In-N-Out Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of In-N-Out Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Packed at all hours of the day

zWbXUB4YxhSjbG_R4t-w5w.text: April 2017. The line is super long, but the staff is quick. You should try and snag a table as soon as you order if you plan on staying in. Simple menu so people usually know what they are ordering as soon as they make it to the cashier. We were able to find a table for the three of us not too long after we ordered. However, there are a lot of other customers searching as well, so you have to be quick. Our order took about 10-15 minutes because it was so busy. We were able to save our seats and drink our soda while we waited. We were out walking the Strip that day, so we didn't go for the Animal style like everyone suggested.  The burgers are good as well as the fries. I don't know if it's worth all of the hype, but against other fast food burgers- it is pretty good.

2438r6fOgc1BPURYIS_NvA.text: Always great for a late night Snack! Not much else to say about this place besides if you haven't had it yet your missing out!

3-KYz-e4HbmNrBwUapByOQ.text: Never had In-N-Outs before this and I always wanted to try it due to the hype. After the first bite, I was instantly hooked to In-N-Outs. It's not the best burger I had in my life; however, the value is unbeatable. It's cheap and very good. The ingredient's quality is pretty good too. Eating an Im-N-Out will change your perspective on burgers. Now when will Michigan get an In-N-Out? I would drive over two hours for these kinds of burger.

photos.caption: Photo of In-N-Out Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of In-N-Out Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States

RT4Sqd71rw90gDMS6qMvGg.text: Haven't had In-N-Out too much since I'm from the east coast but it lives up to the hype.  The line here was almost out the door but we got to the front in under 20 minutes.  I've had In-N-Out only a few times before and this was probably the worst one but it's still worth 4 stars.  This just shows you how good this place is.  Get everything animal style, it's worth it.

photos.caption: Photo of In-N-Out Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 4x4 animal style with animal style fries

QBHgoko3m6O1brcRPzkmUQ.text: My third experience with In-N-Out and again, the food is CHEAP for the amount that you get and decent food quality. I ordered just a hamburger with extra lettuce, tomatoes and grilled onions (not animal style, but my personal style) and it came out to about 4$! The burger looked beautiful when it came with all the beautiful toppings peaking through and when I bit into it, the top bun was warm but the bottom was cold. The bun was also a little bit hard and the meat was quite eager compared to Shake Shack. Even so, I was gladly satisfied at this must go West Coast USA joint.

rAQBZfCJ0h-MOVYIZ5nLgA.text: Excellent cost performance!  The more you know the US, the more you believe In-N-Out Burger is the savior. No wonder there is such a long line for burgers!

B45bLYkZGX6dx5Xujlq_5g.text: Great service that was fast and very polite at all times for a location that was always packed with customers. The burgers are first class but the fries could be better. I'd definitely go back again.

uRwKXeus02ZF9ILYwxsy_g.text: Yeah, yeah, yeah I know super overrated! But I wanted to try it for myself and let me just say that this place lives up to the hype. I had a lettuce wrap and it was amazing my husband had the double which was also amazing (my mouth is watering) I wish we had a in-N-out in New York! Only 4 stars bc the line was so damn long and so was the wait for the food but worth it....

photos.caption: Photo of In-N-Out Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States

h5nvDT52E0MKBULfCUcjCA.text: Let's kick back way old school - remember when you couldn't get Coors east of Colorado (yes dating myself) and my Dad would smuggle out a six pack (ON THE PLANE) and we would crack a ice cold beer in the Midwest and swear it was the greatest beer ever -- and now it is just Coors - its okay on a hot day but way way down the list of best beers.  Which begs the question, is my love for In-N-Out just a function of it's relative inaccessibility or its excellent.  Probably a bit of both - as far as the In-N-Out on the Strip (on is also relative - sort of on more precise) goes you don't just get a great burger and fries - the place comes with a show.  By show I don't mean dancing girls (although I am not ruling it out) by show I mean ever single segment of society smushed into a small restaurant - mostly drunk - all hungry - at midnight - hangry for some seared beef perfection.  So there I am - dressed business casual - with multiple shirtless dudes, bachelorettes and whole host of Vegas finest - all congregating peacefully while waiting for our number to be called and shove the Double into our face.  The five star review may not be applicable at ever hour of the day - but at midnight after entertaining clients all day - eating practically nothing - the Double at In-N-Out is one of the greatest things in creation - and you need it Animal Style because of course you do and I don't really even know what Animal Style means.  The patties are cooked perfect - cheese is melty - lettuce and tomato super fresh - bun holds up to the beef and toppings and it is just the best late night meal.  Also went Animal Style on the fries - probs not absolutely necessary but yes on the burger.  As much as I would like to see In-N-Out move east - I think my preference is to maintain the mythical status of the once a year late night calorie explosion in Vegas when I never have to consider it just another burger.

bY5ysr3nQnrczBHFaqkZOg.text: They definitely get you in and out. This location is mobbed all the time. The burgers were thin but tasty with fresh lettuce and whatever that sauce is they put on it. Fresh rolls toasted to perfection. My first time.  Service is friendly. Their menu is limited but good for a quick bite! Double double cheese please!

photos.caption: Photo of In-N-Out Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of In-N-Out Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States

tPQrEBzcDO3IWjadGEITrw.text: Breakdown: Super busy Good service Good location  This was my only In-n-Out Burger experience, but thought I'd give it a second go around for the vacation. The service was very friendly, and accommodating. The place is very clean but seating is hard to find. This place gets quite busy because of its great location, so I suggest taking it to go! The food was okay.

photos.caption: Photo of In-N-Out Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Not the hype everyone makes it out to be.

wdQowWTg-hZFThWpFIUR1Q.text: I'd challenge you to find a more economical option on the strip. Double cheeseburger was $4 and delicious. This was our first time ever at this chain as we don't have them in any of the places we have lived. Ordering went quick. Had to wait a few minutes for the order. Fountain machines are in the dining area and refills are free (and definitely the cheapest fountain soda I could find at under $2!). Coke products-yay!!!  Located at the back of the string of shops by the High Roller at the Linq. It's a really neat area with lots to do and see.

f2SKsTOA8FauMuvMBc6wBA.text: This location was super busy, although I'm sure they all are! This was my first In-N-Out Burger experience and I really enjoyed it. We waited about 20/30 minutes for our food but there were no seats inside. We tried to sit outside but there was no shade and the seats were too hot from the sun. I recommend trying to find a table when you first get in. We ended up just walking around with our food, but it was still good!

photos.caption: Photo of In-N-Out Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States

MWUfgEYXjbQTXhw5RtZroQ.text: The burger was awesome! The fries were meh, taste like cardboard. I would definitely come back for the the burger.

PcjOjg1hd3ry_WhjGiCI5A.text: Pretty sure I am the exception to the In-n-Out craze. Everyone for years has been touting this chain as the best of the best.   After stopping for lunch at this location I got the following:   *Stale bun falling apart *Mediocre dry burger  *Inconsistency with secret menu ordering -- they f-ed up their own item.  *Sad-ass, stale fries   Maybe it's because I'm from a state where burgers are a 8th level to the nutrition pyramid, but these burgers were absolutely not worth the hype. The experience was almost on-par to McDonald's, but worse.   Yep, this goes under the big ol' book of fails.   You'll be fighting for seating during peak hours, but the staff was pretty nice and on it, which is why I'm adding a star to the experience.   Nope, nope and more nope.   Don't settle for the hype, people. Stop lying to yourself.

qObpPPFsJ85qpN60tPQCHw.text: Coming from the East Coast, visiting an In-N-Out Burger is quite the treat. When in California and Arizona, I'm there. AND...... whenever we go to Vegas, our first stop off the plane is to....you guessed it. They are quite packed in Vegas so we always have a Plan B and Plan C location to fall back on. Imagine my amazement when I found out that this burger haven now has a location right off the Vegas Strip. It is officially listed as at The Linq, but is right around the corner from The Flamingo Hotel in the alleyway leading to the Giant Ferris Wheel. Now we were able to walk there after checking into our hotel. As with other locations, the crowd was plentiful but the young staff was quite efficient in filling the orders and getting the food in your hands in a reasonable time. My wife in the meantime secured a nice table outside. So, that's where the good review ends with the pleasant and efficient staff. They get the one star that I have awarded. As for the food......my love of all In-N-Outs has come crashing down to earth. I ordered my usual Double-Double and Fries. The burger which is usually juicy, was cooked beyond recognition. It was horribly overdone and I actually threw it out after eating half of it. My wife's was the same. Now, they can't also screw up the freshly made Fries, can they? Yes they can and they did! These Fries were so overdone, charred and dried out that they were like those dry straws you buy in a bag or can. How can they mess up what every other location has brilliantly delivered? I hope I'm not scarred for life, but for sure will never visit this location again. Hopefully it was an off day, but I won't be around to find out. Back to Plan B & C.

photos.caption: Photo of In-N-Out Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. View across the alleyway
Photo of In-N-Out Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Entrance

dJ9baB5C7M24aJIuppU9ng.text: Good inexpensive place to eat in the middle of overpriced Vegas. Was busy but did not take too long to get food.

yghj9VtQS0fmBURDsbNpgA.text: Stayed at the Linq hotel and found this In-N-Out within the shopping center outside. The location itself is quite small inside. The menu is the same as any other In-N-Out but the pricing is definitely more expensive. I ordered a cheeseburger with grilled onions and French fries. When waiting for my order, we attempted to find seating and there was none available. The wait time to receive our food was quite long because they were very busy. Eventually other guests left and we were finally able to find seating after about 15-20 min.   Once we received our food, it wasn't up to the normal In-N-Out standard I'm used to in CA. The buns seemed a little dry and would crumble a little when you would hold it. The French fries were definitely a disappointment. They were so salty we couldn't really finish them.   Because we were so hungry, the food did its job but overall I probably won't come to this location again.

IBSOiec5l5XInQKwVA28eQ.text: Sorry I just don't get some of the hype here. The burgers are meh. I like a meaty juicy burger and not these well done drier patties. Fries especially suck. I get that they are all about freshness but taste and texture is important to me too. For a fresh concept fast food burger, I would rather go for Shake Shack or Five Guys, which is much juicier and flavorful.  Still, my preference for an awesome burger is one that uses some fattier cuts of well seasoned meat and can be cooked to a juicy medium rare.

E7oE36cpl813PXA182e6IQ.text: This place is CROWDED but they're a machine! They somehow take your order and leave you waiting much less time than you'd expect for your food. The food is the usual fare and what seem to be close to normal prices. It was a nice night so we just got our food and ate outside, the seating area is pretty big but I'm sure it gets packed at times. Forget all those overpriced mediocre strip places, if you want the best quick cheap meal on the strip come here and you won't be disappointed. Maybe they'll eventually be open 24 hours?

photos.caption: Photo of In-N-Out Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Outside patio
Photo of In-N-Out Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sign out front

Bn-CyMX3PM1WVVKj3FqvvQ.text: Iconic burger and fun location. We were not terribly hungry, so we decided to get a little something-something. There was a line out the door even though there were several other restaurants around. The line moved quickly, and since there were only certain things to order we had our food in no time. The burgers were delicious. The bun was toasted and the toppings were fresh. The fries were good but I like more skin on mine. It was a great place to eat our first night in Vegas.

gUNE9Ie7ky-ll1pX-zlEDA.text: No trip to the west coast is complete without a trip here. I mean you have too. Delicious , mouth watering so good its hard to have just one kinda burger place.  Animal fries here are good too even though I passed on it this visit. The line is long but it goes quick.   Also dont be confused or get upset when they call the numbers out of order it happens so relax you will sinking your teeth into a burger in no time.  Its vegas so swing by fat tuesday or Margerittaville  ( pick your poison ) grab a drink before coming here and grab a table outside once you have your order.   Enjoy.

photos.caption: Photo of In-N-Out Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The reward after standing in line.
Photo of In-N-Out Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Your entrance way into the halls of burger legend.

cyXwR8GTPImzH-jHqZBhhw.text: Its not Whataburger but its fresh. I reommend animal style afterall you're eating a burger its not like you're on a diet.

b7rUHfsf4Fx_U-xuoi8o6g.text: If you crave fast food this is the one. Not MacDonalds or Burger King! Each patty is juicy and flavourful served on soft bun and with a large portion of fries in the side. I prefer the outlet in San Francisco to this Vegas one though

photos.caption: Photo of In-N-Out Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States

zMMrtW-m57y_XplFDQ94Og.text: I was a little worried that a restaurant off the Strip would be chaotic, but In-N-Out was a critical stop. Luckily, we were pleasantly surprised, and this spot was quite efficient and handled the crowds well.   Not only was the food spot on - delicious tasting and traditionally priced - but this location was also great for people watching. If you catch my drift.   Animal style all the way, my friends.

bO2SlZRgKIwER9M8CjsjLg.text: After pining for In-N-Out for months (I live on the east coast) I was so excited for my In-N-Out experience. I hate to say I was disappointed. We waited a very long time for our food. They called all the numbers around us, but not our number. Eventually I went to the counter to ask about my food- it had been sitting there the whole time and they never called our number! My burger and fries were cold as a result. The burger party itself was small and had too much sauce (I ordered it animal style) I'm not sure I'll go back on my next west coast trip.

h6-09Y4LXphgJ-nJkrByuQ.text: People who live near an In-N-Out must be over it, but for us who don't and traveling to one... this is a must. Reasonably priced and good service. However this location is really since it's within the strip. But all locations are great. Not just this one.

RQmVjKAu0nm3Ao6fUUiVtg.text: My wife and I came to Vegas last week and top of my list of places to eat was in-n-out. I'd read all the great reviews online and seen YouTube videos of people proclaiming their love of the best burgers and fries ever, we ordered the double cheeseburgers, animal style fries and chocolate shakes. What happened next was both surprising and heartbreaking, it SUCKED. The fries and the blandest fries I've ever had, I can see why people put all the sauce and cheese on them otherwise it's like eating cardboard. The burger was average at best, I'd rate 5 guys, fat burger, McDonald's etc way above it. We ate maybe 10 fries each and half the burgers and binned the rest. Obviously people and just drinking the in-n-out cool aid and believing all the hype because this is nowhere near all it's cracked up to be. The only reason I didn't give it a 1 star review was because the staff are all very friendly and it's actually a nice restaurant inside.

photos.caption: Photo of In-N-Out Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of In-N-Out Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of In-N-Out Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States

vflzKmJ5nNOlrC838dNxZw.text: Exceptional burger at great price. You know you are in a quality restaurant when there's a long queue and especially when there's only 4 burger options. This means that they do not mess with the recipe and master their craft in a few!

photos.caption: Photo of In-N-Out Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States

f3tFSmA4f2nznmN2k-Fw_A.text: The fries are really good and the burgers are average. Don't get me wrong, it's better than McDonalds, but there is so much hype around it I guess I expected to much. It is above average for fast food and everybody should check it out once
